loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo, Isabela. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Shirley joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font essentiellement la vente de pagnes et  de tissus tel avec KADIA K.
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 balles de tissus au grand marché  de Sikasso auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au marché de  Sikasso et à domicile au comptant,  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of this DANAYA group are mostly married women with an average age of 37 and 3 children, on average. Most of them live in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They are on their eighth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, aiming to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their preceding loans were repaid correctly. They mostly sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth used for clothing) and other fabrics, as does Kadia K.. 

With her new loan, she is intending to buy 15 bales of cloth from wholesalers in the big marketplace in Sikasso. She resells them in the market in Sikasso and out of her home, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of  42.500 FCFA, part of which she will put aside as savings and for family necessities, investing the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie S. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Winnie has a salon business, which she has run for three years. She also has an outdoor catering business.
To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase oil and braids for the hair. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build a house.
Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase oil and braids for the hair

loans.name: Anne Nakuti

texts.en:
Anne Nakuti N. is a young woman of twenty six years.  She is married to Bruce Ngowo and together they have two children.  They all live in Milimani in Kitale town. Anne does taxi business in Kitale town and she has hired someone to drive it for her.  She gets a monthly income of KES.25,000 and has been in taxi business for four years now however she wants to diversify and open a food shop in Kitale.

This will be Anne's first loan from  KADET LTD.  With the loan she wants to diversify from her taxi business and start a food shop.  She will use the entire loan to open a food shop in Kitale.

With the income that she will get she plans to plough it back to the food shop business. In the future she wants to educate her children to the highest level, and also wants to become a prominent business lady.

loans.use: To buy food like cooking fat, baking flour rice etc

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo de 37 años, empezó el negocio de venta de legumbres en su casa pero como las personas del sector no le pagaban puntual el decidió recorrer las calles de la Perimetral para tener más clientela. 

En la actualidad vende en compañía de su esposa verduras desde las 10h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Tienes muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus 4 hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda y así que sus hijos estén mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Segundo, who is 37 years old, began his business by selling vegetables from his home.  However, because the people in his area didn't pay him on time, he decided to sell on the streets of Perimetral to gain more customers. 

Currently, Segundo makes his sales together with wife.  They sell vegetables from 10:00am until 5:00pm.  He has many aspiriations for his business, and that is why he wants to contiue working.  He also wants to give his 4 children a good life.  With this loan, he wants to purchase construction maierials to improve his home so that his children will be more comfortable.

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Alex Geovanny

texts.es:
Alex de 34 años, comenzó su papelería con una vitrina vendiendo hojas por unidad. Ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación para tener una papelería surtida. Trabaja con ayuda de su mama todos los días atendiendo la papelería.  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería para su local. En el futuro quiere incrementa la mercadería de su local y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alex, age 34, started a stationery shop with a display cabinet from which he sells paper by the sheet. He works with effort and dedication to keep his business stocked. Alex has the help of his mother and they both manage the stationery shop every day.

He has many aspirations for his business, so he wants to use this loan to buy stationery for his store. In the future, he wants to increase the inventory in his shop and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: To purchase stationery.

loans.name: Ximena Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Ximena Álvarez es socia del banco comunal Virgen de Bronce, vive por el sector de la Convención del 45 en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene muchos lugares turísticos y su gente es amable, cordial, muy culta y llena de tradiciones.

Doña Ximena tiene 35 años, es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad quien estudia en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña. Ximena es profesora de una escuela en donde es Psicóloga Clínica, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio día.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de material didactico como juegos de rompecabezas, imagenes, folletos, etc. para sus alumnos.

Su meta es tener un Centro Educativo propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ximena Álvarez is a member of the “Virgen de Bronce” communal bank.  She lives around the Convención del 45 neighborhood in the city of Cuenca.  This city is bathed by four rivers and is named Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.  It has many tourist attractions and its residents are kind, cordial, very cultured and filled with tradition.

Ximena is 35 years old, divorced and she has a 15-year-old son who goes to school in Cuenca.  She does not own her house; she rents.

Ximena is a Teacher at a school where she is a Clinical Psychologist.  She’s been in this line of work for 10 years and works half days Monday through Friday.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for a year and will use the loan to buy teaching aids like jigsaw puzzles, prints, pamphlets, etc. for her students.

Her goal is to own an educational center.

loans.use: to buy teaching aids like jigsaw puzzles, prints, pamphlets, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: Manuel tiene 65 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa e hijo en casa propia en el distrito de San José. Esta ciudad está ubicada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Manuel gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Lleva más de tres años realizando esta actividad en su domicilio. Su esposa lo ayuda en su negocio. Desea comprar más animales menores y alimento balanceado con la finalidad de generar más ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: Manuel is 65 years old. He lives with his wife and son in their own home in the district of San José. This city is located in the province of Pacasmayo, uan area with a lot of comercial activty located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital Lambayeque region. Manuel makes his living raising and selling small animals. When his animals have reached a good point of development, he offers them for sale to dealers who visit the area. He has been doing this activity for more than three years, from his house. His wife helps him with the business. He wants to buy more small animals and balanced feed in order to generate more income and improve his family's quality of life. For this, he decided to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Annet lives in a rented home without access to electricity or running water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. For the past ten years, Annet has run a food stall. She works six days out of every week selling products wholesale from her home.

Annet is requesting a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy to buy more bags of cassava and sweet potatoes. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Annet’s goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and cassava to sell

loans.name: José Higinio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Higinio le esta haciendo falta el techo del patio al frente de su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, madera, varilla y pagarle a la persona que contratara para realizar la mejora, desea que sea lo concreto ya que es más segura y duradera. 
Planea pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carretea. Que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que su esposa la señora Blanca Estela se encarga del cuidado de los hijos y de la casa.
texts.en: The house belonging to Jose Higinio does not have a roof over the front patio but he doesn't have the funds that he needs to carry out this improvement. He requests a loan to purchase material, such as cement, wood, steel rods, and to hire a contractor for the project. He wants it to be made of concrete because it is safer and longer lasting. He plans on paying the loan with a part of the salary he earns from his work as a transport truck driver. This is the source of income for his family. His wife, Blanca Estela, takes care of the children and the house.

loans.use: to build a roof over the front patio.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en: Sareoun, 35, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantation. Sareoun is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.4 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband purchases mango stock to resell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 60 on the other necessary expenses. Sareoun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cashew nuts and peanuts in stock to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts and peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Sayohatkhon

texts.en:
Sayohatkhon is a hard-working woman and the mother of one child. She in engaged in tailoring. Sayohatkhon sews blinds and dresses that she hands out to her relatives to sell at the market. Sayohatkhon has been running this business for 11 years. Once a week she purchases fabrics and sews blinds and dresses at home. She would like a loan of 7,500 TJS to purchase fabrics and expand her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabrics and expand her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 31 years old, married and supports a family of six. She has been in the farming business for the last eight years, with a monthly income of KES 4,000. Caroline plans to use her fourth loan of KES 22,000 from KADET to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer for her family farm. This will help in increasing her farm production. Caroline's future plans are to expand her farm business and raise school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mirbala

texts.en:
Mirbala is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. Mirbala is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs, including sweets, soft drinks, and juice, in the grocery store that he rents. Mirbala is not alone in this business; his entire family actively helps him with the sales.

Mirbala has previously received financial help through AqroInvest Credit Union. The financial assistance he has received has helped him expand his business. Currently, Mirbala's gross income is about 500 USD, and his monthly net profit is about 300 USD.

Mirbala needs a loan of 1500 AZN to be able to increase the stock of goods in his store. He is ready to work hard and to make sacrifices to become an even more successful entrepreneur. Mirbala's perseverance and clear vision will help him succeed in his small business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase the stock of goods in his store.

loans.name: Idolina

texts.es:
La señora idolina es casada con el señor Flavio y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad  y son: Fabio de Jesús de veintidós años de edad y Fernando Rubiel de seis años de edad.
    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra material  como  son: hilos, agujas, hilos de  estambres para elaborar, manteles, sobre bufandas, tapetes, en donde lleva ocho meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado en su pequeña actividad.
    Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su  familia quienes es  lo mas importante para ella, darle lo mas necesario para que sigan delante aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el campo y así juntos salir adelante como familia.
    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda mejorar su estado económico, para seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando  y logren terminar una carera.
texts.en:
Idolina is married to Flavio.  They have two children still in their care: Fabio de Jesús, 22, and Fernando Rubiel, 6.

She is a housewife and requested the loan to buy supplies like: thread, needles, yarn, tablecloths, scarves, mats.  She’s been in business 8 months and comments that she does well because she’s had good results from her small business.

Her family who are the most important thing for her motivated her to go into this activity.  She wanted to provide them with the best so that they can go forward even though she has support from her husband who works in the fields and this way they can continue making progress as a family.

What she wants with this small business is to improve her economic situation to continue supporting her children so that they can stay in school and complete a career.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Bernardo Jose

texts.es: Este cliente es originario   de la comunidad  La Quimera y Siempre se ha dedicado ha la agricultura desde que estaba con sus padres y posterior ya cuando se caso continuo con esta misma lbor con el apollo de su esposa ya que ella ha trabajado como domestica y le ha apoyado económicamente como también el apollo de sus hijos y con estas dos cosas de ellos formaron ha sus hijos tanto académicamente  y también como han sido bien unidos compraron donde viven con los excedentes de agricultura mercedes y tiene 14 años de vender servicio de acarreo comercial y tiene 8 crédito con la empresa los cuales le han servido para compra del camión y  darle el mantenimiento del vehículo y  compra de llanta para brindar mejor el servicio  de acarreo también menciono que estos créditos le han servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también ha venido preparando académicamente a sus hijos y a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con las ganancia obtenidas
texts.en: He is originally from the community of La Quimera and he has always worked in agriculture. He started out with his parents and later continued in the field when he married. He continues on in this work with his wife's support. She has been working as a janitor and she has also been contributing financially in the support of their children. With these two sources of income they managed to support their children academically and they have also been able to work together to buy the house where they live. They did so with the profits from their agricultural work. He has 14 years' experience in commercial transportation and he has had 8 previous loans with the organization. They have helped him to purchase his truck and to carry out maintenance repairs to the vehicle, including the purchase of new tires. He has been able to improve the service he provides in commercial transportation. He also mentioned that these loans have helped him to improve his living conditions. He has been able to keep his children in school and to improve the conditions of his house with the profits he earned.

loans.use: to prepare his farm land to plant corn. He will purchase urea, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Elsa has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy breads & biscuits for resale. 

Elsa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads & biscuits for resale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene años 42 de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 26, 15 y 11 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos pudo seguir adelante en su negocio y con esto poder sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es padre y madre a la vez.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y productos naturales de varias marcas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque ya tiene varios clientes que siempre le compran sus productos sobretodo los naturales, trabaja de lunes a viernes  en las mañanas y en las noches ya que de mañana están sus hijos en la escuela y en la noche están en casa sus clientes. Lleva cinco años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar productos naturales y sabanas.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years past as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix Bird) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met María, 42, here.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 26, 15 and 11 years of age.  The two youngest go to secondary school and elementary school.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because thanks to the loans she’s been able to stay in business and through it was able to raise her children since she’s both father and mother at the same time.

Our friend’s a merchant selling sheets and natural products of different brands.  She sells door to door although she has several customers that always buy her products, especially the natural ones.  She works Monday through Friday both mornings and evenings because in the morning her children are at school and at evening her customers are home.  She’s been in this line of work that she’s raised her children with for five years.

She will use this loan to buy natural products and sheets.  Her dream is to see her children become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy natural products and sheets.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 65 years old, married and has eight children with whom he lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to become a role model as a farmer as well as completing his family house. John is a commercial tea farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for the past twenty years. His major challenge is hailstorms which destroy his tea. His dream is to own at least 100 acres of tea as he currently has only 20 acres. John needs the loan to pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.use: To pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 54-year-old man. He is married and his wife is a teacher. 

He works as a driver for his own motorcycle transport business.  Rodrigo wants a loan so be can change the chain on his motorcycle and buy gasoline so it will operate more efficiently.  

He hopes this will increase his family's income.  Rodrigo wants to give his children better living conditions and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy new chain and gasoline for his transportation business

loans.name: Maria Victorina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Victorina es casada, tiene 33 años D. edad, cursó los 6 años D. educación primaria, tiene 7 hijos 5 D. los cuales estudian, ella se dedica a la tejeduría, lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción D. vivienda.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizar para sufragar los gastos D. estudios D. su hijos y una D. sus hijas, ya la hija D. ella se esta graduando este año, por lo que espera mejores su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
María Victorina is married.  She’s 33 years old.  She completed six years of elementary education.  She has seven children, five of whom are in school.  She’s a weaver and has 10 years’ experience.  She has her husband’s support who works in home construction.

She’s asking for a loan to cover education costs for her sons and a one of her daughters.  Her daughter will be graduating this year so she’s hoping for improvements in her living condition.

loans.use: to cover school costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Miflinmahou Group

texts.fr: MIFLINMAHOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Thérèse (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans. Thérèse est mariée à un maçon du nom de Yacoubou. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Thérèse vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Thérèse n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Thérèse vend depuis trois ans, des gâteaux (faits à base de la farine de blé) de façon ambulante. Thérèse s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Thérèse sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIFLINMAHOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MIFLINMAHOU is a group of three persons who all live in the same district in Bénin. The representative of the group, Thérèse (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 33. She is married to a mason named Yacoubou. The couple has one child, enrolled in school and in their care. 

Thérèse lives together with her husband and child. The couple share in supporting the household. Thérèse did not attend school. In order to support herself, Thérèse has for three years been selling cakes (made out of wheat flour) door-to-door. She buys her ingredients in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and also to grow her working capital and strengthen her business, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group called MIFLINMAHOU. This loan will allow them to respond better to the needs of their clientele and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of wheat flour and tins of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Konwendsida Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELIANE JOSEPHE  est la représentante du groupe KONWENDSIDA. Elle est célibataire et mère de 01 enfant. Il a 04ans et fait la maternelle. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle fait la pédicure manucure et vend des mèches  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de secteur 10 .Ses clients sont les femmes et les  filles.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02 douzaines de mèche, 01 douzaine de vernis à ongle et un paquet d’ongles artificiels.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle s’occupe de sa petite famille. Elle rêve  devenir une grande commerçante et faire des voyages sur Doubaï et la Chine.
texts.en:
Mrs ELIANE JOSEPHE is KONWENDSIDA Group's representative. She's single and the mother of one child, who is 4 years old and goes to kindergarten. She has one person to support.

For three years, she's been providing pedicure and manicure services, and selling hair extensions. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and girls.

She wants to buy two dozen hair extensions, one dozen units of nail varnish, and one pack of false nails. With her profits, she takes care of her little family. She dreams of becoming a big merchant and traveling to Dubai and China.

loans.use: to buy two dozen hair extensions, one dozen units of nail varnish, and one pack of false nails

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Rose  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rose est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Rose  n’a jamais fréquenté. Rose est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Romain. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre restent  à leur charge. Rose vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux charges de la famille, Rose vend depuis sept ans, des chaussures dans un quartier du Bénin. Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Rose sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The NONVIGNON group is made up of three people who live in the same area. It's the third time that the group is asking for financial support from Alidé, in order to elevate their activity level. The representative of the group, named Rose, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Rose is forty-three years old and lives in Benin. Rose never attended school. Rose is married to a retailer named Romain. The couple has five children, all in school, of which four are in their care. Rose lives with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the expenses of their family together. In order to contribute to the family's expenses, Rose has sold shoes in an area of Benin for seven years. Rose stocks up in a market in Benin. In the mission of satisfying her customers and to increase her turnover and profit, Rose is asking together with the other members of the NONVIGNON group for a third loan from Alidé. The first two loans were completely repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of shoes.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: Clemente has been a rice farmer for fifteen years, and he usually earns PHP 26,000 per season. He is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. Clemente is married to Marcelina, who helps him manage their family rice field. He says that the income generated from his business has enabled him to provide for their household. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested in order to support further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sonia Hermocina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Lovon es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 3 hijos pequeños, el menor de ellos tiene 6 años y sus hermanitos tienen entre 10 y 14. Sonia Vive y trabaja en Camaná, ubicada en el sur del Perú, un oasis extenso y seco ubicado en el desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas. El micro financiamiento permite a las personas, que no tienen muchos recursos y cuentan con un pequeño negocio, tener una oportunidad como negociante en el mercado laboral.

Ella es una mujer perseverante, luchadora y empeñosa en querer progresar cada día más y fue por así como se le ocurrió incursionar en este negocio, a partir del año 2010 ella se está dedicando a alquilar servicios higiénicos, esta actividad le permite ganar aproximadamente S/. 42 diariamente.

Con el préstamo de S/.2, 120 que recibirá gracias a Kiva, Sonia podrá comprar la computadora que necesitan sus hijos para poder hacer todas sus tareas en casa sin la necesidad de que diariamente acudan a cabinas de internet, esto también ayudará a que Sonia se sienta más tranquila sabiendo que sus hijitos se encuentran seguros en su casa. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecer más servicios con la finalidad de lograr, en unos años más, techar por completo su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia Lovon is a hard-working woman with 3 young children.  The youngest is only 6-years old and [his/her--not clear] [brothers/sisters--not clear] are 10- and 14-years old, respectively.  Sonia lives and works in Camana, a city in southern Peru.  Camana is in a large, dry oasis of the Sechura desert, a desert that dominates the coast in the southeast of the country.  Camana has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru, but the frequent earthquakes and tsunamis of the last decade (an earthquake of 8.4 in 2001 and another of 8.0 in 2007) have seriously damaged the city and destroyed local tourism.  The consequence has been grave, costing many jobs and with them, the only means many local people have for supporting their families.  Unemployment has forced many people to look for other means to make a living and microlending has helped.  Microlending allows people with few resources to develop and grow small businesses.  

Sonia is a hard-working woman who gets up every morning determined to become a little better off than she was the day before.  That's why she started a business in 2010, providing leased hygiene services, a business that now generates around S/.42 [new soles] a day.

With the loan of S/2,120 [new soles] that she will receive thanks to Kiva, Sonia will be able to buy a computer for her children.  She wants the computer so that her children can do their schoolwork at home.  They have to leave home now to go to a place where they can access the Internet and Sonia would feel easier if she could watch over them at home.  Her long-term goal is to expand her business and provide more services so that she can, in a few years, pay for improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's schooling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 28-year-old man. He is married to Moraa and they have one child, but they support three other children.

For five years he has been in the art-selling business, from which he earns a monthly income of approximately 80,000 KES. He is applying for his second loan through KADET LTD, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES. He explains that he promptly and successfully repaid the previous loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more artwork for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional artwork.

loans.name: Godeffroy Edgar

texts.fr: Agé de 39ans, Godeffroy est marié et père de trois enfants. Il est spécialisé dans la fabrication et la vente des savons de dentition à Cocotomey. Pour l'écoulement des savons, le client fait des dépôts au niveau des pharmacies, les supers marchés et d'autres points de vente. Dans le but de répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, il fait  recours au financement de Finadev afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de contribuer activement aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Godeffroy is married and has three children. He specializes in making and selling soap in Cocotomey. To distribute the soap, he takes it to pharmacies, supermarkets and sales outlets. 

In order to meet client demand, he is asking Finadev for a loan so he can increase his working capital and contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: buy 3 batches of oil and other items.

loans.name: Josias

texts.es: Josías, de 73 años es un hombre divorciado vive en su propia casa junto a sus 05 hijos a quienes le brinda apoyo y sobre todo mucha dedicación. Josías a pesar de su edad es un hombre con muchas fueras de seguir trabajando desde  muy joven a trabajar como ayudante en distintas tiendas comerciales, sus proyecciones era tener su propia tienda comercial su deseo se hizo realidad desde que empezó a ahorrar sus salarios y desde hace 45 años viene trabajando de forma independiente. Hoy, con una sonrisa despejada siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Gracias al préstamo solicitado llevará acabo uno de sus planes, ampliar su espacio de ventas y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Este es crédito numero 11 con MFP, esta muy contento de poder trabajar con los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo financiero va progresando. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; incrementará productos para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Josías is 73 years old. He is divorced and lives in his own house along with his 5 children, to whom he provides support and, above all, his dedication. Josías, despite his age, is a man with a lot of strength to continue working. From the time he was very young he worked as an assistant in several stores. His plan was to have his own store. His dream became a reality because he saved his salary and 45 years ago he began working independently. Now, with a content smile, he feels that he has achieved one of his first goals, which is bringing about good economic results because of the good quality and variety of products he offers to his customers. Thanks to the loan he has requested, he will carry out one of his plans, which is to expand so that he can offer a larger variety of products of daily use. This is his 11th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He is very content to work with the lenders because it is thanks to their financial support that he is making progress. With the 1,000.00 nuevos soles (PEN) he will increase the products in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: Ramón Asencio de sesenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y además obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y está cercano a su residencia, comercia en todas los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es único siempre está a la orden  de los clientes; Ramón es un hombre visionario, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presenten sabe que así encontrara el camino al éxito, desde hace algún tiempo quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee del suficiente capital para invertir en los insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Ramón Asencio tiene buena referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura pagará la deuda  y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, herbicida, herramienta

loans.name: Nhóm 22-Thôn 01-Quảng Nhân-Quảng Xương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình Trần works in agriculture, raising pigs and poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Bình Trần is 55 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 22-Thôn 01-Quảng Nhân-Quảng Xương solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2011, Bình Trần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình Trần has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bình Trần has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bình Trần hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell the in future.

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.ru:
Хакимчон молодой мужчина в возрасте 23 лет. Он веселый, добрый и приятный в общении. Если вдруг вы окажитесь случайно в районе Чоми, то обязательно должны познакомиться с Хокимчоном. Он покажет все достопримечательности и никогда в беде не бросит. 
   Хокимчон из-за финансового положения семьи не смог получить образование и пошел по стопам родителей и стал дехканином. Он иногда жалеет, что не смог получить высшее образование, но и работа на земле его не расстраивает. Хокимчон имеет не большую землю, где сажает цветную капусту. Каждый раз он радуется, когда получает хороший урожай. 
  На данный момент Хокимчон намерен собрать урожай и купить минеральные удобрения. Он будет нетерпением ждать снова сбора урожая.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений и семян

loans.name: Twizerane Sub Group A

texts.en:
Speciose is the group leader, age 40.  She is married, with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old.  Her group is called Twizerane, which means “Trust each other” in English.  

The group sells different products and they wish to expand their business to change their future for the better.  Speciose owns a beauty saloon and has been running a business for 15 years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more saloon equipment to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
A. jenny is a married woman with four children. She came to Kampala in1997 forcefully when especially her neighborhood homestead burnt down by Kony rebels and people lost their lives. The situation was so scaring and to remain was to loose life. She decided to come to Kampala where she settles at the suburb of Kampala known as Acholi quarters. While in this displaced place life has not been good because the way of earning living was not easy apart from stone quarry which is the only alternative to Acholi people in the suburb of Kampala.

But due to God’s will for his People, she joined life in Africa where sign of good life began to appear. She is a very active member and quick to learn whatever the community plans to do. She involved her self in learning how to make paper beads and other crafts that she became skilled in it and has become her monthly source of income. But still Jenny believes that she should not forget the stone quarry completely because that is where she started from and she knows enough about that business to know how to create more job opportunities in the stone quarry industry for the people of Acholi Quarters.

Her plan with this loan is to inject 500,000 in the stone quarry business as another side income and her production target is five trips per month. To realize her plan, she is seeking loan amount of 500,000/= that once given shall be repaid in 12 months. Below is her budget:

-Removing soil from pit........110,000/=
-Extraction of five trips of stone...100,000/=
-Breaking ................50,000/=
-Breaking into aggregates ........160,000/=
-Buying tools: big hammer, 10 chisels..80,000/=
Total .........................500,000/=

loans.use: Buying tools and employing people to quarry 5 trucks of stone

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Natalya is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur. She simultaneously runs two side by side kiosks each selling very different products. In one she offers a selection of wall-paper and in the other she sells small animals and products and supplies for them such as cages, toys and food. Natalya is a delightful retailer whom people trust and respect. She brings much joy to children whose parents buy them small pets and necessary equipment. She assists many people in improving their homes by offering a wide variety of wall-paper in her other kiosk. Natalya’s business strategy of having both kiosks side by side has helped her save the expense of hiring additional personnel to help her with retail. With 10 years of experience running these two different businesses, Natalya continues to reinvest profits into the development of her trade. Also, as a mother, she strives to be successful so that she can see her son graduate from college. Paying for his schooling is currently one of her biggest financial priorities. Natalya is requesting a loan for $500 to expand her assortment of available wall-paper before springtime and the beginning of the big remodeling season in Ukraine.

Наталія – дуже енергійна та жвава. Вона – власниця двох кіосків, торгує зовсім різними товарами: шпалерами, а також їжею та супровідними товарами для домашніх улюбленців, а саме, клітками та іграшками. Наталія – чудовий підприємець. Її поважають покупці, ставляться до неї з довірою. Вона дарує радість багатьом дітлахам, яким батьки купують домашніх улюбленців, а також усе необхідне для них. До того ж Наталія пропонує своїм покупцям широкий вибір різних шпалер, чим допомагає багатьом людям покращити інтер’єр в квартирах. Завдяки тому, що обидва кіоски Наталії знаходяться поруч один з одним, їй вдається обходитися без допомоги ще одного реалізатора, що, в свою чергу, допомагає їй заощаджувати кошти. Наталія займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Вона вкладає зароблені кошти в подальший розвиток торгівлі. До того ж вона допомагає сину з платою за навчання в університеті. Це зараз найважливіший фінансовий пріоритет для Наталії. Наталія просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент шпалер напередодні весняного періоду та початку сезону ремонтів для багатьох власників квартир.

loans.use: To purchase wall-paper

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 22 and has two sons. Her husband works as an assistant at a workshop specialized in manufacturing wrought iron fences. Amalia sews blouses and embroiders them. She sells her blouses to a lady who in turn sells them in Cancun. Amalia's mother, who is also in the same trade, put her in touch with this lady. Amalia can make 60 to 65 blouses every 15 days; she hopes that with the loan she'll be able to increase her production so she can have enough blouses to sell to the lady and to sell them herself to the tourists at the handcraft market. Amalia is part of the Arcos 1 group.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

AMALIA TIENE 22 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE UNA BALCONERIA (FIERRO FORJADO), Y ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BLUSAS DE MANTA Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA. SE LO VENDE A UNA SEÑORA QUE LOS LLEVA A CANCUN (SU MAMA TRABAJA EN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD Y ATRAVES DE ELLA OBTUVO EL CONTACTO). REALIZA UNA PRODUCCION DE 60 A 65 BLUSAS CADA 15 DIAS, Y ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD PARA ASI PODER ENTREGAR A LA SEÑORA Y TAMBIEN PODER IR A VENDER AL MERCADO ARTESANAL A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ARCOS 1.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: S. Mavluda is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters and one son. Her husband is a driver for a private company. She sells children's clothes in a local bazaar in Panjshanbe. She started her business with 50 US dollars and now has 15 years experience in trade. Earlier she sold socks and now her business is improving. She wants to purchase new kind of children clothes from Istaravshan. Her son works for a construction company but Mavluda would like him to go to university. She is a teacher by education but teacher's salary is not enough to support her family.  She will use her next loan to purchase seasonal children's clothes.

loans.use: EXPANSION OF COMMODITIES

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge and his partner live together and have a 16 year old son. His partner stays at home, and he started this line of work while helping his father, who also works in the moving business. After learning the business Jorge decided to go independent since before he only earned the salary of an employee. Now he earns more and can pay all his family's expenses. Jorge likes the job a lot and has more than 30 years with his own business. Due to his perserverance and effort he's managed to increase his clientele and offer his family a better quality of life.

Jorge is asking for a 4 month US $175 loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle's motor, since it is the main tool of his work. He and his family are grateful to you for the support you're giving him to continue his business and continue offering a quality job to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen un hijo de 16 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al hogar, y él empezó con el negocio ayudando a su padre que tiene el mismo oficio de mudanzas, cuando aprendió el negocio decidió independizarse, ya que antes solo ganaba como empleado y ahora ya tiene mejores ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de su familia, a Jorge le gusto mucho el negocio y ya tiene mas de 30 años con su negocio y debido a su constancia y esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y tener así una mejor calidad de vida que le ofrece a su familia.

Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 175 para poder hacerle mantenimiento al motor de su vehículo, ya que es su principal herramienta de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder seguir brindando un trabajo con calidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en: Gulmira I. is 44 years old, lives in the Khaladj village in the Salyan region, and has a daughter (shown in the picture). Gulmira has run her own farming business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Umrinisso

texts.en:
Umrinisso M. lives in Khujand, is married, and has 5 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She borrows from MicroInvest because she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.

Umrinisso has a business selling cigarettes and packets alongside roasted sunflower seeds. Currently, she earns practically all of her family's income by herself so it is difficult to bring up 5 children. As any mother, she dreams of a good and happy future for her children and that is why she is ready to work every day.

Despite having a lot of ideas, Umrinisso has not had the opportunity to realize them. That is why she now requires a loan of 1600 TJS to purchase additional agricultural and demand goods such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. that will allow her to improve the family income and support her business.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural and demand goods for winter

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is 48 years old.  She is married, has five children, and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale.  She has been in this business for over 30 years. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Fulaha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Fulaha M.. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 9. In 2006 Fulaha established a pool table business. Fulaha now requires a loan in order to buy a pool table for business purposes. 

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit-worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for business purposes.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Magreth M.. She is single with one child, aged 15, and has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.

In 2004, Magreth established a pharmacy. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requires a new loan in order to increase her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of medicines

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea R., a 74-year-old widow, makes around $8 per day selling bags from her home in the Prek Krobao 3 Village, Kandal Province. She has two married children who sell bags at the Prek Leap Market. R. now requests a loan of $800 to purchase more bags to sell. With her income is generated by her business, She will be able to support her family’s financial stability easily and appreciates Kiva for their support. R. and her client are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue investing in her salon and add a line of cosmetics in order to better server her customers.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Adi Wartini

texts.id:
Kadek Adi Wartini has successfully paid off her first loan from Dinari. Her first loan was IDR 1.4 million (approximately of USD 175) and she was able to paid off this loan in 6 month period. Not only she was able to paid off her loan, she was also able to made a profit of IDR 1 million (Approx of USD 125).

With this result, she wants to take another loan to further expand her business. She is planning to use the loan money to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah menyelesaikan pinjaman periode pertama, Kadek Adi Wartini peternak babi asal Ekasari ini merasakan hasil yang diperolehnya cukup lumayan. Dari pinjaman pertama sebesar Rp. 1.400.000.- yang diterimanya 6 bulan lalu dari Dinari, Kadek Adi Wartini mampu memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp.1000.000.-. Dengan hasil bagus yang dicapai oleh Kadek Adi Wartini disertai pembinaan yang rutin dilaksanakan oleh staf DINARI memacu Kadek Adi Wartini untuk melanjutkan pinjaman ke periode kedua dengan jumlah yang sama untuk nantinya akan dimanfaatkan untuk menambah jumlah babi dan membeli pakannya. Dari hasil beternak babi yang ditekuni Kadek Adi Wartini ini bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-hari dan sedikit disisihkan untuk ditabung supaya bisa menambah modal usaha yang dikembangkan oleh Kadek Adi Wartini.

loans.use: To buy piglet and pig feed (Membeli bibit dan pakan)

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia S. is a 50-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation/farming business, and she proudly works hard at her profession. As a result, she sells her crops to the village people and to the public at large 3 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 350 Tala ($145 USD).

Rosalia has received 3 previous loans from SPBD. As a matter of fact, SPBD loans are Rosalia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her kids' education, while the rest of the loan proceeds will be used for general business purposes.

loans.use: To improve her farming operations by purchasing additional equipment (e.g.,  weedkiller, knives, and chemicals).

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady D. is 31, married, has two children and has been a member of the Belfort village bank for five years. She buys fabric dyed in Mali and then resells it. Her income allows her to help pay her family’s daily expenses. She would also like to develop her business. Khady is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Khady D., 31 ans, est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge et est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 5 ans. Elle achète des tissus teintés du Mali pour les revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of dyed fabric

loans.name: Salma's Hatuchoki Group

texts.en:
Salma is 36 years old. She is married with three children, aged fourteen, sixteen, and eighteen years old. Since 2002, she has been selling clothing. She works daily and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma is now requesting a loan of $1925 to buy more clothing for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling perfume, juice, bites (snacks), cosmetics, phone vouchers, clothing, shoes, CDs, and DVDs.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and expand her business.

loans.name: Jane Francis

texts.en: S. Jane Francis is 28 years old and is married, with four children. She also cares for one niece who is also in school. She has had a retail shop in Kabowa for one year and it is now doing well, thanks to a loan from Pearl Microfinance. Before her first loan, she had empty shelves and few customers, but after her mother introduced her to the Abateesa women's group, her life transformed for the better. She has been able to stock her shop over the past six months and now her customers have increased, with more profits coming in.  With this loan, her second with the group, she plans to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, bread, soda and other items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Serubogo Jane Francis plans to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, bread, soda, and other items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 35 años de edad, estudió superior universitario, es casada, progenitora de 02 hijos varones de 10, 04 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 630 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo, con su crédito inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles aumentó a su capital y compró: 01 fotocopiadora. Desde los 13 años de edad empezó a vender ropa para niños y a la edad de 25 años tuvo su pareja. En la actualidad tiene una tienda de celulares y accesorios, a su vez cuenta con un locutorio, una librería.  

Con el préstamo que solicitará de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles,  que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará celulares de diferentes marcas y precios desde S/.69.00 hasta S/.1900.00, ella hace pedido a las distribuidoras de la ciudad de Puno.

Su visión es tener tiendas sucursales en los Departamento de  Tacna, Arequipa y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 35 years old and she went to university. She is married and she is the mother of two sons, aged 10 and 4 years old. They lie in Jr. Bolognesi No. 630 in the district and province of Yunguyo – Puno.

She is a founding member of the community bank "Winay Marca" in Yunguyo. With the initial loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she replenished her capital and purchase a photocopier. When she was 13 years old she started selling children's clothing. When she was 25 years old she got married. Currently she runs a store selling cellular phones and their accessories. In the store she also has a public phone and a book store.

With the loan is requesting, amounting to S/.1000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase more cellular phones of different makes and prices, starting from S/.60 up to S/.1900. She places an order to the distributers in the city of Puno.

Her dream is to have various franchise locations in the region of Tacna, and Arequipa. And she wants to see her children go to school and become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cellular phones wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Su nombre es Ana Cecilia T. R. tiene  la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta señora no tiene hijos, por lo que sus propósitos son de ampliar su negocio y en sus deseos esta el ampliar su negocio y su vivienda  como es pintar su vivienda y darle las condiciones necesarias para que esta sea un lugar acogedor para ella y su mama ya que el lugar donde reside es en la casa de habitación de su mama por lo que ella sueña seguirle proporcionando mantenimiento a su vivienda para que en un futuro esta no tenga problemas y este acondicionada de la mejor forma.



Su actividad económica a la que dedica es la venta de golosinas, artículos para el hogar venta de granos básicos y venta de refrescos y gaseosa, el tiempo que tiene en este negocio es de 6 años, la ubicación de su establecimiento es en su casa de habitación en león Bo subtiava, tamarindo ½ cuadra al este, en sus inicios decide establecer una venta de golosinas y refrescos por cuenta propia tenia ciertos clientes pero en esa misma cuadra estaban 2 pulperías de las cuales no pudieron mantenerse y ella deseaba invertir en mas productos y mas tarde lo efectúa, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo razón por la que  decide recurrir a su mano amiga como lo es la Fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones por lo que desea ampliarse aun mas para la compra de juguetes y ropa debido a las fechas festivas que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia T. Ruis is 38 years old and is single, she has no children. Her purpose is to improve her business and her house, to turn it on a welcoming home for her and her mother. She currently lives at her mother’s one room house, and she wants to keep supporting her mom and provide her of a home without any problems. She works selling candy, home supplies, grains and sodas for the past 6 years. Her grocery store is located on her one room house. She started by herself selling candy and sodas but she had 2 other grocery stores as competition, so she wants a loan to invest on buying more products to increase her supplies and buy toys and clothes because of the coming holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, es madre soltera, vive con su último hijo de 26 años. Siempre tuvo la fortaleza de salir adelante por sus hijos y desde hace 20 años encontró en la agricultura la manera de hacerlo, y gracias a su gran capacidad en la  crianza y venta de animales pudo educar a sus hijos quienes ahora son profesionales. María tiene hasta hoy en la crianza de animales una forma de ganarse la vida, y aprovecha los meses de fiesta para vender a mejores precios y obtener grandes ganancias de sus animales, en quienes invierte grandes cantidades de dinero para su alimentación. María está iniciando su préstamo, con la mejor condición de pagar y asumir su compromiso con responsabilidad. Durante estas fechas de fiesta tiene pensado comprar algunos animales y revenderlos a precios altos en las ferias, con ese fin invertirá la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and a single mother. She lives with her youngest son who is 26 years old. She always had the strength to go forward for her children and 20 years ago she found that agriculture was the manner in which to do it. Thanks to her great ability in the raising and sale of animals she could educate her children who are now professionals. As of today María has a way to earn a living through the raising of animals and she takes advantage of the holiday months in order to sell at the best prices and obtain large profits from her animals, in which she invests large quantities of money for their food.

María is beginning her loan in the best possible condition to pay and take on the commitment of responsibility. During the holiday time she plans to use her loan to buy some animals and resell them at higher prices at the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en: Bakir A. is 42 years old and married with two sons.  His family consists of five people, including his parents, two sons and wife.  To earn a living, Bakir sells food products and has been in this business for eight years.  In addition, he raises cattle; currently, he owns a cow to provide milk for his family.  These two businesses generate most of the income for Bakir 's family.  Already popular in the neighborhood for selling fresh eggs, Bakir, nevertheless, would like to increase the range goods he can offer.  Therefore, Bakir is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD for a term of 15 months in order to be able to purchase more food products for sale, as well as improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase more food products to increase profit

loans.name: Exaltación Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Zonia M. está dedicada a su kiosco, ya que ella vende  variedad de productos, temprano empieza con el desayuno y una variedad de sándwich, al medio día ofrece almuerzo a unos pocos clientes que tiene y por la tarde ofrece té, café, pasteles, y otros.
La Sra. Maruja G., es una cliente que ofrece otra variedad de productos como por ejemplo, empanadas, ensaladas de fruta, sándwich y otros, los cuales ofrece a sus clientes del Puesto policial que esta a media cuadra.
Ambas trabajan en sus kioscos ubicados en la calle 8 de Calacoto sus puestos son lado a lado y ellas tienen una muy buena relación de amistad y compañerismo entre si.
Este grupo trabaja desde Marzo del año 2002 con nuestra institucion y el miembro más antiguo de este grupo es la Sra. Maruja G. quien es fundadora del grupo. La Sra. Zonia M. trabaja en el grupo 3 secuencias mostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zonia M. operates a food stand where she sells various products. Early in the day she begins by selling breakfast and a variety of sandwiches. Midday she offers lunch to a few customers, and in the evening she sells tea, coffee, cakes and other items. Mrs. Maruja G. is another client of ours who offers different products, such as empanadas, fruit salads, sandwiches and other items. She sells these to customers from the police station half a block away. Both operate their food stands on Calle 8 in Calacoto side by side, and have a friendly working relationship. This group has been working with our institution since March 2002, with Mrs. Maruja G. being the founding member and our long time client. Mrs. Zonia M. has been through 3 loan cycles with the group, demonstrating responsibility in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of soft drinks, sugar and fruit

loans.name: Bayardo Manuel

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Manuel Vásquez, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar tiene una tienda de ropa usada en su casa, don Bayardo trabaja como supervisor de guarda de seguridad, desde hace cinco años, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido en construir su vivienda por falta de financiamiento; ya que su salario es bajo. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa y poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. V. lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. His wife works to support with the household expenses. She has a used clothes store at her home. Don Bayardo has worked for five years as a security guard supervisor. His future plans are to improve the living conditions of his family. The greatest difficulty that he is facing is building his home due to a lack of financing since his salary is low. With this request, he is going to buy construction materials to make improvements to the home and be able to have a home worth of his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to improve and finish his home.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia cuenta con 52 años de edad, vive durante 25 años con el padre de sus 5 hijos. De jovencita sus anhelos eran dedicarse a la gastronomía andina, pero este sueño se truncó al enamorarse de un agricultor y tenía un hijo en camino. Desde entonces se incrementaron sus   labores, se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el menú  para los que cultivan la tierra, y después ella sumarse al trabajo, el cual ya se acostumbró. Ellos siembran mayormente maíz, pero en este años el precio del mercado no les ayudó y han perdido inversiones considerables, por ello que se han propuestos en cultivar alverjas, porque son ahora rentables, y de ese modo quiere revertir su situación actual. Florencia tiene anhelos de comprar sus propias chacras, lo cual seria una buena inversión y los próximos años se ahorraría el derecho de alquiler. Este es su 8vo préstamo consecutivo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad, pero nunca quiso recibir ningún cargo de la junta directiva, por carecer de educación. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semilla de alverjas, de ese modo alternar sus sembríos, para que los altibajos de los precios del mercado no le afecten tanto.
texts.en:
Florencia is 52 years old, and has lived for 25 years with the father of her 5 children. When she was a little girl she dreamed of dedicating herself to Andean cooking, but this dream got cut short when she fell in love with a farmer and had a baby. Since then she and her partner have expanded their work, and she gets up at 5:00 each morning to prepare meals for the farmworkers, and afterwards she joins in the work, which she is very used to. They primarily grow corn, but lately the price of corn isn't very high and they have lost considerable investments. This is why they have proposed to grow peas, because right now they are more profitable, and this way they can reverse their current economic course. Florencia has dreams of buying her own fields, which would be a good investment and in future years she would save the part of her crop that usually goes to pay the landlord.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, and in all this time she hasn't been delinquent, but she's never wanted to take on any administrative role in her group due to her lack of education. The money she's asking for is to buy seeds for peas, so they can alternate their crops so the ups and downs of the market don't have such a big effect on them.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
Separated from her husband, F. supports her five children by selling medicine, cosmetics and cell phone credit at her shop in Bamenda. She is planning on using this loan to purchase additional medicine, rubbing oil and cell phone credit.

F. is well aware of what it takes to manage a business well: she believes one must know the business language, keep a good stock of needed products, and make customers feel welcome. With this knowledge, she hopes that her shop will continue to succeed. In fact, if the business expands, she will help the community by creating employment opportunities at her shop.

On a personal note, F. has faced some of life's difficulties like poverty, mistreatment by others, and the inability to provide for her children, but because of this loan and the support of others, she has been able to confront such problems. Three out of F.'s five children are under the age of fifteen, so she plans to use the profits from the loan to pay for her children's school fees and medical services, buy additional food, expand her business and and continue to save her money!

F. appreciates GHAPE's gradual repayment schedule and their training programs, for instance how to manage their loan and savings.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Medicine, Rubbing Oil, Cell Phone Credit

loans.name: Al Naenaiya Group

texts.en:
The group name is Al Naenaiya; it is made of five ladies who live in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

-Halimah is an 18-year-old married woman. Halimah has owned livestock for ten years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Halimah has requested a loan. 
Halimah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Halimah decided on doing her business because it is a demanding work in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock. 

-Amina is a 33-year-old married woman. Amina has been working in agriculture for four years. She has owned livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan. 
Amina is special in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Yosra is a 23-year old woman. Yosra has been working in agriculture for twelve years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Yosra has requested a loan. 
Yosra is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. Najah decided on doing her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Najah is a 50-year-old woman. Najah has been working in agriculture for ten years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. 
Najah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock. 

-Kosbah is a 41-year old married woman. Kosbah has been working in agriculture for fifteen years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Kosbah has requested a loan. 
Kosbah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because that was the demand in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Naenaiya group will use the loan to increase their livestock.

loans.name: Oluwaseun

texts.en:
Oluwaseun is 33 years old and married with two children. He has a business center where he offers computer services and where he also teaches young people how to use the computer.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more computers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more computers

loans.name: Cobra

texts.en: Cobra R. is from the village of Panduma Sur, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, married, and has eight children, who are now adults. Cobra owns and operates a "sari-sari" or variety store, selling daily use products such as bread, fruit, candies etc. in the local community. Cobra has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Cobra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cobra is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC.
