She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eva Nalukwago Group

texts.en:
Eva is a leader of four members of a group. She is 35 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 10. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with three people. She takes care of two additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Eva runs her business in Kisasi and so she incurs transportation costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of forty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Eva has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 18th loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her restaurant. Eva is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her restaurant

loans.name: Elizabeth Benita

texts.es: La Sra, Elizabeth Z., cliente que trabajo en grupo solidario Sureñas, desde al año 2004, durante diecisiete secuencias, ahora solicita credito individual, ya que por el monto decidieron individualizarse cada una de las integrantes del grupo, ella solicita para aumentar capital en su negocio, la Sra. tiene dos hijas en edad escolar que ella las mantiuene, ya que se separo de su esposo y vive en la casa de sus padres, solo trabaja con credito en Emp`render y es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Z. has been a client since 2004, working with the Sureñas solidarity group for 17 loan cycles. Now she is asking for an individual loan because the group members decided to apply for loans individually because of the sum of the loan. She is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her business. Elizabeth has two school-age daughters that she supports because she separated from her husband and lives in her parents’ house. She only works with loans from Emprender and she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of acrylic thinner and hardware merchandise

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Antonio M. tiene 20 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio M., aged 20, is single and lives with his parents. He is a weaver by trade and has two looms in his workshop named "Making of Traditional Ladies' Wear". He and his parents are engaged in the same trade. They have hired two workers for this activity. They have been making dresses for six years in their home in a hamlet near Aldea Vásquez in the department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. Recently the demand of his customers has grown, but his economic situation prevents him from making the necessary capital investments. For this reason he came to Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, intending to buy raw material and thereby increasing his sales and giving his family the chance of better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 25 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 10,4 years.

Zawadi started her own clothing business selling used clothes 6 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn motherly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Zawadi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Zawadi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding a bakery

loans.name: San Luis Pampa Group

texts.es:
Trece mujeres formaron la asociación “San Luis Pampa”, ellas se reunirán quincenalmente para cumplir con sus actividades en el centro focal Cascada. 
Entre los diversos negocios que tiene el grupo, encontramos a socias que se dedican a la costura, elaboración y venta de comida, tejidos, comercio de mercadería de todo tipo y por temporadas. Esta asociación requiere de capital, principalmente para comprar mercadería o materia prima, desean abastecer sus negocios para generar recursos y hacer frente a las necesidades de sus familias.
texts.en:
Thirteen women form the "San Luis Pampa" association and meet bi-weekly at the Cascada center for their activities. Among the varios businesses the group is involved with, we find members who do sewing, food preparation and sales, knitting, retail and seasonal sales. This group needs funds principally to purchase raw materials or inventory to supply their businesses and generate funds with which to meet their family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Sara Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Sara Gabriela López Pérez , tiene la edad de 54 años , habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como cobrador para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen seis hijos , ya todos son casados e independiente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Sara desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le heredaron para que la trabajara , ella esta contenta con el apoyo que le hemos brindado al sector agrícola ya que son muchas personas que se benefician así como ella que logro mejorar la producción y venderla a un mejor precio y cancelar su préstamo. El financiamiento será para comprar fertilizantes y aplicar al cultivo. Sus planes es poder hacer toda su casa de concreto para mayor seguridad y presentación
texts.en:
Sara Gabriela López Pérez is 54, and she lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division with her husband. He works as a conductor to help her with the household expenses. They have six children. All of them are married and independent. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. For 16 years Sara has been a farmer. She inherited it from her parents so that she could work. She is happy with the support we have offered the agricultural sector because there are a lot of people who benefit like she has. She was able to improve production, sell at a better price, and repay her loan. The loan is to buy fertilizers to put on her crops. Her plan is to be able to make her whole house concrete. This will look better and provide greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to put on her crops

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke sells yam. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in the business of selling yams for the past 15 years.  She is requesting N40,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She say thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: more yams to sell

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en: Flordelisa B. is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City. She is 43 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Flordelisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Flordelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Flordelisa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four kids. Currently all her children are in school. She enjoys selling goods, the business from which she makes a living. She has been selling yams for eight years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and would resell to her at higher price.

Lydia wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucena C. is a resident of Purok 6 Labuyo, Tangub City, 53 years of age, married to Mr. Olimpio C., a contractor. She has 5 children; 1 of them is still studying and the rest are already married. She is engaged in operating a sari-store which she newly opened in August 2009 with a starting capital of P 1,000 only. Now, she is earning an average net income of P2,000 a month.

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC as the one of the outstanding cooperatives of Northern Mindanao (awarded the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership award in the year 2006), she unhesitatingly joined the coop. With her good record in the community and with the capacity to repay, she was given the privilege of accessing the amount of P 5,000 as her 1st loan to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs and for the educational expenses for her child who is studying. She is hoping that someday she will have a mini-grocery store in their place.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita Y. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carlita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carlita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2008, Carlita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh L. is from the village of Butuay in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Purreh is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Purreh prepares and sells candies and cooked food for daily meals in the local community. Purreh has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Purreh joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Purreh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Purreh is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make the products that she sells. This will be Purreh's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food

loans.name: Hector Alcides

texts.es:
Héctor P. de 51 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento, es soltero con 2 hijos ya mayores de edad.

Héctor empezó vendiendo sacos de arroz a vecinos de su sector después de reunir un capital de dinero pudo poner una pequeña tienda vendiendo arroz, azúcar, dulces.

Hace 15 años realiza esta actividad el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, Héctor distribuye arroz y trabaja en su tienda. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia del sector donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar embutidos, arroz, bebidas para tener más variedad en su tienda. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para poder transportar mejor el arroz y demás víveres.
texts.en:
Héctor P., 51, lives in a periurban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His house is cement, he's single and has 2 adult children. Héctor started selling sacks of rice to his neighbors. Once he had saved up a bit of money he was able to set up a small store selling rice, sugar, candies. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and he's open from 7am until 9pm every day. Héctor distributes rice and works in his store. One of the inconveniences he has to face is the high level of delinquency in his area. The funds will be used to buy cured meats, rice and beverages in order to have a more varied stock in his store. In the future, he would like to buy a van to transport the rice and other supplies more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beverages, cured meats.

loans.name: Segundo Aristides

texts.es:
Segundo es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, Vive con sus padres, hermanos y sobrinos. Reside en un Pueblo Joven de Lambayeque ubicado a 15 minutos de Chiclayo.

El es propietario de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros),que adquirió con sus ahorros cuando trabajaba como albañil de construcción. Tiene 03 años de experiencia brindando servicio de tranporte de carga y pasajeros en su unidad móvil, esta actividad es su único ingreso económico con el cual aporta dinero a su hogar.

Segundo nos cuenta que las lluvias durante estos meses de verano son muy intensas en los caseríos donde el brinda su servicio de movilidad y esto ha afectado su vehículo, el cual requiere reparación urgente por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para cubrir los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo. 

Su más grande anhelo es comprar otra mototaxi, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos y dar tranquilidad y apoyo a sus padres y familiares.

Segundo es muy querido por sus vecinos y todos dan referencia de su buen comportamiento y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Segundo, 35, is single. He lives with his parents, his siblings and his nieces and nephews in one of Lambayeque's new towns located 15 minutes from Chiclayo. He owns a mototaxi (three-wheeled vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that he got from savings he had from his work as a bricklayer. He has been in the transportation business for three years; this is his only source of income for his household. Segundo tells us that the heavy summer rains these past few months in the settlements where he works have damaged the roads and thus his vehicle needs urgent repair and servicing. He has called upon Edpyme Alternativa requesting a 1200 new sol loan to cover these repair costs. His greatest wish is to buy another mototaxi so that his earnings will increase thereby providing his parents and family peace of mind. Segundo is well-liked by his neighbors and they all attest to his good behavior and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and service costs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 53 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de zapatos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que sus hijos le ayudan en lo que más pueden, pues trabajan de manera independiente pero siempre están al pendiente de su Madre. Ella inicio hace 3 años con este negocio por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su condición económica. Por lo que no quiere perder su medio de trabajo por este motivo solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar diferentes estilos de calzado. Su deseo es remodelar su vivienda para dejárselas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old, and her work is selling shoes. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than 3 years, and her children help her whenever they can, working independently but still depending on their mother. She began the business three years ago because she has always worked hard to improve her economic situation. She does not want to lose her means of making a living, so she is requesting a loan to provide working capital and to buy different styles of shoes. Her desire is to remodel her home so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karina Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora KARIANA MARILYN C. A. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6TO  de Primaria, es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Karina se dedica a la venta de menús (alimentos) que lleva a repartir a los trabajadores de las fábricas cercanas a su casa, también vende gaseosas y cervezas, pero refiere que los días de mayores ventas de la cerveza y gaseosa son los fines de semana (Sábado y Domingo). Para la preparación de sus menús ella compra productos alimenticios como: arroz, menestras, papas, aceite, azúcar, pollo, carne, pato, chancho, etc. En el mercado mayorista que es donde los encuentra a menor precio lo cual le favorece. Las gaseosas y cervezas las solicita a los camiones proveedores que pasan por su casa y las compra al por mayor para que le vendan a menor costo.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio ya que cerca de su domicilio nadie vendía gaseosas y cerveza lo cual la benefició, logrando captar rápidamente clientes.
Con su prime crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor y ahora con su próximo crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor, mesas y vajillla.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas para generar así mayores ganancias y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y la educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
Mrs. KARIANA MARILYN C. A. is 28 years old. She lives in the DE MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department – Perú. She belongs to the SAN BORJA communal bank. She went to school up to 6th grade of primary school. She is married and she has 2 school age children who depend on her financially. Karina sells meals that she delivers to workers in the factories near her house. She also sells soda and beer, but says that the days she sells the most beer and soda are on weekends (Saturdays and Sundays). To prepare her meals, she buys food products such as: rice, vegetable stews, potatoes, oil, sugar, chicken, beef, duck, pork, etc. In the wholesale market she finds the lowest prices which she prefers. She orders the soda and beer from the supply trucks that go by her house. She buys them wholesale so she can get them at a lower price. She decided to start this buisness since no one near her house sold soda and beer. This benefited her and she gained customers quickly. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles she bought cases of beer and soda wholesale. Now, with her next loan of 700.00 nuevos soles, she will buy cases of beer and soda wholesale and tables and dishes. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to have more profit and make more income for her home and her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SHE WILL BUY CASES OF BEER AND SODA AND TABLES AND DISHES

loans.name: Álvaro José

texts.es:
El joven  Álvaro José V. M. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operario de Limpieza, es soltero no tiene hijos y aun vive en casa de sus padres.

El señor Álvaro V. M., solicito el crédito para ayudar un poco a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y otros gastos personales, ya que sus padres son personas de edad y ya no pueden trabajar por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Alvaro works as a custodian in the Chinandenga city hall. He is single, has no children, and lives with his parents. Alvaro is requesting this loan in order to help his parents a little with household and other expenses. His parents are elderly and can no longer work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assist parents with expenses

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 27 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas que aún son menores de edad. Cuando era muy pequeña observaba como sus padres trabajaban la tierra, y como jugando aprendió todo lo necesario para obtener una cosecha productiva;  es así que tiene 8 años sembrando arveja. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho trabajar las labores agrícolas, por las ganancias que obtiene luego de vender la producción de arveja a los mayoristas de la ciudad, siendo estas rentas que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Aunque la agricultura es una actividad muy variable debido a las constantes amenazas que se presentan, como la plaga de insectos y los cambios climáticos que afectan las plantaciones, confía en que mientras sea mejor la tierra que prepara con fertilizantes, mayor será la producción. Para el futuro tiene planeado empezar a sembrar otro tipo de vegetales para variar un poco y obtener mejores ganancias. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y espera que éste crédito le será muy útil para mejorar su trabajo en búsqueda de progreso. Violeta tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra de fertilizantes para asegurar sus próximas cosechas, por lo que espera aumentar ésta última producción.
texts.en:
Violeta is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her three young daughters. As a girl she watched her parents work the land and learned everything that needed to be done to achieve a good harvest. She has been growing peas for eight years. Violeta says she enjoys farming because of the income she is able to generate selling peas to the wholesalers in the city. These profits allow her to live comfortably. Agriculture is an activity that can have variable results as a result of constant threats, such as swarms of insects and changes in weather that can affect planting. However, Violeta is confident that she can improve her land by preparing it with fertilizers to increase production. In the future, she hopes to begin planting other types of vegetables to add some variety and to earn generate more revenue.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Violeta expects that this will loan will be useful in improving her work and making progress. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of fertilizers to ensure her next harvest in hopes of increasing production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Kossi Fofovi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un homme marié, il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier d’aguikopé avépozo. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses charges est le commerce en détail de ferraille, il fait son commerce dans son propre atelier qu’il a appelé «  A. et fils », il s’approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de soudeurs. Son stock est en baisse, il voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour il laquelle il demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour l’achat de ferraille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and lives with his wife in the Aguikopé Avépozo district. He has an income generating activity, buying and selling scrap iron, and this allows him to cover his expenses. He runs his business in his own workshop which he has named "A. and Son". He gets his supplies at the local market in the independent port of Lomé. His customer base is made up primarily of welders. His stock is declining and he would like to get fresh supplies. For this reason he has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy scrap iron.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of scrap iron

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Phum M. is 45 years old and generates a daily income of $5 per day by selling fish. She is married to Yan, who is 33 years old and owns a trailer-motorbike taxi service. He also works in the construction field. He also earns approximately $5 each day to help manage the family's expenses. They have four children who go to the local public school. 

Phum M.’s husband has a problem: he can’t earn as much income as before since his taxi has broken often when providing transportation. To help solve the obstacle, Phum M. requests a loan to mend the broken taxi. Phum M.'s husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: To mend a broken taxi.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta R. is from the village of Luano, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. While Julieta’s husband is engaged in a transportation business with their motorcycle, Julieta is engaged in a food business where she cooks and sells snack foods to the local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair the motorcycle that is used in their trasportation business. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her snack-food business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Glenda Rosibel

texts.es:
la señora Glenda Rosibel C. T. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en en union libre con el señor Jose Serapio Garcia Zeron quien le ayuda con los gastos de los alimentos para el hogar. tienen una hija pequeña.
Glenda tiene un negocio de elaboracion y venta de papas y productos de soya, estos churros los realiza junto con su suegra en su casa de habitacion, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara  para compra de la materia prima para elaborar las papas y comprar salsas y bolsas para empaque. su mayor deseo es que su hijo crezca sano y saludable.
texts.en:
Glenda is 22 years old and lives in common law marriage with Jose, who helps her with household food expenses. They have a small daughter. Glenda has a business producing and selling potato crisps and soy products. She makes the chips together with her mother-in-law in her house. She has little time to do this type of activity. Glenda will use the loan to buy raw materials for making the chips and to buy sauces and bags for packaging. Her greatest wish is that her child grow up safe and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, potatoes, soy products and packaging

loans.name: Casa Hamaquera Group

texts.es:
La Casa Hamaquera es un grupo conformado por tres féminas emprendedoras provenientes de Masaya considera la cuna del Folklor nicaragüense. Este departamento cuenta con la mayor expresión Folklórica y una gran variedad de producción de arte y artesanía.
Las hamacas son parte son parte de la cultura nicaragüense que data desde antaños y la fabricación de esta ha sido transmitida de generación en generación tal es el caso de Evangelina L. fabricante de manilas, Ana S. y Amalia del Socorro Vásquez quienes fabrican hamacas de todos los colores y formas. 
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para mejorar y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
“La Casa Hamaquera” (The House of the Hammock Makers) is a group consisting of three female entrepreneurs from Masaya, which is considered the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore. This department experiences the highest level of folkloric expression and produces a wide variety of artistic and handcrafted objects. Hammocks are a part of Nicaraguan culture that dates back several years. Making hammocks is a skill that has been passed from generation to generation. Evangelina L. manufactures manila rope, while Ana S. and Amalia del Socorro Vásquez make hammocks in every color and style. They will invest this loan to improve their businesses and keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making manila rope & manila hammocks

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena L. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, que se encuentra ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, lo que producen es para su consumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y  a la cría de animales especialmente de ganado, con la leche que obtiene elabora quesillos(queso tierno) que los que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca, también trabaja en el agricultura labrando la tierra.

Nuestra tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es una socia fundadora y los créditos le han ayudado para los gastos de su hogar y para la compra de animales.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en  la compra de ganado y su meta es superarse y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena L. is a member of the Zhidmad communal bank which is located in the south of the Gualaceo territory. The people are farmers and raise cattle. What they produce is for their own consumption. The women make straw hats, woolen sweaters and embroider skirts and blouses. Our member is works around the house and raises animals, especially cattle. She uses the milk to make fresh cheeses that she sells in the city of Cuenca. She also works in farming and cultivates the land. Our member is 33 years old, married with 4 children ages 11, 8, 5 and 3. Her first three children study at the local school. Her husband is a bricklayer. Thanks to their joint efforts, they have been able to build their own house. She is a founding member and the loans have been put towards her household expenses and buying animals. This new loan will be used to buy cattle. Her dream is to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ida Kalé

texts.fr: Née le 13 avril 1969 au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, A. Ida Kalé est mariée à AZINFAN Réné un soudeur. Ida est Mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Ida vit depuis sept ans avec son mari et son enfant à Womey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Ida vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir, Ida prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermenté avec de la sauce au tomate fraiche) à la devanture de son domicile. Ida achète ses produits dans le petit marché de son quartier et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ida a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. Dans le but de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle et d'agrandir son commerce, Ida demande un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1969 in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, Ms. A. Ida Kalé is married to Mr. AZINFAN Réné, a welder. She is the mother of one child, who has attended school. Ida has been living with her husband and child for seven years in Womey, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She helps out her husband and, along with him, supports the family. To do so, she makes and sells food (a kind of fermented polenta served with fresh tomato sauce) in front of her home. She gets her supplies at the small market in her district and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Ida has already benefited from three loans from ALIDé and has repaid them. With the goal of satisfying the requirements of her customers and to expand her business, she is asking for a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 5 sacks of corn and 3 baskets of condiments

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 54 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 12 and 27. Four of the children attend school. Raphael has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya, for over 30 years. He employs two people from his community. His farm produces bananas, tobacco, maize, sukuma wiki (kale), beans and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same area.
Raphael recently completed his previous loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase farm supplies and start a cereals business. He says that this loan will enable him to expand his farm and therefore provide enough food for his family. He will also be able to earn extra income from the cereals business.
Raphael's primary challenges are lack of fertilizers, diseases, and lack of market especially when there is surplus produce. He hopes that in five years' time, his business will have improved and he will have expanded his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and start a cereals business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria F. is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 2 - 16).  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale.  Maria has 3 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of 2000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $81 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Maria joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Мурадова Адолат проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сыновья на заработках в России. Сама Адолат имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Adolat M. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Her sons work in Russia. Adolat has a secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. She fattens and sells livestock. Adolat is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle. She wants to use the resulting profit to remodel her house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la  Sra. Teodora;  La socia tiene 66 años de edad;  ella es casado y tiene 8  hijos; La socia  trabaja criando gallinas, ella también tiene su chichería en su propio domicilio, La socia elabora la chicha de jora a base de maíz macerado, ella vende todas las tardes en su casa, también cría gallinas para la venta o para cocinar para los clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo para elaborar la chicha.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Sr. de Tantamarca" [Lord of Tantamarca] located in the district of Chicon in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The member is Teodora, 66; she is married and has eight children. The member raises chickens and also makes and sells chicha, a traditional mild corn liquor, out of her own home. She makes chicha de jora out of corn mash and sells it every afternoon at her house. She also raises chickens for sale or for preparing food for the customers. The member is seeking the loan to purchase yellow maize for making chicha. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted through this means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase yellow maize for making a traditional mild corn liquor

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Jenny Julieta; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para el restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jenny Julieta, 29, is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES II” (Lord of the Earthquakes II) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a restaurant that she tends to from 7am until 5pm.  This business makes it possible for her to support her children.  She wants to equip the restaurant and is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for it.

She thanks all those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for the restaurant.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, D. 59 años, es una madre D. familia D. buen carácter, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos que son varones, quienes trabajan en el transporte público. Hace más D. 14 años  trabaja con su esposo, brindando servicio D. transporte público. Inicialmente ella era la cobradora y su esposo el chofer, pero por un tiempo le fue muy bien. Actualmente sus hijos han tomado la posta, desD. entonces Bertha se dedica a la preparación D. menú diario y también en la administración del servicio D. transporte, así como hacer los pedidos  D. repuestos para sus vehículos. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que tiene, ya que le es rentable y D. las ganancias se compraron un segundo carro, para que sus hijos puedan trabajar y sean independientes. Por lo pronto continuará construyendo su casa, ya que su fin es alquilarlo. Es su crédito número 16 con MFP, sabe que el crédito que recibe le será muy beneficioso para la reparación D. su carro; además, comenta que le gusta ser puntual en las reuniones D. su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunos repuestos D. su carro, para que trabaje sin desperfectos en sus vehículos.
texts.en: Bertha is 59 years old. She is a wife and mother of good character. She lives in her own house wit hher husband nad 5 sons. They work an public transport. She has worked with her  husband for more than 14 years offering public transport service. At first she took the money and her husband drove, but for a time it went very well. Now her sons have taken over her post and Bertha prepares the daily menu and and manages the transportation service and makes the orders for the vehicle replacement parts. She really likes her job since it is profitable and with the earnings they bought a second car so that her sons can work and be independent. Soon she will continue building her house, since the idea is to rent it out. This is her 16th loan with MFP. She knows that the loan she receives will be very beneficial for car repair, so she can work without imperfections in her vehicles.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the president of the group "We are Impact 2006."  She has been the president for two years, but the group has successfully borrowed together for more than five years.
 
Margarita has a life partner and five children who range in age from 14 to 25. She has enjoyed knitting since high school and started her own handbag business a few years ago. She makes brightly colored woven bags that her customers typically use as purses.  

Up until this point, Margarita has taken orders for purses and sold them out of her home. With this loan, Margarita is hoping to hire someone to help her knit and increase her inventory so that she might sell her purses in a local market. She is very excited to expand the business that helps to support her family.

loans.use: To expand her handbag business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina, de 24 años, está casada con Iván, de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Jean, de 8, Juan, de 2 y Percy, de 9 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Está joven mujer y madre; desde niña, se dedicó a sembrar, limpiar y cosechar sus terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello, pero hace 3 años comenzó a generar sus propios ingresos, pues el motor de su progreso y desarrollo son sus hijos. Su principal producción consta de café y plátanos, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa a los intermediarios que constantemente visitan la zona. El deseo de Carolina, es comprar más terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues su aspiración es poder ser una de los mejores agricultores de su localidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está segura que si sigue trabajando con ahínco y empeño podrá salir adelante, junto a su banco comunal. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado compra de 3 sacos de guano de isla (fertilizante natural), con el que esparcirá en sus cultivos de café y, si el dinero le alcanza podrá invertir en la contrata de peones, para que le ayuden en la limpieza de la maleza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carolina is 24 years old.  She is married to 25 year-old Iván.  The couple have 3 children: Jean aged 8, Juan aged 2 and Percy aged 9 months.  They live together in their own house which is in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar (in the Peruvian central jungle).  This young woman and mother has been sowing, weeding and harvesting her farmland since she was a girl.  She has been doing this work for 12 years but 3 years ago she started making her own income since the driving force behind her progress and development are her children.

Carolina's main crops are coffee and bananas.  After every harvest she sells her crops to the middlemen who constantly visit the area.  Carolina's wish is to buy more land where she can sow more crops since her aspiration is to become one of the best farmers in her area.

This is Carolina's third loan with MFP and she is sure that if she keeps working hard and with determination, she will be able to get ahead in life, together with her community bank.

Carolina plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of guano (a natural fertilizer) which she will spread over her coffee crops and, if there is enough money left over, she will also invest in hiring laborers to help her clear the weeds from her crops.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers to help her weed her land

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun V. was born in 1966 and is married. She has two children who both attend public school. To earn a living, Chhoeun V. cultivates a rice crop with her husband. She currently lacks farming supplies to help support her work on the farm, so she would like a loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to pay someone to plow her dry-season rice field and to purchase seeds and fertilizers to help her crops grow well.

loans.use: To pay plowing fee, to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a mother from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. She has one daughter, Rana, and one son, Muhammad. Her husband, Imad, is a taxi driver who has been doing this work for four years now. Kholoud took out a loan from FATEN as her husband needs to do urgent maintenance on the car and to replace the old engine. The car is the only source of income for the family and fixing it will keep the family in a good financial situation.

Kholoud's husband Imad appears in the picture as she is religious, as are most of Gaza's inhabitants.

loans.use: For car maintenance and to replace an old engine

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
Luís Alberto C. E., tiene 30 años, es soltero vive con la hija, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Alberto C. E., age 30, is single and lives with his daughter in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has one child.

The members of the V.R.C. Valle Alto are located in the Voluntad de Dios district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice.

Luis works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in stalls in the Peña market and sells them every day from home or in the market.

He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a farm.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Eva has a small retail shop business, which she has run for four years. Eva has a second business of a restaurant.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for her restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become a fashion designer.
Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Christopher Muya

texts.en:
Christopher Muya M. is 32 years old, single and a hardworking gentle man. He lives in Kangudo and has operated laboratory services at the same place for five years now. The monthly profit margin is KES. 15000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy a modern microscope and some other laboratory equipment.

The anticipated profit he will save and invest. In future he desires to grow his business and own a clinic. Christopher is very hardworking, honest and patient with people.

loans.use: To buy modern microscope and other laboratory equipment

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia de 35 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, en casa de una tía,  Sonia administra una pupuseria este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con la ayuda de su madre.
Hoy día solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las pupusas, los cuales son aceite, maíz, arroz, pollo, chicharrón, esta compra le ayudara a mantener lo necesario para su venta y poder disponer de mayor cantidad cuando la demanda sea más.
El propósito de Sonia es mantenerse en el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso y ayudar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 35, lives in Puerto el Triunfo in the Usulután department.  She lives in her aunt’s house with her two children, ages 10 and 5.  Sonia runs a “pupusuría” (a business that specializes in selling “pupusas”, which are stuffed corn tortillas).  She started this business three years ago with help from her mother.

She is now requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make the pupusas.  She will buy oil, corn, rice, chicken, and “chicharrón” (pork rind).  This purchase will help her  keep on hand what she needs for her sales.  It will also help her to be able to get a larger quantity ready when there is increased demand.

Sonia’s intention is to keep up with the business because it is her source of income and to help her children in everything that they need.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like oil, corn, chicken, and pork rinds

loans.name: Deisy Natividad

texts.es:
Deisy Natividad G. Z. tiene 23 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Deisy Natividad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable y tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta que el próximo año el monto del coedito sea mas alto.
texts.en:
Deisy Natividad G. Z. is 23 years old, has a common-law marriage and 3 children. She lives with her husband and children in Bolívar Province.

The members of CALZADO SOLIDARIO [Calzado Solidarity] communal bank live in Calzado Recinto in San Miguel Canton, a half hour from the Cooperativa office. The 12 members of this group do short cycle agricultural work, planting corn, potatoes and beans, and raise farmyard animals and cattle.

Deisy Natividad does agricultural work growing corn, potatoes and beans, and raising farmyard animals. She purchases her products in the San Miguel market each week and sells them at the Thursday market in San Miguel. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially meet her needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. Her dream is to have a stable job and to have her own business.

She likes that next year her loan amount can be higher.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia es originaria de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda, tiene 25 años de edad y nos comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y que ya no continuo con sus estudios debido  a que sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándola con los gastos de sus útiles escolares ni con los pasajes ya que se tenia que trasladar a otra población para estudiar la preparatoria. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 4 años y está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para comprar maíz, fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y no dañar la tierra, también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de ocoshal las cuales las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población, ella comprará con el préstamo agujas, hilo, jabón para lavar el ocoshal. Comenta que desde muy niña sus papás le enseñaron a cuidar los árboles y las plantas.
Ella vende su maíz en la central de abastos en Zitacuaro, una de las situaciones difíciles que ellos pasan es la falta de agua para regar sus siembras y tienen que rentar una bomba para acarrear el agua. Ella esta casada con el señor Marcelino el cual trabaja como cargador en la central de abastos en la cuidad de México, ellos tienen una niña de nombre Alelí la cual tiene 5 años y estudia el preescolar.
texts.en:
Natalia is from the town of Donaciano Ojeda.  She is 25 years old and tells us that she studied up to the third year of high school but didn't continue her studies because her parents couldn't continue supporting her with the cost of her school supplies nor the cost of transportation to another town where she was studying.

Natalia has been growing corn for 4 years.  She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to buy corn and organic fertilizer to feed the soil without damaging the earth.  Natalia also makes handicrafts from ocoshal leaves which she sells in neighboring towns.  She will use her loan to buy needles, thread and soap for washing the ocoshal leaves.  Natalia comments that her parents taught her to care for trees and plants from a very young age.  She sells her corn in the wholesale food market in Zitacuaro.  One of the difficult situations that Natalia experiences is the lack of water with which to irrigate her crops.  She has to hire a pump to deliver the water.

Natalia is married to Marcelino who works as a loader in the wholesale food market in Mexico City.  The couple have a daughter named Alelí who is five years old and attending pre-school.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel M. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Nissel is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nissel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Kyankyere Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en: B. Dickson is the leader of the Kyankyere Kwetungura group in Kihihi. He is 30 years old and married with four children aged 13, 11, 9, and 7. Dickson is a timber dealer transacting his business by the side of the road. He is able to generate 280,000UGX per month. He is also involved in selling bananas from which he generates another 100,000UGX monthly. He has been in the timber business for five years. Being hardworking and cooperative have enabled him grow. His dream is to be able expand his business and educate his children. He needs a loan to be able to buy trees for growing mor timber.

loans.use: To buy trees to grow more timber.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique vive en el barrio Centro del  municipio de Malambo  con su esposa y dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 12 años; él es un hombre muy responsable de 42 años que ha sostenido su hogar  trabajando independientemente, en un negocio que inició   hace seis años impulsado por un amigo, propietario de un expendio y fue de aquí donde se derivó su emprendimiento; Luis Enrique comenzó vendiendo carnero semanalmente al detal a los vecinos del barrio y a los copropietarios de un edificio, donde prestó el servicio de celaduría  y consiguió muchos clientes a quienes hoy les vende de contado y a crédito a cortos plazos.
Su meta a nivel familiar es  que algún día sus hijos sean profesionales  y su meta empresarial es aumentar su capacidad de compra pues quiere convertirse en mayorista  de ganado   y quiere cuidar su historia crediticia por eso es cauteloso cuando se trata del  pago de sus obligaciones, y está organizándose para poco a poco  conseguir este propósito. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque requiere  adecuar la cubierta de su negocio,  para evitar que la temporada de invierno que ya se avecina,  pueda afectarle su actividad y con este crédito también comprará  carne de cerdo, ganado vacuno y  gallina para la venta pues su mercado ha crecido y diariamente solicita que tengan diversos productos en su oferta, para atraer  a un mayor número de clientes y que estos tengan de donde escoger de acuerdo a sus gustos y cultura alimentaria. 
Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo mediante conexiones con propietarios de fincas y  vendiendo cerdo y gallipava alrededor de su vivienda, con el tiempo se dio a conocer en el sector y ahora no solo vende en el centro de Malambo, sino que en todo el municipio entre restaurantes  y otros clientes que compran al por mayor y con sus ingresos  poco a poco ha organizado su expendio, adicionando un congelador para la conservación de sus alimentos,  con un préstamo que obtuvo con el que logró también enchapar las paredes. Él viaja los fines de semana para hacer las compras  a Cascajal, Ponedera,  Sabanagrande Puerto Giraldo y justamente en estos sitios ha conocido muchos propietarios de fincad, los cuales lo están motivando para comercializar su ganado y a Luis le parece una buena idea aunque planea hacerlo con calma.  Como muestra del alcance de Luis,  su organización y la proyección que tiene,  hace dos años formalizó su microempresa y obtuvo el registro mercantil ante la Cámara de Comercio, para continuar ganando credibilidad en el mercado y oportunidades comerciales superiores a las actuales.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique lives in the community of Centro in the municipality of Malambo. He lives with his wife and their two children, aged 8 and 12. He is a very responsible, 42-year old man who has supported his household by working independently on a business he started six years ago. He was encouraged by a friend, the owner of an outlet, and that is from where he derived his own business. Luis Enrique started out sell ram's meat weekly to his neighbors in the community and to the co-owners of a building where he worked as a security guard. There he earned many clients and he completes his sales in cash and on short-term credit.

His goal for his family is to one day see his children have careers. His goal for his business is to increase his purchase capacity, wanting to convert into a cattle wholesaler. He wants to protect his credit history so he is cautious with his loan payment obligations and his is gradually organizing himself to meet his goal. This Kiva loan is the first loan he has accessed through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he requires it to recondition the roofing on his business, to be ready for the approaching winter season which could affect his business. He will also purchase pork, beef, and chicken meats to resell. His market has grown in the number of clients. He wants to offer them a selection according to their likes and to their gastronomical culture.

He started out his business through connections with owners of farms and by selling pork and turkey meat in his neighborhood. With time he got to know the business and today he not only sells in downtown Malambo, but also at the restaurants and other clients who buy in wholesale in the entire municipality. His profits he has been gradually organizing his store, adding a freezer to conserve his foods. He was also able to refinish the walls with a loan he acquired. He travels on the weekends to make his purchases in Cascajal, Ponedera, Sabanagrande and Puerto Giraldo and it is at these locations that he has gotten to know many farmers. They have been encouraging him to sell their cattle and he thinks it's a good idea, although he plans on taking his time. Given that Luis's goals are within his reach, his organization, and his projection for the future he formalized his business by registering it with Chamber of Commerce. He will continue to earn credibility in the market and to secure better commercial activities.

loans.use: to install a roof on his building.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a dairy farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for seven years. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, and beans which are all sold to the local market. Farming has been her main source of income.

Jane has requested this loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her four children who are currently attending school. Her biggest challenge has been transportation of her products to the market due to poor road transport network in the area. She plans to expand her dairy farming in the next future by acquiring at least five dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lala

texts.fr:
Madame Lala est une femme mariée de  23 ans, qui vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame, à Sanankoroba, préfecture de Kati, deuxième région administrative de la république  du Mali.
Très tôt Lala s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des produits laitiers : lait en poudre, lait frais, laits caillé, crèmes, yaourts etc.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à son premier prêt.
Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Bamako et compte acheter avec ce prêt, cinq sacs de lait en poudre qu’elle vendra, en détail, en ambulant et surtout au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir à ses dépenses et rembourser les échéances du prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lala is a 23 year old, married woman who lives with her 3 children and spouse in a monogamous family in Sanankoroba, a prefecture of Kati, the second largest administrative region in Mali.

Very early on, Lala became interested in income-generating businesses, notably the purchase and sale of diary products: powdered milk, fresh milk, milk curd, cream, yogurt, etc.  

While looking for additional funding, she decided to sign-up for the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. She is on her first loan.

She stocks up twice a month in Bamako and plans to buy with this loan, five sacks of powdered milk which she will sell retail, from place to place, for cash, to male and female customers.  She hopes to achieve a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA which will be used to cover her expenses and to make loan payments.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with six children.  Two children attend school while four are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwaka has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighborss and passersby. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With a loan of Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Soumba

texts.fr:
Madame Soumba est âgée de 61 ans, mariée  et mère de 7 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari et ses enfants  au  1er quartier  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença dès le bas âge   le commerce  auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et céréales. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle finit par évoluer seule pour faire le commerce de fruits et de jus de fruits. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses fruits mais également au goût de son jus.
Pour faire son jus : elle a besoin de 5 kg de sucre, 10 sachets de poudre de jus et 2 kg de gingembre en poudre, le tout mélangé dans 8 litres d’eaux. Ensuite elle met le jus dans de bouteilles en plastiques et dans des sachets, qui seront mis dans un congélateur avant la vente. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, un congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Soumba  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 120 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de participer à des événements sociaux. Son ambition est  de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Soumba is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in a traditional household with her husband and children in the 1st quarter of Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
Not having attended school for societal reasons, she began working in business at an early age with her mother, who sold condiments and cereals. After several years of training at her mother's side, she eventually started her own business selling fruit and fruit juice. She has run this business for 20 years and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Her strong sales are due to the quality of her fruit and also to the taste of the juice she sells.
To make her juice, she uses 5kg of sugar, 10 packets of powdered juice, and 2 kg of powdered ginger, all mixed with 8 litres of water. She then pours the juice into plastic bottles and packets, which will be stored in a freezer before being sold.
With the goal of meeting her customers' demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso and has been working with this institution for 60 months. After 4 solidarity (group) loans and 3 individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her fourth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a freezer. She gets her supplies locally. Soumba sells her goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and participate in traditional social events. Her ambition is to build a home.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Francisquenses Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Joh es casada, tiene 31 años D. edad, curso los 6 años D. educación primaria, tiene 4  hijos 3 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al comercio, ya que tiene una tienda D. venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, inicio con un pequeño capital gracias al poyo D. su esposo y hasta el momento lleva  6 años D. experiencia, su esposo se dedica a la confección D. tejidos.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital del negocio que tiene, va a comprar más producto: aguas gaseosas, jugos, comida enlatada, fideos, golosinas, agua pura, dulces, productos lácteos como queso y leche y entres otros productos, ya que quiere que su tienda se mejor y surtido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a diversas actividades productivas: venta D. alientos, consumo diario, vena D. ropa típica, venta e útiles escolares, confección D. pants, faldas y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Maria Joh is 31 years old and married.  She studied at elementary school for six years.  She has four children, three of whom are in school.  Maria does domestic work and also works in commerce.  She owns a store where she sells basic household products.  She started out with a little capital, thanks to the support of her husband, and now has six years experience.  Her husband makes woven products.

Maria decided to form a group so that she could request a loan that she would use to expand her business capital.  She will buy more products such as water, soda, juice, canned food, noodles, candies, water, sweet treats, dairy products (cheese and milk) and other products.  She would like to improve and better stock her store.  The other members of this group work in different business activities such as selling food and basic household products, selling traditional clothing, selling school supplies, making pants and skirts, and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Zulma Carolina

texts.es:
Zulma, es madre soltera de dos niños de 9 y 1 año de edad, ella trabaja como cocinera de un restaurante, lleva 5 años de trabajar, su horario es de 10:00am a 7:00pm, todos los días de la semana, este trabajo le ayuda para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de zapatos y uniformes escolares, para sus hijos, este préstamo le ayudara para que sus hijos cuenten con lo necesario para sus estudios.
Su propósito es trabajar de una manera excelente para conservar el trabajo y poder proveer para sus hijos lo necesario hasta que finalicen los estudios.
texts.en:
Zulma is a single mother of two children who are 9 and 1 year old.  She works as a Cook in a restaurant; she’s been working for five years and her schedule is 10am to 7m every day of the week.  This work helps her meet her children’s needs.

She is asking for the loan to buy shoes and school uniforms for her children.  The loan will help her so that her children will have everything they need for school.

Her goal is to work in an excellent way to save at work and be able to provide her children with everything they need until they finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy shoes and school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: El trabajo de Isabel consiste en la venta de helados y bebidas gaseosas, compra al por mayor y se encarga de venderlo por unidades en su casa, lleva realizando este trabajo ya mas de 4 años y esta contenta pues es rentable ya que siempre hay clientes y la ganancia se ve a diario, trabaja sola ya que no es necesario de tantas personas para realizar este trabajo, en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo o su hija.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaja y aparte puede trabajar en otras actividades, ya que es promotora de un sistema de educación del estado llamado Piet -, espera poder continuar con lo que hace y en cuanto a su negocio aun no tiene planes a futuro ya que se siente tranquila por ahora.Este es el préstamo numero diez entre Isabel y la institución MFP, se siente cómoda en su grupo y espera poder seguir trabajando junto a ellas ya que la quieren mucho y es la presidenta del grupo, espera poder seguir trabajando junto a la institución que le da ese apoyo que tanto necesitan algunas emprendedoras como ella.Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, ella comprara bebidas y helados para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Isabel sells ice cream and soft drinks, buying wholesale quantities and selling them retail from her home.  She has been selling these products for 4 years, and is pleased to see the business grow with daily profits.  She does not require much help to carry out these sales, but occasionally her husband or daughter assist her.  Her business is not demanding, and allows her to focus on other activities as well such as promoting "Piet" educational materials.  She is confident in the future of her sales and very content with her situation at present.  This will be Isabel's tenth loan with  MFP, and she feels very comfortable working with her colleagues there.  With a loan of 1800 soles, Isabel will buy additional stock of soft drinks and ice cream for re-sale.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ice cream to sustain her business

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mary-Ann has a food shop where she sells home-made sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausages.

Mary-Ann is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary-Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausages.

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar, 32, lives with his two daughters and wife in the house of his relative. 

He is a lawyer and new in this field. Zorigtbaatar started his career just last year and currently he is working as a lawyer in a non-government organization that runs a legal consulting service.
 
In winter time, his family lives in a winter house that is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  But the house is becoming old and it has been losing heat lately. 

He decided to make a renovation and insulate the walls of the house because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and unhealthy to live in. Also there will be no heat loss after the making insulation, so it will be beneficial for the spending of fuel or firewood.  
 
Therefore he is requesting a loan to purchase some building materials to renovate and insulate his house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to renovate and insulate his house.

loans.name: Aitbu

texts.en:
Aitbu is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 26 and together with her husband she runs a food stall. Aitbu is bringing up a son and two daughters; the son is at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven).  

The family opened the food stall three years ago with an initial investment of 7000 soms. The monthly profit from this business is about 15,000 soms.  With the profits earned, Aitbu purchased a cow for breeding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase onions and flour.  Some part of the loan she will use to purchase a carpet for their home. In the future Aitbu wishes to build a new house and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
