This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onions, flour and a carpet.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa tiene 39 años y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos.
gracias a su negocio a logrado salir adelante, es rentable y le genera ganancias.
Candida nos comento que desea tener una mayor produccion ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores y no tiene el capital sufuciente para comprar mas materiales para una mayor produccion de tortillas.
la meta de Candida es mejorar y ampliar su negocio de manera que pueda cubrir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes a tiempo y de manera eficiente.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 39, and she makes and sells tortillas. Her business is located in the house where she lives. Her main customers are her neighbors. Thanks to her business, she has managed to get ahead in life.  Her business is profitable, and generates earnings. 

Candida told us that she wants to produce more, since demand from her customers has increased, and she doesn't have sufficient working capital to buy more materials in order to produce more tortillas. 

Candida's goal is to improve and expand her business, so that she can cover all her customer orders efficiently and on time.

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime, corn and water.

loans.name: Elio Enrique

texts.es:
Elio de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de La Libertad.

Elio brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior (máximo 3 personas), la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia en el rubro trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos accesorios a su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su mototaxi en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Elio, 38, lives with his family in their own house that is equipped with power and water.  It is located in a rural zone of Paijan district, an area that focuses on agriculture and cattle raising in La Libertad department.

Elio has a motortaxi transport service.  His motortaxi has a cabin that holds up to 3 people and he works daily until 6.  Despite having competition in the area, he tries to make enough money to cover his family’s expenses.

He is requesting a loan of 1300 new sols for the maintenance of his motortaxi and to change some accessories.  He needs to keep it in shape to continue offering good service to his customers.  The loan will help him increase his income and continuing helping his family financially.

loans.use: to provide maintenance and change some of the accessories on his motortaxi.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 44 años, vive con sus 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 16 años de edad. Hace 3 años que se separó del padre de ellos, aún así se siente mejor. Vive en la casa de sus padres de 86 y 84 años a quienes cuida desinteresadamente. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales menores, específicamente de cuyes, los que cría cada 4 meses y los vende en la ciudad de Lima. “Si me conviene este negocio, por que cada cuy lo vendo a 20 o 25 soles, y cada quincena de mes llevo 50 cuyes”, explica. Del mismo modo, compra queso y miel y los vende en la capital. Además, cuenta con parcelas de terrenos agrícolas en donde siembra arvejas, maíz, y gladiolos. Alicia considera como principal problema la mala designación de su tiempo, que hizo que descuidará anteriormente sus cultivos, asimismo la falta de personal para trabajarlos, inconvenientes que ha solucionado con el tiempo. Espera, más adelante construir su casa de material noble, eso gracias a los ahorros y el trabajo incansable al que se entrega día a día. Ya son 13 los ciclos que Alicia trabaja con MFP y con su Banco Comunal llamado “Nueva Esperanza”, se siente a gusto trabajando con vecinos y familiares, por el ambiente cálido y hogareño que formaron en todo este tiempo.
Con el dinero del préstamo, Alicia podrá comprar semillas de arvejas y sacos de abono, para sembrar en esta nueva temporada, lo que calcula le costará de 2000 a 3000 soles, incluyendo el pago a operarios.
texts.en:
Alicia, 44, lives with her three children, ages 22, 18, and 16.  She has been separated from their father for three years; even so, she feels better.  She lives with her parents, ages 86 and 84, in their home, and takes care of them selflessly.

Her principal job is selling small animals, specifically guinea pigs, which she raises for four months and sells in the city of Lima.  "Yes, this business is good for me, because I sell each guinea pig for 20 or 25 PEN, and every two weeks I take 50 guinea pigs," she explains.

She also buys cheese and honey and sells them in the capital.  In addition, she has plots of farmland where she grows peas, corn, and gladiolus.

Alicia considers her main problem to be poor time management, which previously caused her to neglect her crops.  The lack of workers to work her crops is another problem she has resolved over time.

She hopes to be able to build a house of fine wood in the future, thanks to her savings and the tireless work she does every day.  Alicia has worked with MFP and her communal bank, Nueva Esperanza, for 13 loan cycles.  She feels comfortable working with neighbors and family members because of the warm family environment they formed in all this time.

With the money from the loan, Alicia will be able to buy pea seeds and bags of fertilizer to plant in this new season.  She calculates that it will cost her from 2000 to 3000 PEN, including the payment to workers.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelsona

texts.en: Nelsona lives in West Point  and is 26 years old. She is  married  and has two children ages 4 and 1. They live at home and the older one is  presently in school. For the past years  Nelsona has been selling rice and vegetables. She enjoys  the way she sells and makes more profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more rice and vegetables   for her  business. Her plan is to  expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and vegetables   for her  business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 40-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 20 to 10 years. Three of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Anna requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, ages 12, in the outer ger district Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, without the basic infrastructure of the city. Her daughter attends a local high school.

Oyunbileg supports her family by operating a recycling raw materials buying business.  She has been in this business for eleven years.  She buys recycling materials such as pots, bottles, brass, copper and sell them back to the factory.  Her husband helps her in the business. Their long term goal is to own an apartment and make better living condition for their daughter and to improve their business and increase their working capital. 

Today their working capital has decreased, so Oyunbileg needs capital in order to continue her own business. So she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario,  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta  de  ropa , de la  cual se ayuda para salir adelante con su familia que  es lo mas importante  en su  vida, este negocio  le  a permitido brindar a  sus  hijos  una  buena estabilidad  económica, en esta  ocasión ella  requiere  realizar  la compra de  ropa para continuar  con su proyecto, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  incrementar  sus  ingresos además  de que  podrá  seguir  ofreciéndoles a  sus  clientes   un  excelente   servicio.
texts.en: Rosario has a small business selling clothes which helps her support her family which is the most important thing in her life.  This business has allowed her to provide her children with good economic stability.  On this occasion, she needs to buy clothes to continue with her project.  She sees in the loan the opportunity to increase income in addition to being able to continue offering her customers excellent service.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is married with 3 children. He is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marlon owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different product to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years and every month he earns 30,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, Marlon hopes to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe De Reyes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo integrado por 10 personas cada una de ellas con una diferente actividad economica, este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy unido, alegre y su gante es muy trabajadora.

El señor Juaquin es otro de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casado con la señora silvia, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a  la primaria. Don Juaquin dice que como no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar aprendio el oficio de herrero para poder sacar a delante a  su familia y darle una mejor calidad de vida. El desde hace un poco mas de cuatro años puso una pequeña herreria en el patio de su casa en la cual realiza trabajos como puertas, ventanas y protecines, el trabaja sobre pedidos como ya tiene varios años con su negocio ya tiene muchos clientes y dice "Gracias a Dios siempre hay trabajo asi a hecharle ganas porque uno se recomiendo con su trabajo", el invertira este credito en la compra de material para la elaboracion de puertas, ventanas y protecciones.

el espera que con esta inversion su negocio de mejores resultado y tener mas clientes para que las ganancias aumenten y asi poder dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y poder darles la oportunidad de tener una carrera.

los demas integrantes son

Crecencia-abarrotes 
Deodora-ropa 
joel abarrotes
Arturo-carpinteria
Alberta-antojitos mexicanos
Rosa-venta de antojitos
juana venta de cosmeticos 
amelia venta de pollo
rosalia venta de antojitos mexicanos
texts.en:
This group is comprised of ten people, and each one of them has a different business activity.  This group is known for being very united, happy, and hard-working.

Juaquin, age 38, is one of the members of this group.  He attended school until the third year of secondary school.  He is married to Silvia, and they have two children who go to elementary school.  Juaquin says that as he did not have the opportunity to study, he learned the trade of being a blacksmith.  He did this in order to get his family ahead and to give them a better quality of life.

A little more than four years ago he set up a small blacksmith business on the patio of his house.  He does jobs there like doors, windows, and protections.  He works by orders because he has had his business for several years, and he has a lot of customers.

He says, “Thank God there is always work to jump into wholeheartedly because one is recommended by their work.”

He will use the loan to buy material to make the doors, windows, and protections.  He hopes that with this investment his business will have better results, and he will have more customers.  Then his earnings will increase, and he will be able to give his children a better quality of life.  He will also be able to give then the opportunity to have a career.

The other members are:

Crecencia-Groceries
Deodora-Clothes
Joel-Groceries
Arturo-Carpentry
Alberta-Mexican snacks
Rosa-Sells snacks
Juana-Sells cosmetics
Amelia-Sells chicken
Rosalia-Sells Mexican snacks

loans.use: to buy a solderer and sheeting.

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es: El señor Eleodoro es cliente antiguo que esta en su  sexta secuencia de su crédito es puntual responsable en su préstamo vive en la ciudad de La Paz, el Sr. Eleodoro es sastre tiene su taller  en su misma casa los trabajos  lo realiza también a domicilio. Tiene tres hijos que están en edad escolar sus hijos también  le ayudan en  la actividad de su padre así también aprenden el oficio del Padre. El préstamo lo invertirá en  compra de tela por rollo ya que tiene pedidos que abastecer el realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad por este motivo tienen mucha clientela, se siente muy feliz y agradecido ya que gracias a la institución creció en su negocio, el deseo del Sr. es el ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleodoro is a long-standing customer who is in his sixth loan cycle.  He is punctual and responsible with his loan payments.  He lives in the city of La Paz where he has his tailor workshop set up in his home.  He also provides his service door-to-door.  He has three school-aged children who help him in the business.  Eleodoro also learned the trade from his father.  

He plans to use the loan to buy fabric in rolls since he has orders to fill.  His work is of top quality and therefore he has many customers.  He is content and grateful to the institution because it has helped him grow.  His goal is to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fabric in rolls.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Akech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans,sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.en:
Mireya is a very young woman, she lives in Villa de G. Nuevo León and has 3 small children. She started her own business because her husband could not find a job that allows him to cover all the family’s basic needs. Her business is based on groceries sales and the number of clients is increasing day by day. At the moment Mireya is expecting a baby, and this motivates her to continue expanding her business and in this way, to increase her income. She wants to offer her children an education and a better quality of life, so that they can be responsible and hard-working people in the future. At present, she and her husband are paying for the house they are living in and this makes their economic situation more difficult.

Mireya requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise so that she can increase the amount of products in her business. She and her family require your support to continue having an income to cover all her children and the next baby’s needs.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Mireya es una mujer muy joven, vive en Villa de G. Nuevo León y tiene 3 hijos pequeños. Inició su negocio debido a que su esposo no puede encontrar trabajo que le permita cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia; su negocio consiste en la venta de abarrotes y cada día sus clientes van aumentando. Hoy en día Mireya se encuentra esperando un bebé y esto la motiva para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos. Ella desea ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida, que les permita ser personas responsables y trabajadoras. En la actualidad ella y su esposo se encuentran pagando la casa donde viven y esto hace más difícil su situación económica.

Mireya requiere de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y de este modo incrementar la capacidad de productos en su negocio. Ella y su familia requieren de tu apoyo para seguir teniendo un ingreso y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y del próximo bebé.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy N. who has 6 months training before she  opened her business in the year 2004. She is 32 year old, married with four children. An $800 loan will will enable her to  expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sales

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.en:
Maria Angelica is the mother of eight. She has been separated from her husband for 10 years. Since then she has supported her children and provided for their education by selling cleaning supplies and cosmetics. She sells at markets and has set up another stand which one of her children can tend. Through hard work and the good service she offers her customers she has managed to stay in business, and now she would like a loan in the amount of $200 to buy the supplies she uses to mix her cleaning supplies which she will sell at the new stand. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. You can play an important role in the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. They very much appreciate your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Angélica es madre de 8 hijos, y esta separada de su esposo desde hace 10 años, en aquel tiempo ella inició su negocio de venta de productos de limpieza y cosméticos, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera darles sustento y educación a sus hijos, actualmente trabaja en los mercados rodantes y ha conseguido otro puesto para que lo atenderá uno de sus hijos.

El buen servicio que ofrecer Maria y su esfuerzo le ha permitido estar en el negocio por tanto tiempo, ahora quiere crecer y requiere de un crédito por $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para elaborar más productos de limpieza para surtir el nuevo puesto, ella se compromete a regresar en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te o agradecerán.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit business

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en: Vilayet is an internally displaced person from the Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is 38, married, and has two children. In 1995 he started his clothing business to help meet his family's needs. He started his business with his own resources and some borrowed goods. Over time he increased the volume of his business. Now he is applying to receive $1,000 to expand his business by adding more variety and volume of goods to eventually improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah T. is a strong lady of thirty eight years of age, married with three children. She is very interested in maintaining and growing her plantation business by weeding and planting. Her loan is to be used for buying weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, knives, a spade and an ax. She sells her crops at the market 3 days per week, and gets 220 Tala ($88 US) per day. If it is a very busy day, such as White Sunday or Christmas, she can make up to 350 Tala ($140). She thinks that her next loan will be used to pay for the next year’s tuition for her daughter at the national university.  Her business is going well, and she is very happy and thankful for the loan program.

loans.use: To buy tools for her plantation

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 57 year old man who lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Mohamad owns a grocery store. His wife helps him in the shop. Mohamad is also a tiler who manages construction workshops. This is the 6th time Mohamad is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 to buy the necessary merchandise for the sustainability and development of his grocery store.

loans.use: Mohamad would like to buy the necessary merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf is a 44-year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in the Chouf. Etaf helps support her family. She does crochet work. She needs to buy materiA. to continue producing items. This is the third time Etaf is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet U. is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells drinks and provisions; she has been in LAPO for 8 years and has been involved with her business for 13 years. She needs the loan of $850 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Mahit

texts.en:
Mr. Mahit T. and his wife, Rokiyas Sos, have been married since 2001 and have one son and one daughter. Both husband and wife don’t have their own house and live with their parents. The house is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mahit has been fishing in the Mekong River, to sell fish, since he was young. Besides fishing, he also sells personal beauty products. He bought the products from market in Phnom Penh for resale in the nearby province. His wife has been selling fish since she was ten years old. She bought fish from her village for resale in the nearby village.

Mr. Mahit is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike and for buying personal beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and personal beauty products for resale

loans.name: Chong

texts.en: Chong S. is 38 years old and has lived in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia with her husband since 2002. She has one child who is a student. She works as construction worker building houses. Normally, she makes $2.50 a day of profit per day. Her husband, Mr. Kim Vart, head family, is also a construction worker, but he earns around $4 a day. This couple is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase cement to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase cement to repair the house.

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif lives with his own family in district 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. He has a general store which he started in Kabul one year ago. Before that he was involved in this business in Pakistan. His experience in this business is good, and he would like to expand in Kabul. He is requesting a loan to complete his lease purchase to expand his store and be able to handle more clients.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Fransiska

texts.id:
Fransiska is a lady who owns packed rice business. At this moment Fransiska still stays in a rented room with her 2 school aged children. Fransiska wishes to get the loan help to open a food stall near her rented room, since up to now Fransiska does not have a place to sell her cooked rice. Every day she has to travel around to offer her packed rice from one place to another. She very much hope with DINARI's help this time to be used as capital addition to rent a stall, so that her business could expand. With higher profit, she likes to send her two children to school. At this moment with husband I Nyoman Udayana and 2 children, they live in Kebo Iwa street Denpasar.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Fransiska adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang memiliki usaha jualan nasi bungkus. Saat ini Fransiska masih tinggal di tempat kost dengan harus menanggung 2 orang anaknya yang masih sekolah. Melalui DINARI, Fransiska berkeinginan mendapat bantuan modal usaha untuk membuka warung nasi didekat tempat kostnya, karena sampai saat ini Fransiska belum mempunyai tempat untuk berjualan nasi. Setiapa harinya, dia harus berkeliling menjajakan nasi bungkus, dari satu tempat ke tempat yang lain. Dia sangat berharap, dengan bantuan dari DINARI kali ini, bisa dipakai sebagai modal untuk menyewa tempat berjualan, sehingga nantinya usaha ini bisa lebih berkembang. Dengan keuntungan yang lebih besar, dia ingin menyekolahkan kedua anaknya. Saat ini bersama suaminya I Nyoman Udayana dan ke 2 anaknya, mereka tinggal di Jl. Kebo Iwa Denpasar.

loans.use: To open own Food stall (Membuka warung sendiri)

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Miss Sitha L., 33, is single and lives with her elderly parents and one sister on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her sister has full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Miss Sitha has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia, a 50 year old woman, is married with six children. One is currently in school and five have graduated. Afia is a resourceful mother. She works with the motivation of wanting to support her children's education to provide them with better lives and future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. Afia wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance her accommodation project. She is a member of a community group called God's Love Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Afia was joined by her husband as she took the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Robinah Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a leader of a five-member group. She is 30 years old, married and has two children ages four and eight. Both of her children go to school, and Robinah also takes care of the two children of her late brother. She owns and resides in a three-room house living with six people There is no electricity but it does have running water. The family gets four meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Robinah works six days a week and rents her business space. Her greatest monthly expenses include her rent, school fees, and medication. She is a tailor and also sells new clothes like bitenge and African attire. Robinah sells to an average of five people per day. She uses public transportation to buy her materials from Kampala. Robinah has been in this business for the last eight years.

Robinah has been with MCDT for the last six years and thirteen loans, working all this time with her same groupmates. She wanted to use this loan to invest in a video camera and to add more stock to her retail clothes. She aspires to buy more sewing machines and start a training school.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes and purchase video camera

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is a 60 year married woman with 9 children. She sells palm oil and yams. She buys her yams from the western part of Nigeria while the palm oil is purchased from Delta State. The demand for her yams and palm oil is very high. Palm oil is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups like Banga & Egusi soups. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more yams and palm oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and yams to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Нуруллоева Халима, 1963 года рождения, она за мужем и у нее 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви. У нее 7 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект одежды для младенца, джемпера, носки, спортивная одежда, шапочки и т.д.. Халимы хочет закупить сезонную одежду, куртки, ветровки и пуховики. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Халима хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить детские пухавики.
texts.en:
Halima N. was born in 1963. She is married and has four children. She began her business selling children's shoes and has seven years experience as an entrepreneur. She sells her goods at the Muboriz Gisarski district market. She carries a wide variety of children's clothing for babies and school age children that includes underwear, jumpers, socks, sport clothes, caps, etc. Halima would like to stock up on clothes for the upcoming season, such as warm coats and jackets. She buys her stock at the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva, Halima hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni, in order to stock up on down coats for children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's coats

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El joven  de nombre Julio Cesar B. B. tiene la edad de 30 años su estado civil es casado,  tiene 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 4 años y cursa recientemente el 1 nivel de primaria, su compañera de vida labora en la venta de medicamentos, sus propósitos son crecer en el mercado y predominar de forma que pueda establecerse obteniendo así los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia en sus deseos esta el proporcionarle  a su hijo un futuro de estudios donde pueda desempeñarse y también obtener una casa para su hijo para que el día de mañana no tenga problemas.


Su actividad económica es la venta de medicamentos como lo es: aspirina, sueros, antigripales y otros, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, la forma en como inicia es por cuenta propia  y decide comenzar con 60 productos y la forma en como los realiza es de forma ambulante en las diferentes farmacias de León  y con los ingresos que obtenía de las compras de estos medicamentos es que llega a incrementarse  y es así como recurre a la ayuda de su esposa y ambos trabajan en lo mismo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado en la compra de mas producto por lo que necesita entregar los encargos que recibe y debido a al eficacia que el da por medio de sus servicios es que sus clientes lo prefieren, es por eso que dice estar agradecido con Fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones por brindarle esta ayuda en este financiamiento.
texts.en:
The young man named Julio Cesar B. B. is 30 years old. He is married and he has one son who is 4 years old. He is studying first level of primary school. His life partner works selling medicines. His goal is to grow in the market and establish himself obtaining the necessary income to help his family. Among his desires is to be able to pay the school for this son and provide him with a house so he doesn't need to struggle in the future. His economic activity is the sale of medicines like aspirin, saline solutions, anti-flu among others. He has had this business for 4 years. He is still selling these products the same way now like when he first started. He is a hawker and he sells his products to different pharmacies in the city of León. With the profits from the sales, he was able to grow and then asked his wife for help and now they both sell medicines. The loan will be use as a working capital to buy more products in order to supply the orders he has. Due to the efficacy of his services, his clients prefer him. He is grateful to Foundacion León 2000 and other organizations for helping him get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hoa 33 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào nghề đệt chiếu truyền thống của địa phương. Hiện nay ngoài đệt chiếu, để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chị Hoa còn đi đánh bắt cá, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây. Vì thế hàng tháng gia đình chị đều có mức thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa mong muốn được vay 6.000.000để đầu tư mua thêm 1 chiếc thuyền nhỏ phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Hoa is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 young children in the District of Quang Xuong in the town of Thanh Hoa. In 2006 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the business of weaving sedge mats, a tradition in this region. In addition to weaving mats, to increase their income she also fishes and her husband is a construction worker. Therefore, every month her family has the ability to bring in a stable income of 187 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 375 USD to buy another small boat for her fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fishing business

loans.name: Muazam

texts.ru:
Саидова Муазам 1956 года рождения, вдова, имеет 4 иждивенцев. Начала свой бизнес 1994 году. Она занимается торговлей детскими одеждами. В бизнес ей помогает дочка. Муаззам  закупают товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон», реализует на рынке "Шохмансур" города Душанбе. Ассортимент ее товара состоит из зимних брючек, футболок, курточек и шапочек. Время от времени она сама привозит товар из Бишкека. 
Муззам хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, чтоб закупить детских пуловер и брюк.
texts.en:
Muazam S., born in 1956, is a widow with four dependents. She began her business in 1994, and trades in children's clothing. Her daughter assists her with the business. Muazam buys goods at the Korvon wholesale market and sells them at the Shohmansur market in the city of Dushanbe. Her goods range from winter pants to shirts, jackets and caps. From time to time she herself brings goods from Bishkek. In order to buy children's pullovers and pants, Muazam hopes to receive assistance from Kiva in the form of a 6-month loan of 3500 somoni

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's pullovers and pants

loans.name: Manrique Zamir

texts.es:
El señor Manrique V. es originario de la ciudad  de Chinandega donde se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería atendido muy amablemente por él mismo.

Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para llevar a cabo la compra de la mercadería. Es importante destacar que con este crédito logra salir adelante ya que compra los productos para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Manrique V. is from the city of Chinandega where he works very hard as he himself kindly attends to his grocery store. These days, with a lot of effort, his business has been moving forward and for this he has come to Ceprodel to be benefited by a loan to carry out the purchase of merchandise. It is important to emphasize that with this loan he will be able to move forward since he buys products for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 48 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas mayores en edad Escolar Secundaria. Se iniciò en la actividad de ventas ambulantes hace cinco años, cuenta con una camioneta de carga, en la cual realiza diariamente sus ventas, por los barrios de San Lorenzo, Villa Elisa, Fdo. De la Mora y Ñemby. 

El credito será destinado a la compra de las mercaderias ya mencionadas mas arriba y de esta forma cumplir con la demanda actual.  Siempre hay mas interes en sus productos alrededor de la semana santa. La Sra Rosa sueña con poder adquirir un vehicula de mayor porte y ampliar sus zonas de venta.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa I. is a 48-year-old single mother with two daughters in high school. She started her street vending business five years ago. She has her own cargo van out of which she sells her products throughout the San Lorenzo, Villa Elisa, Fdo. De la Mora and Ñemby neighborhoods.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can meet customer demand. Her products are quite popular around Holy Week. Ms. Rosa dreams of getting a bigger vehicle and expanding her sales area.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, plastic bags, cheese, and cornmeal

loans.name: Taeni

texts.en:
Taeni S. sells food supplies like groundnuts and plastic rubbers at Abura, and has done so since 2007. 

Taeni is married and has two children. She received no formal education. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Taeni uses her income to assist her husband with their housekeeping expenses. 

Taeni will use the loan to purchase additional food supplies and  plastic rubbers to meet an increase in demand of her supplies by her costumers. Taeni plans to reinvest the new profits in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies like groundnuts and rubbers to meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima W. est un commerçant.  Il est marie et il habite au quartier Cité Lamy à Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Il a commence son petit commerce depuis 1989.  Son activité consiste à vendre la pate d’arachide, de l’huile de palme et du gombo en poudre en gros et en détail.  Avec ce prêt il va acheter 250 kg d’arachide, 150 kg de gombo en poudre, 50 litres de l’huile de palme, et transport.  Avec ses marchandises il veut renforcer son activité dont les revenues lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima W. is a businessman. He is married and lives in the Cité Lamy district in Thiès, a town 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He began his little business in 1989. His business consists in selling peanut butter, palm oil, and powdered okra, wholesale and retail. With this loan he is going to buy 250 kg of peanuts, 150 kg of powdered okra, 50 liters of palm oil, and pay for transport. With this merchandise, he will be able to bolster his business whose income allows him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts, palm oil, and powdered okra

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Husein has been doing cladding work for fourteen years. Husein requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cladding for his work. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. 
Husien is special because of his experience. Husein decided on doing his businesses because he wants the best for his family. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Джумаев Абдуджалил проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 39 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли продуктов питания. Имеет Торговую точку , где продает конфеты и другие виды товаров. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент . Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и таким образом развивать свой бизнес. В месяц Абдуджаллил получает около 900 сомони прибыли.
texts.en:
J. Abdujalil lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 39 years old, is married and has four children. He provides for his family by selling food products. He has a sales location where he sells candy and other products. He plans to get credit in order to increase his product assortment. This will help him to attract new customers and to grow his business that way. Abdujalil earns around 900 somoni a month.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
"I have been tilling my farm for 20 years already. I started farming in 1989. Until now, I till my farm to be able to support the needs of our home. My harvest is what I use to buy our personal needs and the tuition for school. My dream is to acquire another hectare of farm to support my family more", says Jenelyn L., a 41-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will really help her improve her farm all the more.

Now, CEVI is helping her sustain her business more. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose T. is the leader of the Kakunama II Twetungure group in Ibanda. She is a friendly, determined and hardworking lady. Rose is married with six children in secondary and primary school. She also cares for four orphans.

Rose has had a retail shop as her business for eight years and although she tries so hard to make it stand, she faces the challenge of bad debtors that take goods and then fail or take a very long to pay back. She is able to make 140,000 UGX in profits per month due to the good products and good customer care that keeps attracting more and more customers. Rose has a dream of expanding her business further so that she can have a very happy family in the future. She needs another loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, bread and so on.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, and married with one young child. To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlinda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
la sra. EVA JULIA R. AGUILAR se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tambien tiene unos cuartos que los alquila, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 13 años, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos  que le genera este negocio cubre todos sus gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos, doña julia es bien conocida por la activiadad que ella realiza ya que sus 
ricas y calientitas tortillas son bien apetecidas por su clientela ya que las consumen a todas horas, este es un aliemento basico en la dieta de los catrachos. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas y asi tener mayores ganancias. la meta de ella es poder tener muchos cuartos para alquilar, porque ella se siente cansada y quiere pasar su vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Eva Julia R. Aguilar makes and sells tortillas. She also owns a few rooms, which she has been renting out for the past 13 years. She is a widow and has 2 sons. With the income generated by her work she covers all of her family's expenses as well as any debts she may have acquired. Doña Julia is well-known for her warm, delicious tortillas, which are demanded by her customers at all hours of the day. Tortillas are a basic food amongst Hondurans. Doña Julia needs this loan in order to purchase more raw materials so that she may make more tortillas, and by doing so increase her earnings. Her goal is to be able to own more rooms to rent, because she is feeling tired from her work with the tortillas, and wishes to live more calmly in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de maiz, agua, cal, leña

loans.name: Sérénité Plus Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse Mangwahu 44 ans est dirigeante du groupe dénommé « Sérénité Plus » qui s’est constituée solidairement en vue de recevoir des prêts auprès de Hope Kinshasa RDC. 
Thérèse est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise depuis 1996 avec un capital initial de $50. Elle est parvenue à stabiliser son affaire grâce à un travail rigoureux et en réinvestissant les bénéfices accumulés. Son activité se situe dans un quartier périphérique et le plus peuplé au nord de Kinshasa. Elle a reçu trois fois les crédits de Hope qu’elle a remboursé totalement et à temps. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une quincaillerie pour desservir la population de son quartier qui effectue de longues distances pour trouver des pièces qu’elle a besoin. L’appui financier à travers des crédits de Kiva par Hope RDC l’aide à faire prospérer son activité et à réaliser progressivement son rêve. Aujourd’hui, son affaire lui génère hebdomadairement un bénéfice de $30. Elle compte acheter avec le prochain prêt une quantité de clous à revendre en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice. Thérèse est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 1 et 23 ans. Six d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Thérèse Mangwahu, age 44, is the leader of the group named "Sérénité Plus", which was established in solidarity with the aim of receiving loans from HOPE Kinshasa RDC. Thérèse entered the micro-enterprise world in 1996 with $50 in initial capital. She managed to stabilize her business, thanks to rigorous work while reinvesting the accumulated profits. Her business is located in an outlying district and the most populated north of Kinshasa. Thérèse received a loan three times from HOPE, and she totally repaid them and on time. Her ambition is to open a hardware store to serve the people in her district who travel far to find items they need. Financial support through Kiva loans via HOPE RDC is helping her to make her business prosper and, progressively, to realize her dream. Today, her business generates $30 in profit for her weekly. With the next loan, she intends to buy a quantity of nails to resell with the aim of growing her profit. Thérèse is married and the mother of eight children varying in age from 1 to 23. Six of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a quantity of nails to resell in order to increase her profit

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a member of the Upendo East borrower group n Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 13,7,3 years.

Farida started her own clothing business selling clothes 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Farida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,farida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Candelarias Group

texts.es:
En la zona Collpani de la ciudad de El Alto, se encuentra el Centro Focal del mismo nombre, que agrupa a varias mujeres de escasos recursos y apoyarles brindándoles servicios de capacitación, atención en salud, ahorro y crédito, para que puedan mejorar su calidad de vida. Candelarias es un grupo de 13 mujeres que se agruparon hace cuatro años aproximadamente para acceder al préstamo e invertir en sus negocios.
Diferentes son los negocios de las integrantes de Candelarias como la venta de comida, dulces, cosméticos, juguetes, otras se dedican a actividades económicas de producción como la confección de deportivos. Ellas requieren del préstamo  para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
In the Collpani region of the city of El Alto you will find the Communal Center of the same name. Various women of scarce resources gather for support offered through training, health services, and savings and loans so that they can improve their quality of life. Candelarias is a group of 13 women who got together approximately four years ago to get access to loans and invest in their businesses. The members of Candelarias have different businesses like selling food, sweets, cosmetics, and toys. Others are involved in production like making warm-up suits. She needs a loan to buy merchandise and raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La socia María, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene  32 años de edad, es natural de Lares, nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un restaurante al cual se dedica el día entero, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su restaurante e implementarlo.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member María, belongs to the communal bank “LLANKAY HUAYNA,” located in the sacred valley of the Incas in the Urubamba province.

Our member is 32 years old, native of Lares, a partner and has 5 children. María alternates from household work and retail commerce. María has a restaurant where she works all day and requests the loan to reinvest in and make use of her restaurant.

This member values and is thankful for the loan awarded by this resource and likewise will undertake to carry out with the payment of her dues in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinvest in and manage her restaurant

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan runs a small cafeteria in the central marketplace of his home town of Vinogradovo. It’s a small town in Western Ukraine. There are few nice places to eat that combine good food and pleasant environment. Ivan’s cafeteria is an affordable café where one can always expect a decent meal at a reasonable price. Ivan has been working in the sphere of catering for 10 years. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas in working capital. His income amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Ivan is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase new quality tables for his cafeteria. He wants to create a nice and welcoming atmosphere in his café to attract new potential customers. One of Ivan’s big dreams is to open a pizza place some day.

loans.use: to purchase new cafeteria tables

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. She has run Glory Chemist for three years. Her business is located at a strategic point in her neighborhood and she is able to employ one person. She is requesting a loan for KES 20,000 to purchase a computer for data entry.

Christine believes that she has the potential to raise herself to a higher standard of living and, from Faulu, she says she has learnt the importance of saving. Her dream is to open a clinic.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, sugar, ramen noodles, chicken, and beans

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: This is Adoracion S., 44, from Pasay City. She is an itinerant vendor of anything that goes with the season. She buys and sells everything from candies and other food items to small toys for kids. She endures the daily strain of buying all her stuff from the commercial district and carrying it all by herself. Her inspiration for doing this hard work is her six children. She has two college students, another two in high school and one in grade school. She also sells electronic load credits for mobile phones. From all of this, she earns a monthly net income of close to 12,000 Philippine pesos, at least enough to make both ends meet along with her husband’s income. Her husband, Leonardo, 45, works as a personal driver. Adoracion joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) credit cooperative in 2004. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P17,000. This would be her 13th loan. She will use the funds to purchase more toy items in line with the holiday season. She also wishes to own a computer shop and an Internet cafe. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Purchase toy items to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario Gabriel, Jr. is from Iligan City. He is 29 years old. Mario is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mario is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey S. was born in 1944 and was married a long time ago to Mr. Sovann, age 54. They now have eight children. Four of their children are married and have already established new homes, and the remaining four are single and are employed in different occupations. 

To make a living, Srey S. sells a few groceries from her home. She can generate $3 per day to help cover her family’s financial needs. In addition, Srey S. and her husband also make Khmer noodles at home for extra profits. 

Srey S. will use her first loan to build up a grocery inventory to sell. With the the rest of loan, she will plant a rice crop.

Srey S. was busy at her business when the photograph was taken, so her husband appears in the picture in her place.

loans.use: To accumulate a grocery inventory

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: La señora Adilia E. M., tiene 35 años de edad, ella con su compañero de vida habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, el señor trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura apoyando de manera económica a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 4 hijos los cuales todos estudian la escuela primaria estando bajo su dominio, ella trabaja como domestica, dentro de las principales necesidades que presenta la familia está el realizar mejoras en el hogar que le resguarde la seguridad de la familia y la comodidad de todos es por esto que solicita este crédito para la construcción de una pared lateral al lado este de su casa de aproximadamente 2 metros para ir poco a poco avanzando en las remodelaciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Adilia E. M., 35, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her life partner. He works in an auto detailing shop and contributes to the household expenses. They have four children, all of whom are in elementary school and under her care. She works as a domestic. One of the family's main needs is to improve the security and comfort of their home. She is requesting funding to build a 2-meters-high wall on the east side of her house in order to continue forward with home improvements step by step.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Information removed at borrower's request

loans.use: To buy fabrics and soaps

loans.name: Lucia Evarista

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Evarista M. Matute está ubicado en la comarca sabana la villa municipio Achuapa donde se dedica a la actividad  ganadera por medio de la crianza de ganado.
Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaquilla y un semental para mejorar su hato ganadero y extraer la leche de la vaquilla para comercializarla y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is located in the savannah area of the Achuapa municipality, where she earns a living in livestock by raising cattle.

She is requesting a loan to buy a heifer and a stud to improve her heard and to milk the cow and sell it to benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su deseo es ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero y aportar para los gastos de su familia. Por ello, todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para lograr que sus papas, choclos y alverjas tengan los cuidados necesarios para que sean rápidamente comprados en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad dependen sus ingresos. Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. 
Para más adelante, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Javier con MFP y sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Javier is 24 years old, and is an unassuming and hardworking youth. He lives in his parents' home, and what he most desires is to succeed in life. He wants to become independent and earn his own money and contribute to the household expenses. To do this, each morning from the early hours he works on his fields to cultivate his potatoes, corn and peas to give them the necessary care so they can be quickly brought to market. What he likes most about his job is to plant, since he knows that his income depends on this activity. He has been farming for 7 years, and what he considers most difficult is to care for his crops when there are abrupt changes in the weather that affect his productivity. In the future he hopes to buy more land to increase his production. This is Javier's 8th loan with MFP, and he knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial to the development of his business. In his communal bank he is a very responsible member, and as a result is well-respected. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested he will buy pea seeds, fertilizer and insecticides so that he can have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Javier Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Javier Ernesto D. O., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempaña como Electricista, es Acompañado y habita en la colonia gracsa.

El señor Javier D. solicito el crédito para repara el techo de su casa y poner piso. Lleva ya dos créditos con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Javier works as an electrician in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and lives in the Gracsa neighborhood. He is requesting this loan in order to repair the roof on his home and install a floor. He has had two previous loans with CEPRODEL and he has proven to be a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Ahtai

texts.en:
Ahtai, 36 years old, lives with his wife and four children in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. All four of his children are between the ages of 15 and 10 years old and attend a local secondary school. Ahtai is an experienced driver who, since 1997, has operated a truck transportation business carrying packages twice a month to Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, earning 1,200,000 tugrugs ( ~ 880 USD) for transporting five tons of packages there. On his way to Taikeshken he also carries flour to his other provincial customers and on his return trip transports other packages from Taikeshken.

Having developed a stable business, Ahtain is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug (~ 1755 USD) loan to purchase a trailer with an eight-ton capacity which, according to his calculations, will help to increase his profit by 50%. An energetic person who has a great business mind, he says, “I would like to save my business profit to purchase a car which will be comfortable to use in the city.”

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Résurrection Plus Group

texts.en:
Mamie B., aged 50, is the president of the Community Bank “Résurrection Plus”, which is composed of 23 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through its partner, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Mamie is married and has five children aged between 13 and 31, three of whom go to school. In 2002, Mamie started a business selling smoked and salted fish at the market located west of Kinshasa city. She is a loyal client of Kiva partner, HOPE RDC, and has already received five loans and repaid them properly. 
As demand for fish is high in her community, she intends to use her next loan to increase her stock of fish for resale with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $100. Mamie's ambition is to open a storage facility.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is from the village of Catugan, Lallo, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilyn is married and has 2 infant children. Marilyn owns & operates a piggery, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell

loans.name: Ngoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoeun N. is 30 years old and a villager in Kantuot Thum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Thea Ros, is a construction foreman who earns a small income to support his family. For her husband's business, Mrs. Ngoeun N. is now requesting a loan to purchase metal. This couple has a child who is just three years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase metal

loans.name: Ollan

texts.en:
Ollan I. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Ollan owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fruits such as watermelon in the local community. Ollan has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Ollan joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ollan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes is 41 years old. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 6 and 22. All the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 20 years and has employed one farm-hand. Her products are maize, beans, tomatoes and vegetables which she sells locally. She also earns income from her tailoring services and from selling second-hand clothes at the local market.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of a market and better prices for her products and the high cost of production.

Enes has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a good quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will assist her in paying school fees for her children.

She hopes to purchase and develop a plot of land to have rental houses and own business premises in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Faustina viaja 2 veces a la semana a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados y luego los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho con carro alquilado. Además Faustina hace papa seca en su casa y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Faustina solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño hace 15 años aproximadamente y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro además que aprendió a ser responsable.
Los sueños de Faustina son que sus hijos salgan adelante con su profesión y tener una tienda en su casa, porque los viajes son cansados.
texts.en:
Faustina is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She goes to area markets twice a week to buy various cereal grains that she transports to the city of Ayacucho in a rented cart. She also dries potatoes at home that she then sells in the city's Abasto market. Faustina is applying for a 3000-soles loan that she will use to buy wheat and barley. Faustina has been a member of the Retono community bank for about 15 years and what she most likes are the incentives for saving and learning to be responsible with money. Faustina's greatest hopes are that her children find steady work and that she have a shop in her house so that she no longer has to take exhausting trips back and forth.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Verónica Mercedes

texts.es:
Verónica Mercedes C. F., tiene 26 años.  Estado civil union libre  y vive con los hijos y con el compañero, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos, Darling  (10), Andy (9) y Erick (5).

Verónica es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Verónica se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y  fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y tener un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta vender productos por medio de revista.
texts.en:
Verónica Mercedes C. F. is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her children and companion in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. The names of her three children are Darling (age 10), Andy (age 9), and Erick (age 5).

Verónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This is the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San José.

Verónica is a farmer who grows rice and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Peña commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include buying a car and opening a business in Ventanas. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Verónica enjoys products that are sold through magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice and beans

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Dorka is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 (Divine Hope). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her young child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house.  In the meantime, she enjoys being with her child at home.

Dorka is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for over 5 years, starting with some savings she had and making the plan to start a business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear, pants and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save to start building her house in the near future. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she like how the loans work, the group, the community and the opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear, pants and accessories

loans.name: Fabio Benito

texts.es:
Fabio tiene la edad de 28 años, casado, tiene un trabajo fijo como supervisor técnico electrónico desde hace cuatro años, y ha  logrado el alquiler de dos cuartos con lo que se ha ayudado económicamente, su esposa le tiene un hijo el cual desea dar estudios.
Los cuartos los construyo en sociedad con su familia. Así mismo trabaja en el negocio de la familia en la reparación y supervisión de celulares.

Con este préstamo lograra comprar materiales en la reparación de celulares como: compra de fuente de poder digital, pistola de color weller, juego de desarmadores, multimetros digital, cautil estación para soldador.
Lo que vendrá a dar un mejor servicio con nuevas herramientas ya que no cuentan con ellas. Y que gracias al financiamiento otorgado por Afodenic están obteniendo herramientas necesarias para su pequeño negocio familiar que vendrá hadar un giro diferente en la producción.
texts.en:
Fabio, 28, is married and has had a regular job working as an electronics technician supervisor for 4 years. He has managed to rent 2 rooms, which has helped him economically. With his wife he has a son, and he wants to provide him with an education. The rooms were built in partnership with his family. He also works in the family business supervising and repairing cellular phones. With this loan, he will buy materials to repair cellular phones, such as: digital power supplies, a Weller heat gun, a set of screwdrivers, digital multimeters, and soldering iron. He will be able to provide better service with these new tools, which he does not currently have. Thanks to the loan granted by AFODENIC, they are getting the tools they need for their small family business, which will allow them to take their business in a new direction.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to repair cell phones, such as: digital power supplies, heat guns, a screwdriver set, and other items needed for the business

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: H. Tham L. is a 36-year-old farmer who has two children in secondary school. Her main activity is growing rice in a 2,500-square-meter paddy. She also raises pigs and has 4 sows which produce piglets for her to sell. Every two months, she is abL. to sell piglets to earn money to support her family. She has been successfully repaying credit loans from our program since 2004. She is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to improve her pigsties.

loans.use: To improve pigsties

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a 10-year-old daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, in the southern part of Ukraine. Tatyana sells children’s clothes in the local market called ‘Privoz’. Her kiosk is well-known for regular additions of trendy merchandise, as well as her reasonable pricing policy and wise customer service. Tatyana is an experienced market vendor – she has been in the trade for 11 years. 

Presently, Tatyana has 25,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 12,000 Grivnyas a month. Tatyana is requesting a 4,500 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and improve selection of products for sale in her kiosk.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise in her kiosk

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Omar Antonio M. L.  el es Trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad  tiene  cinco  años de trabajar en esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Omar Antonio M. L. is an active worker of the San Rafael del Sur municipal government.  He has worked as a security guard for five years.  He is married and has a school aged child.  

He has had four loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been for the purchase of construction materials to improve his house.  The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him very much because he has been able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (sand, cement, quarry stone)

loans.name: Angela
