texts.es: Ángela tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio ella es una persona muy emprendedora. Inicia con ahorros propios pues la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos y familiares y ciertas personas que recurren de su actividad. La mayoría de veces sale a vender todos los días los diferentes productos ya que tiene una gran variedad de encargos, pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan por medio del catalogo es que ellos deciden lo que más les gusta.
texts.en: Ángela is 41 years old and has been selling cosmetics for more than three years.  She is a very enterprising individual.  Ángela started her business using her own savings.  Most of her customers are neighbors, relatives, and other people who do repeat business with her.  She sells different products every day since she keeps a wide variety.  Many customers place orders through the catalog since they must look through it until they decide what they like most.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, es conviviente 23 años, es madre de 5 hijos, la mayor tiene 22 años y la ultima 3 años; se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor como son plátano, yuca, nony y carambola, trabaja en el mercado Basilio Auqui este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años.
La dificultad que se le presenta es cuando se le malogran las frutas, y cuando la venta baja, porque la mercaderia se le queda y se malogra.
Modesta se siente feliz de ser socia de Finca Perú por que gracias a ello se capacita y aprende más. El sueño de Modesta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder aumentar su capital para poder tener más productos.
texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Nueva Vida Communal Bank.  She has been in a common law union for 23 years and has five children, ages 22 through three years old.  

She has worked in the Basilio Auqui market for ten years where she sells banana, yuca, nony and carambola wholesale.  Her main problem arises when the fruit goes bad due to slow sales.  Modesta is happy to be a member of Finca Perú because she feels she has gained empowerment and can continue learning more and more.  Modesta's dream is to provide professional training for her children and to increase her capital in order to acquire more products.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es una orgullosa madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellos: Marco, de 11 años de edad. A quien educa y cría en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Palca. Como madre soltera, ella afirma que tienen más fuerzas y vitalidad para salir adelante. “Tengo que trabajar al doble y ser el ejemplo de mis hijos”, afirma. Con esfuerzo y dedicación logró sacar adelante a la mayoría de sus hijos, ya que la agricultura es su principal sustento. Sus sembríos de papa, arvejas y demás hortalizas, le proporcionan buenos ingresos, en cada campaña de cosecha. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, y los compradores mayoristas del mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, la conocen por ser una mujer luchadora y optimista. Pero, para sustentar la educación universitaria de sus demás hijos, ella hace 2 años, comenzó a vender agua de manzana, y demás bebidas a base de harina de maca y soya, los que acompaña con porciones de pan, este negocio le genera muchas ganancias, y ahora quiere acondicionar su puesto de venta, para que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal, se siente muy feliz de todo el apoyo que recibe por su banco comunal. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, para su cultivo de papa. Como también comprará quintales de harina para su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old.  She is a proud single mother of 4 children but currently only lives with one of them: Marco, aged 11.  She educates and raises her son in her own home which is located in the town of Palca.  As a single mother, she confirms that she has a lot of strength and vitality for getting ahead in life.  “I have to work twice as hard and be an example for my children” she comments.

Through her hard work and determination, she has managed to get most of her children ahead in life, since farming is her main support.  She grows potatoes, peas and other vegetables which make her a good income each harvest season.  Carmen has been in this business for 5 years and the wholesale purchasers in the central market of the city of Tarma know her as a determined and optimistic woman.

However, in order to support the university education of her other children, two years ago Carmen also started selling sweetened apple water and other drinks made from 'maca' flour and soya flour which she sells together with pieces of bread.  This business is very profitable and now she would like to adapt her sales stall so that her customers feel comfortable.

This is Carmen's third loan with MFP and she feels very happy for all the support which her community bank has provided her with.  She is planning to use her loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop.  She will also buy 100kg sacks of flour for her business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and 100kg sacks of flour

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Baara  est un regroupement de dix femmes toutes mariées dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles ont   une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, de 3 enfants et résident dans le quartier Heremakono-Nord, de la ville  de BOUGOUNI,(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt MARIAM D., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Baara is a gathering of 10 women, each married in a traditional extended family with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husband. They have a median age of 26, an average of 3 children and live in the Heremakono-Nord neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (in the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali). They met one another through business connections.

With the intention of buying more goods, the women of Baara decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan, the previous loan having been properly repaid.

With this loan, Mariam D., the group's president, intends to buy a large quantity of different sorts of spices from wholesalers. She makes her sales in cash and on credit to a client base of men and women.

With this loan, Mariam plans to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used for the business and the rest for the education expenses of their children.

loans.use: Buying spices

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su hermana y su hijo Jonathan, posee casa propia, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo ha ubicado en la cochera de su casa desde hace 5 años donde ofrece artículos y productos de primera necesidad en cada hogar como bebidas, boquitas y granos básicos (arroz, café, frijoles) entre otros que le soliciten los clientes.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar bebidas refrescantes, con esta ayuda tendrá una compra oportuna ya que se acerca la navidad y las bebidas refrescantes no pueden faltar en cada hogar que celebra la noche buena.
Su objetivo es mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y por mismo aumentar sus ganancias para el hogar.
texts.en:
Jenny is 36 years old.  She lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department, with her sister and her son Jonathan.  She has her own home and her business is selling convenience store items.  She has had her business for 5 years and it is located in her garage.  She offers her customers household essentials such as drinks, snacks, basic grains (rice, coffee, beans), as well as other products that her customers request.

Jenny is currently requesting a loan to buy soft drinks.  This will be a timely purchase for her since Christmas is approaching and soft drinks are always present in every household which is celebrating Christmas Eve.  Her goal is to improve her business' profitability and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny vive en casa alquilada con sus hijos en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como secretaria en el ministerio de trabajo donde percibe un sueldo que no es muy alto, por tal razón ella se dedica a la venta de calzados, ropa, cosméticos, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más calzados, ropa y cosméticos  y de esta manera mantener estable su negocio.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro. El análisis socio económico indica que es sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Jenny lives in a rented home with her children in the 14 de Septiembre zone of the city of La Paz. She works as a secretary in the Ministry of Labour, where she receives a salary that is not very high. This is why she sells shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc. The requested loan is to increase her capital, buying more shoes, clothing and cosmetics. This way, she will be able to keep her business stable.

This is her first loan from Impro. The socio-economic analysis indicates that she can receive a loan.

loans.use: the purchase of more shoes, clothing and cosmetics for her business in which she sells these items.

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. Torrechayoc II” ya tiene dos años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres y  varones, los socios son personas  trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Urubamba departamento del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad D. Urubamba y se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas.   
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunas D. los socios son por ejemplo; venta D. comestibles, venta D. golosinas y confitería, venta D. panes y pasteles, venta D. Omnilife y venta D. ropa. Otros socios son profesores.
  
Edelmira, tiene 45 años y nació en el distrito D. Urubamba provincia del Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Edelmira  es profesora y trabaja en el colegio “C.E. 50877” D. la ciudad D. Maras. Maras se encuentra a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. Edelmira desea invertir dinero del préstamo para uso personal y no especifico para que exactamente.
texts.en:
The "Señor D. Torrechayoc II" communal bank is two years old and is maD. up of women and men.  The members are hard-working entrepeneurs who seek out every opportunity to get ahead and, through their efforts, proviD. a better future for their children.  The communal bank meets every month in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  Most of the members live in Urubamba and work in different business activities.
 
The various activities incluD. sales of food, sweets, bread, pastry, Omnilife and clothing.  Some of the members are teachers.
  
Edelmira is 45 years old and was born in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Perú.  She is a teacher at "C.E. 50877" school in the city of Maras.  Maras is about 15 minutes from Urubamba.  She has been teaching for a long time and enjoys it very much.  Edelmira plans to use the loan for personal use which she has not specified.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Maisha Plus Group

texts.en:
Albert O., aged 36, is the leader of the community bank named “Maisha Plus”, which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

Albert started his business in 2000 selling miscellaneous items. He now operates a drugstore in the mid-eastern part of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE DRC, having already received seven different loans and repaid them properly. Albert intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by his customers and to resell them to increase his profits. Albert's business brings in a weekly profit of $40. His ambition is to expand his business by opening a medical center. Albert has two children, 1 week old and 18 months old.

loans.use: to purchase medicine

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Dame  Akpéné  a  39 ans et    mariée.  Elle a 3 enfants   à charge.  Pour améliorer  les conditions de  vie de ses enfants, elle  fait  le commerce  de  produit  générique. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana  à Accra  et  revend  en face  du bar  Madibar à Adidogomé.  Elle  demande un prêt pour  se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akpéné is 39 years old and married. She is responsible for 3 children. 

In order to improve her children's living conditions, she sells generic items. She gets her supplies in Ghana in Accra. She then resells them in front of the bar Madibar in Adidogomé. 

She is requesting a loan to refill her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of generic items

loans.name: Ada Mariel

texts.es:
Ada, nació en Yali un municipio del departamento de Jinotega, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a  vender tortilla. Debido a que en su hogar  no contaba con lo recursos económicos necesarios para poder estudiar solo logro terminar el sexto grado de primaria.
Inicio  a los 15 años de edad a trabajar  con su mama en el negocio de tortillas, aunque es originaria de Yali tiene mas de 20 años de vivir en el departamento de Estelí, al cumplir 23 años se independizo de su mama , comenzó ella sola con su propio negocio de vender tortillas después recibió apoyo de su tía que vive en los Estados Unidos . Anteriormente vendía nacatamales pero ahora solo se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, las cuales distribuye en su barrio. Le gustaría que su producto se diera a conocer en ferias centrales y supermercados de Estelí.  
Solicita el crédito  para construir  un cuarto, comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, ya que ahí es donde tiene su puesto de venta de tortilla, porque actualmente su construcción esta hecha de madera y ripios materiales muy viejos, quiere atraer mas clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Le gustaría brindar empleos a otras madres solteras que como ella aprendan  a ganarse la vida honradamente y preparar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria y no sufran como le sucedió a ella por no estudiar, pues lo primordial como madre es darle una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ada was born in Yali, a town in Jinotega department.  She is 30 years old, a single mother, and has three children.  Her business is selling tortillas.  Owing to the fact that her family didn't have enough money for her to study, she only managed to finish sixth grade in elementary school.

Ada started making tortillas with her mom at the age of 15.  Although she is originally from Yali, she has been living in Estelí for more than 20 years.  When she was 23 years old, she started working independently from her mom.  She started out in her own business selling tortillas after having received support from her aunt who lives in the United States.  Ada used to sell 'nactamales' (Nicaraguan tamales) but now she solely makes and sells tortillas which she distributes in her neighborhood.  Ada would like her products to become known in the central markets and supermarkets of Estelí.

Ada is requesting this loan so that she can build a room.  She will buy bricks, cement and sand.  This will help her a lot because she will be able to improve the infrastructure of her home.  This is important as she sells her tortillas from her home.  Currently, her house is made from wood and gravel.  These materials are very old.  She would like to attract more customers to her business and improve her sales.  She would like to be able to offer jobs to other single mothers who, in the same way she has, can learn to earn a living honestly and prepare their children for university.  She doesn't want them to suffer the way she did, not being able to study, because the most important thing for any mother is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to build a room, buying bricks, cement and sand

loans.name: Los Espinales Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Nazaria pertenece al grupo llamado “LOS ESPINALES” comenta que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque donD. ellas viven hay muchos árboles D. espino y por eso le pusieron así al grupo. Ella es originaria D. la localidad D. Macho D. Agua ubicado en el estado D. Michoacán. Doña Nazaria tiene 30 años D. edad, comenta que estudio hasta el quinto año D. primaria y que ya no continúo con sus estudios porque sus papas eran personas D. bajos recursos y no tenían dinero para comprarle las libretas. Doña Naza como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la cría y venta D. borregos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desD. muy temprana hora del día saca a pastear a sus borregos, a un terreno que tienen donD. ella y su esposo siembran pastura para que coman sus animales, comenta que con el préstamo que esta obteniendo comprara borregos, alimento, vacunas, desparacitantes, vitaminas para que los borregos crezcan rápido y pueda venderlos a un buen precio, ella tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente  2 años y empezó con este tipo D. negocio por que dice que si deja ganancias y son fáciles D. criar y no se les invierte mucho a ese tipo D. animales. Ella venD. sus borregos en su localidad y aveces va a la central D. abastos D. Zitacuaro a ofrecer sus borregos. La meta que tiene doña Nazaria es poderles hacer un corral donD. no pasen fríos sus animales para que no se le enfermen. Ella esta casada con el señor Genaro el cual es jornalero y tienen cuatro hijos los cuales están patrocinados por Visión Mundial, ella dice “Gracias a Visión mundial mis hijos pueden tener una mejor calidad D. vida y también gracias a Fundación Realidad por que así puedo tener una fuente D. empleo y así poder ayudarle a mi esposo con los gastos D. mi casa e hijos”. La Señora Agustina, es parte del grupo “LOS ESPINALES” es originaria D. la localidad D. Macho D. Agua  Michoacán, ella tiene 38 años D. edad y estudio hasta el tercer año D. primaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas y no le alcanzaba para sus útiles que ocupaba en la escuela, y también que su papa le decía “las mujeres nacieron para trabajar en la casa y cuidar a los hijos no andar en la calle según trabajando por eso tienen a sus esposos para que las mantengan”  y por eso no la dejo seguir estudiando. Doña Agustina está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra D. unos borregos ella quiere incrementar el numero D. animales para así venderlos mas fácilmente por mayoreo, también nos comenta que comprara alimento y vitaminas. Comenta que lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 3 años y que venD. sus borregos con un cliente D. Zitacuaro que hace babarcoa (comida mexicana). Doña Agustina esta casada con el señor Leonidas el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 5 hijos. La meta que tiene la señora es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes para tener otra fuente donD. pueda sacar dinero para la educación D. sus hijos. Las otras 5 integrantes se llaman Maria Lucia D. Jesús García, Natalia D. C., Rosa Maria V. M., Juana H. M. ellas quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra borregos para criarlos y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Maria Nazaria belongs to a group called, Los Espinales, she comments that they named the group that because where they live there are lots of Hawthorne trees and that is why they named the group that.  She is originally from Macho D. Agua located in the state of Michoacan.  Nazaria is 30 years old and states that she only completed 5th graD. in elementary and did not go on any further because her parents had minimal resources and could not buy her the books.
She is known as "Naza" by her friends and neighbors and dedicates herself to raising and selling sheep.  She is a very hard working person and takes her sheep to graze at a very early hour to a plot where she and her husband plant grass for their animals to eat. She states that with the loan she will purchase more sheep, feed, vaccinations, parasite medication, and vitamins so that the sheep grow quickly for her to sell at a good price.  She has been doing this for 2 years and started in this type of business because she says it is profitable and they are easy to raise and you don't have to invest too much into this type of animal.  She sells her sheep locally and sometimes takes them to auction in Zitacuaro.  Nazaria's goal is to build them a shed so they won't be cold and so they won't get sick.  She is married to Genaro who is 38 years old and is a day laborer.  They have four children who are sponsored by Vision Mundial (World Vision).  She states, " Thanks to World Vision my children have a better quality of life and also thanks to Fundacion Realidad ( Reality Foundation) because this way I have a source of employment to help out my husband with household expenses and with the kids."
Augustina is part of the group, " Los Espinales" and originates from Macho D. Agua, Michoacan.  She is 38 years old and studied until 3rd graD. and did not continue her education because she helped her parents out by working and didn't have enough to cover her school expenses; also her dad would tell her, " women were born to work around the house and take care of the kids, not be out in the streets so called "working", that is why they have their husbands to support them.", and that is why he wouldn't let her continue studying.  Augustina is soliciting a loan from Fundacion Realidad ( Reality Foundation) to purchase more sheep and increase her livestock to facilitate their sale in bulk, she also adds that she will be purchasing feed and vitamins.  She has been at this business for 3 years and sells her sheep to a client in Zitacuaro who makes barbacoa ( mexican food ).  Augustina is married to Leonidas who is a day laborer and they have 5 children.  Her goal is to open a store selling groceries in order to have another source she can draw money from for her children's education.  
The other 5 members are: Maria Lucia D. Jesús García, Natalia D. C., Rosa Maria V. M., Juana H. M. and they want the loan to purchase sheep to raise and sell.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and sell later.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia V. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 60 years old. Simplicia is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Simplicia makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Simplicia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Simplicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. 

Simplicia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira section of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  For the last 10 years, she has made a living by selling fish, and works seven days a week. She sells her fish in the local market and has applied for this loan for 40,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more fish to sell, as well as bananas, beef, potatoes and rice. She supplements her income by renting out a motorcycle she owns. Her main challenges are the seasonal nature of her business and occasional thefts. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant and a business where she call sell items in retail markets. Florence owns the home she lives in and has access to electricity but no piped-in water. Her biggest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Alhaji. He is married and has 2 children. In the year 2002, Alhaji established his clothing business. He raised his initial business capital from the sales-assistant work he was doing. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) from this business every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alhaji requires a loan in order to buy more bales of wax cotton. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 4,000,000. In the future, Alhaji plans to open a retail outlet in another strategic location. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton for his business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 25. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been farming for three years. She earns 15,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Alicia also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells vegetables, canned goods, and other products.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her farming business and reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 59-year-old hard-working man who has been always fascinated with stones and rock and the way they are shaped.

Since he was in his twenties, he has been sculpturing rocks as a hobby but then he left his full-time job and dedicated his time to being a sculptor. Nabil makes a lot of amazingly beautiful sculptures such as Petra drawings out of rocks and stone with his hands using few tools. He also makes building entrance decoration by sculpturing on the wall.

Now Nabil is applying for a loan to buy electrical tools for sculpturing that would save him time and effort when creating an artistic piece like the one he is holding in the picture.

loans.use: To buy electrical tools for sculpturing.

loans.name: Dulce Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "DULCE MARIA" porque la señora venD. dulces y se llama Luz, esta ubicado en el estado D. México, esta conformado por 9 integrantes, la señora Luz es la tesorera D. grupo, tiene 36 años, estudio la primaria, tienen 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones) ella se dedica a la venta D. dulces con el cual lleva 5 años, solicita el prestamo para invertir en variedad D. dulces que le solicitan sus clientes ya que la mayoria son niños así como para fiestas infantiles que es donD. le realizan pedidos grandes y son sus mejores ventas, con las ganancias quiere ahorrar y seguir pidiendo prestamos para posteriormente tener un local fijo, ella se siente contenta porque pueD. contribuir con el gasto D. su familia, además D. apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan estudios y una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called "Dulce María" (Sweet María) because one of the ladies sells sweet treats and is called María Luz.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has nine members.  Luz is the group's treasurer.  She is 36 years old, has an elementary school level of education, and has three children (one daughter and two sons).  Her business is selling sweet treats and she has been in this business for five years.

Luz is requesting a loan to invest in a range of sweet treats that her customers are requesting.  Most of her customers are children.  She receives large orders from children's parties and this is where she makes her best sales.  With the profits from her business, she would like to save up and continue requesting loans so that she can eventually obtain her own fixed premises.  She feels happy because she is able to contribute towards her family's expenses and also support her children so that they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in a range of sweet treats

loans.name: Konah

texts.en: Konah is 48 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married, and her husband receives a pension. They have eight children, ranging in age from 18 to 30 years. Only two of her children live with her. For the past 25 years, Konah has been selling charcoal and dried goods. Sometimes she makes less profit, because she buys at a higher price. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal, pepper oil, and vegetables. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  charcoal, pepper oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 41 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja José de 37 años y sus 02 queridos hijos José de 13 años y Ruth de 08 años de edad, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos de su centro poblado de Santa Rosa, ubicado en la selva tropical Ayacuchana, han sido en la vida de Erika un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor  y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja con mucho esmero, sembrando café, cacao y Plátano. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo sus frutos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Erika solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, incrementar sus sembríos con plantas de cacao ya que es una de sus plantas que mayor  precio tiene en el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y en esta oportunidad espera contar una vez mas con el apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al aporte de ellos va progresando. Y ello Erika esta llano de devolver puntualmente sus aportes. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Erika is 41 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 37 year-old José, and her two beloved children, 13 year-old José and 8 year-old Ruth, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The green fields of Santa Rosa, in the Ayacucho rainforest, have been a very pleasant place for Erika to work.  Since she was very young, her parents taught her to farm and now she owns her own land which she works very carefully together with her partner, growing coffee, cacao and bananas.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since then she feels that all her hard work is providing its rewards.  She has been in this business for ten years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the middlemen in the town of San Francisco.

Erika is requesting this loan to carry out some plans.  She will increase her plantings with cacao plants since this is one of her plants which fetches the highest price on the market.  Over time, she hopes to gather together enough money to buy more farmland.  This will be her second loan from MFP and, on this occasion, she hopes to be able to rely on Kiva lenders' support once more since, thanks to their support, she has been making progress in her business.  Erika, for her part, is prepared to make her repayments punctually.  She will use the 2,500 soles to buy cacao seeds and thereby increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Pedro Reynaldo

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de comarca el jicarito es maestro del colegio del mismo nombre, tiene 27 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta con 2 personas su esposa que también es maestra del mismo núcleo educativo y su hija quien estudia en el colegio de la misma localidad, actualmente tiene 13 créditos recibidos con la empresa, este ultimo será utilizado para la compra de impresora , cocina de gas y Refrigeradora, ya que de esa manera ha venido mejorando sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Pedro is a native of the El Jicarito region.  He has been a teacher for 27 years at a school called El Jicarito. His nuclear family consists of himself and two other people: his wife, who is also a teacher in the same school district, and his daughter, who studies in a school in the same place.  He has received 13 loans from the institution.  This new loan will be used to buy a printer, gas cooker and refrigerator, because in this way he can continue to improve his living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a printer, gas cooker and refrigerator

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 44 years old. She is a widow with four children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from selling bread. Hellen requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase or order more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en:
Celedonio is a determined father who wants to lift his family out of poverty. He wakes up early and goes down to the field. He manages his time wisely in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and then sell it to traders. Celedonio is 42 years old. He has three children to support which is why he spends most of his time at his business. He sacrifices a lot to ensure his crop produces an abundant harvest. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and pay for land cultivation. With the help of these chemicals he would maintain his farming business and yield a better crop every crop season.
 
In the future, Celedonio hopes to earn more profits for house repair.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a hardworking business man aged 32.  He is married and blessed with one child.  For the last six years, he has been managing a pharmacy to make a living.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business with his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ma. Teresa has a retail shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Ma. Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing or "ukay-ukay".

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José, es habitante del municipio  de  Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijo , la esposa actualmente labora como comerciante para apoyar  con algunos gastos de la casa , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida  y apoyar siempre en su estudios a su hijo para que logre llegar a la universidad , don José desde hace va ríos años labora en una empresa privada como guarda de seguridad , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un salario moderado que le permita comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos , él no lograría mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and son.  His wife currently works as a merchant to help with some of the household expenses.  His plan for the family is to improve living conditions and to always support his son’s education so that he makes it to the university.  José has been working in a private firm as a security guard for several years now.  His greatest difficulty at present is that he does not earn a high enough salary that will make it possible for him to purchase all the building materials at the same time.  He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides him through the Kiva fund because without it he would not reach his goal of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, la socia cría cuyes al por mayor, ella desea comprar 100 cuyes para criarlos y una vez que alcanza la madures ella los lleva  a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de sus cuyes y de este modo incrementar los que ya tiene y poder crecer económicamente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes ella tiene pensado comprar 100 cuyes para incrementar su  negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas." The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Dominga. She is 38 years old, single, and has two children who are 12 and 3 years old. She makes a living raising large quantities of guinea pigs. She hopes to buy and raise 100 guinea pigs and take them to the city of Puerto Maldonado to sell once they reach maturity. She would like to invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and thus increase the number that she has already and be able to grow. She requests the loan in order to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs and she plans to buy 100 of them to improve her business.

Dominga is thankful for the loan and commits to honoring the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs. She plans to buy 100 guinea pigs to improve her business.

loans.name: Umoja S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja SHG Group in Western Kenya! Samuel is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Some members of this group joined One Acre Fund as early as 2010 and are now entering their third season with the program.

Samuel takes care of three children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access very competitive input prices. In the recent 2011 season, Samuel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samuel was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Samuel will pay for school fees and other major annual expenses.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hannah from Goderich, the western area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged 10 years and 18 years. Her two children are currently attending school.

Hannah runs a crated drinks and bundled water store in Goderich, where she sells Fanta, Vinto and Coca-Cola. She has been running this business for nine years.  She also receives income from her husband who lives in England; he usually sends money to take care of their children. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to invest in the business.

Hannah has requested a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to extend her business to international levels. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bundled water.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita is 40-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 6 and 18. All of them are in school. She has a business of selling food in a  stall in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Tabita requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, tomatoes, and breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Rowelyn is making and peddling viands such as fried fish, fried chicken and vegetables soup.  She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Rowelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rowelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Noelia Esperanza

texts.es:
Noelia, vive con tres nietos uno de ellos ya casado y dos de 9 y 12 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de juguetes, éste lo aprendió por medio de unas amigas, vende ropa, calzado, juguetes y plásticos, desde hace 30 años, su horario es de siete de la mañana hasta las 4:30 de la tarde.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes en la temporada, pues en estos meses se incrementa las ventas de juguetes para niños y niñas, ya sean plásticos o de metal, esta inversión ayudará para incrementar el negocio atraer nuevos clientes y generar más ganancias. La intención de Noelia es tener un negocio rentable del apoyo de los préstamos.
texts.en: Noelia lives with 3 grandchildren, one of whom is already married and two others aged 9 and 12.  She has a business selling toys.  She learned this trade from some friends.  She has been selling clothing, shoes, toys and plastic products for 30 years.  She works from 7am until 4:30 pm.  Noelia requests a loan to buy seasonal toys, as in these months the sales of toys for little girls and boys increases, including those made of plastic and metal.  This investment will help Noelia to grow her business, attract new customers and generate more profits.  With the support of this loan, Noel intends to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal toys

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, age 44, and her husband live in Ho Chi Minh City. They have two daughters.

Hong and her husband have been earning a living by operating a beverage store in the front of their house for the past twenty years. They sell a variety of soft drinks and fruit juice. 

Hong would like to borrow money to expand her current business and hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her current business by purchasing a greater variety of beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosario

texts.es:
De oficio agricultora, originaria de Chacaraseca una pequeña comarca de León,  es Francisca de 52 años de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos todos ellos viven aparte. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y también trabaja en la siembra. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes la criaron en el campo trabajando desde muy pequeña y con esos le ha servido a ella para salir adelante con su hijos. Hoy en día ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.  
Ella solicita el crédito para compra de dos vacas paridas . Pues las utilizara para vender leche producto que es muy solicitado en su comunidad. A ella le gusta mucho el campo conoce muy bien las actividades una de sus  planes es tener una granja de cerdos y comprar ganado de raza.
texts.en: Francisca makes a living in agriculture and is a native of Chacaraseca, a small area in León. She is 52 years old, married and has four children who all live on their own. She makes a living raising pigs and chickens and also works in the fields. She learned the trade from her parents, who raised her on a farm and had her working since she was very young. That knowledge has helped her make headway for her family. Today, she and her husband have crops and raise livestock. She is requesting the loan to purchase two young cows so she can sell their milk, which is in high demand in her community. Francisca really likes working in the field because she knows it very well. One of her plans is to have a pig farm and buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two young cows.

loans.name: Junior Ii Group

texts.fr: JUNIOR II est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yolande (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Yolande  est mariée à un certain Raphael. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Yolande et son mari. Pour cette raison, Yolande vend des articles en plastiques dans sa région depuis dix sept ans. De façon secondaire Yolande vend aussi de l'huile végétale, du maïs et du riz ;ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Yolande s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yolande sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JUNIOR II, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Joas

texts.en:
Joas is 46 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 4 and 17 years, 4 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 9 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ignat

texts.en: Ignat J. has own business since 2003. He is of roma origin and has a coffee and refreshments store in the roma ghetto in Sliven. Ignat is married and has a very large family – besides his three children he is looking after his old parents and his sister who is disabled. He also has a parellel farming business for more than 10 years Ignat is breeding pigs and now he has about 20 pigs in the farm. Ignat J. needs $ 2 000 to repair his store to bring it into line with sanitary requirements.

loans.use: To repair his store

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema runs a hairdressing saloon.The saloon is located in a bussy area of Temeke in Dar es Salaam.She has one assistant in her business.In regular days she attends twelve to fifteen customers,but the number increases during weekends .She faces a problem of stock outs of hairdressing and sterilizing materials. Sometimes she has to make the customers wait while she go downstreet to fetch hairdressing materials.The situation which is not desirable in business.Competitors may take this problem as an advantage.To curb such a problem she is in need of USD 400 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel has five children. The eldest is married, but the rest live with her. Two of those work, and the other two are students. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Raquel has worked ever since she was young, she always had to help pay the household expenses. She started out selling food like gorditas and enchiladas, then went into Tupperware sales for a long time, then she sold Avon beauty products, and at present she is working selling shoes, linens, and miscellaneous items. Her two daughters help her very occasionally with her sales, but not often because they have other responsibilities.

Raquel is requesting a loan for $925 to buy merchandise, especially shoes and linens, since she has orders and needs the capital to fulfill them. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She is very grateful for the support you offer in helping her business continue to grow.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Raquel tiene cinco hijos, la mayor es la única casada y los demás viven con ella, dos trabajan y los otros dos son estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como taxista. Raquel trabajó desde muy joven y siempre tuvo que hacerlo para colaborar con los gastos de su casa, empezó vendiendo comidas como gorditas y enchiladas y posteriormente incursionó en la venta de tuperwere por mucho tiempo, luego vendió productos Avon que son de belleza y actualmente esta trabajando en la venta de zapatos, blancos y misceláneas. En sus ventas muy ocasionalmente la ayudan dos de sus hijas pero no siempre por que tienen otras responsabilidades que hacer.

Raquel está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para la compra de mercadería especialmente en zapatos y blancos, ya que tiene pedidos anticipados y necesita el capital para abastecerse. Ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindan para que continúe creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise

loans.name: Mayra Yesenia

texts.es:
Mayra has two children, age 2 and 10. She is single and she has had to work very hard to support her two little ones. Since Mayra is an enterprising woman, she decided to start her own business of selling footwear five years ago to offer her children a better quality of life and to give them everything they need. Little by little she has made her business grow and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger.

Now, Mayra needs a loan of $150 that she will use to buy merchandise to cover the demand of her clients, and to offer a better service. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Be an important part in the life of this family! They are very grateful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayra tiene dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, ella es soltera y ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños. Como Mayra es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace cinco años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado para ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y darles todo lo necesario, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y con las facilidades de pagos que ofrece a sus clientes sus pedidos son cada vez mayores.

En estos momentos Mayra necesita de un crédito por $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en solo tres meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is a low-income resident of the Belyagan district in Gahramanli village. He is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. He has been running a cattle rearing business for 15 years. His first loan was from Normicro and he used the money to improve his business. He  is now requesting a $400 loan to expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy 1 cow

loans.name: Leuatea

texts.en: Leuatea is a mother of four kids, who are living together in one house. She applied for the750 Tala ($300USD) loan amount and used the money to buy stock to start her small shop she runs from tables inside a small room of her house. It is going well but she would like to build a special room with good shelves to sell her stocks. She hopes that her next loan will be used to complete that project, and make some repairs to her house. She appreciates the help she receives from this program because without it she could not run her business.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas B. sells drinks and requests a loan of $300 to buy more drinks to sell. She is 42 years, married and has 8 children .She hails from Benin City. She has been in this business since 2005. She promises to pay back within 8 months

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young father. He and his family live in one of the areas on the outskirts of the city, in a community where he's established his work and his home. He works in agriculture and transport, but the transport provides the most economic support for his family. He does not own his small motor scooter, but rents it, which limits the possibilities of growing his income. Because he must take care of his 2 year old daughter and his wife, he needs his own scooter for work so that he can get some financial stability and generate more income. He is requesting a loan to invest in the land he cultivates, so that with the earnings from the harvest he'll be able to purchase his own scooter on monthly payments. Remember that when one has obligations as a parent, one does everything possible to see their children happy. This is the goal of Luis.

Luis, es un joven padre de familia que vive en uno de los lugares más alejados de la ciudad y en cuya comunidad nativa ha establecido su trabajo y su hogar.Se desenvuelve en la labor agrícola y el transporte terrestre, siendo esta segunda ocupación la más rentable y gran ayuda económica de su familia; sin embargo el mototaxi en el cual trabaja no es propio sino alquilado motivo por el que Luis ve limitada la posibilidad de aumentar sus ganancias.Debido a que necesita mantener a su hija de dos años y a su esposa requiere de una herramienta de trabajo propia para estabilizar su economía y llevar mayores ingresos a casa. Por eso solicita su apoyo con un préstamo, cuyo dinero invertirá en su terreno de cultivo y con las ganancias de cosecha comprará su propio mototaxi en cuotas módicas que podría pagar.Recuerde que cuando uno tiene obligaciones como padre hace hasta lo imposible por ver a sus hijos felices y Luis es uno de ellos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY OF SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO MAXIMIZE PROFITS FROM HIS HARVEST.  WITH THE PROFITS,  HE WILL BE ABLE TO PURCHASE HIS OWN SCOOTER FOR HIS TRANSPORT BUSINESS.

loans.name: Mededji N.

texts.fr:
Born in 1959 in ADJOHOUN in the PLATEAU area, Mrs. Mededji N. L. has lived for more than 20 years in AVOTROU, one of the popular districts of COTONOU, characterized by a highly dense population. She is married to a man in his sixties and is a mother of 5 children of whom she still takes care. From a hangar in her house, she sells various condiments and beans, which her customers appreciate. In spite of her age, she is devoted to her business, and is determed and courageous. Mrs. Mededji N. L. is asking for this loan in order to meet the expectations of her clients.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1959 à ADJOHOUN dans le département du PLATEAU, dame Mededji N. L. réside depuis plus de 20 ans à AVOTROU l'un des quartiers populaires de COTONOU caractérisé par une forte densité de population. Elle est mariée à un sexagénaire et est mère de 05 enfants qui sont à sa charge. Elle vend sous un hangar de la cour de sa maison divers condiments et du haricot que ses clients apprécient bien. Malgré son âge avancé, elle se consacre à ses activités avec détermination et bravour. Dame Mededji N. L. sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 bags of beans

loans.name: Marry's Mauwa Group

texts.en:
Marry is 32 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, one 5 years old and one 6 months. Marry owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Marry has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her pharmacy. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling,chips selling, and fish and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng M., age 50, is a mother of six children and has resided in Phnom Penh over 30 years. To raise the family’s income, she works growing rice and raising fish to earn approximately $1 a day. Her husband, Ouy Mao, age 54, works as farmer growing rice. Normally, he makes $5 a day in revenue. Two of their children are employed by a garment factory with a salary $70 each per month and the rest are students and farmers.

To help with their farm, this couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a harvest machine. This will be used to hire to the local people to gain more profit for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a harvest machine.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra A. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children. Sandra sells clothes in the market. Sandra travels to Ontisha Market in the east to buy clothes, which she later sells in Benin City. She has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for 4 years. She is requesting the loan of $350 to buy more clothes for sale to her ever increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong R. is a widow grocery seller in Oreusey Village in the Pursat Province. She has eight children, one of whom is married. With her large family, R. cannot support her family expenses sufficiently so her children decided go out to find jobs to help support family. Now two sons are working as construction workers and others made a business of selling groceries. With her business growing, R. is seeking a loan to purchase more grocery stock for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock for her business

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim (her husband is pictured) was born in 1967. She has four children. The Muzaffarov family lives in the Khachmaz region. Her husband has been in the building material sales business for six years. Now they need a loan of $1,200 US to buy spare parts for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene has dedicated herself the last two months to selling cosmetics via catalogue. However, she has delivered clothing via order for the past seven years. Her customers are her friends and neighbors. Every day she goes out to distribute her products, among them cosmetics and clothing. She is also a moneylender on her own. The previous loans she has requested have helped her invest in her cosmetics stock and have also allowed her to provide loans of her own to acquaintances. In the future, Marlene would like to run a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marlene se dedica desde hace 2 meses a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Sin embargo, ella reparte ropa por pedidos desde hace 7 años. Sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos. Todos los días ella sale a repartir sus productos, entre cosméticos y ropa. Asimismo, ella es prestamista de dinero. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para invertir en el stock de cosméticos. También le ha servido para hacer los préstamos a sus conocidos. A Marlene le gustaría poner una fuente de soda en el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in her cosmetics stock and to make small loans to acquaintances / Para invertir en el stock de los cosméticos que ofrece y para hacer pequeños préstamos de dinero a sus conocidos.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Саидова Мастура, ей 27 лет. Занимается она  продажей женской и детской обуви и имеет 8 летний опыт. Местом деятельности Мастуры является  оптовый рынок «Корвон» г. Душанбе. Товары закупает у поставщиков из Китая и на оптовом рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Турции. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров очень разнообразен, особенно по ее словам клиенты дают предпочтение на удобные повседневные обуви. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви она хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Mastura S. is 27 years old. She sells women’s and children’s shoes at the Corvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. She has an 8-year experience in this business. Mastura buys her goods from suppliers in China and at the Corvon wholesale market, and sometimes from suppliers in Turkey. She sells a wide assortment of goods; her clients especially prefer everyday-wear comfort shoes. During the fall shoe season, Mastura wants to participate in the Kiva program and obtain a $600 loan to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra, es comerciante y tiene una tienda donde vende carne, abarrotes, conservas, refrescos.
Tiene un hijo y es separada; Mayra es la única que genera ingresos en su familia para los gastos de estudios, ropa alimentación y otros gastos de ella y su hijo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de Abarrotes, carne, y conservas) para reabastecer su tienda.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
El crédito le dará la oportunidad de comprar en cantidad y bajar sus costos con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mayra is a businesswoman, and she has a store where she sells meat, snacks, canned food, and soft drinks. She has a son and is separated from her husband; Mayra is the only person who generates an income in her family to cover the expenses of studies, clothing, food, and any other expenses for her and her son. Her home is located in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This loan would be used for working capital (to buy snacks, meat, and cans of food) in order to restock her store. This is the second time that she has asked for a loan from IMPRO. Her history qualifies her as a Client 1, which is to say she complied well in her repayments, and because of this she is permitted to gain access this second loan. The loan will give her the opportunity to buy in quantity and lower her costs with the objective of improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (meat, canned food, soft drinks, etc.) for Mayra's shop

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Mrs. Hao C. is a villager in Preak Talai village in Kandal province.  She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables.  In vegetable farming, she usually grows beans on a 0.5-hectare field, while she cultivates rice on a 1-hectare field.  

On these plantations, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which is affecting her crop badly.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field and produce a better crop. 

Mrs. Hao C. is a 44-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field and produce a better crop.

loans.name: Julia Irene

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en la Av. Tupac Amaru Mz. B Lt. 1, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante de Seguridad Ciudadana. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de plásticos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de belleza “EBEL”. En las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y por las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 6 colonias para bebes, 7 talcos, 6 desodorantes, cremas de manos y cuerpos.

Julia y su familia están muy agradecidos con el banco comunal por la oportunidad que le brindan para tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Señora Julia belongs to the community bank "El Paraíso," located at Av. Tupac Amaru Mz. B Lt. 1, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and a mother of one little boy who depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a security guard for Seguridad Ciudadana. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in plastic sales. She has a two-year history working with the community bank. Presently she works selling beauty products of "EBEL." In the mornings, she is dedicated to caring for her son and in the evenings she delivers her products to her clients. With this loan for 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy six colognes for babies, seven talcum powders, six deodorants, hand creams, and body creams. Julia and her family are very thankful for the community bank and for the opportunity that you offer her so that she can have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 6 colognes for babies, 7 talcum powders, 6 deodorants, hand creams, and body creams.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Bảo năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại chồng chị Bảo đang lamg nghề thợ mộc còn chị chăn nuôi  lợn, gà và chăm sóc hai con nhỏ. Công việc làm mộc, chăn nuôi của gia đình  chị đang ngày càng phát triển và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mongm uốn được vay 6.000.000để đầu tư mua thêm gỗ phục vụ cho việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô Thị Bảo is 30 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2007. Her husband is a carpenter, she raises pigs, poultry and takes care of their 2 young children. Her husband work is stable, her animal raising business is good. They make a good combined income of 3.500.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 6.000.000 VND to invest in her husband's business: to buy wood.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood for her husband

loans.name: Kosar M. Zubair Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is 38 years old and married. She resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived there all her life. Her husband's name is M. Z.. He is a watchman in a school.

Kosar baji is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer, but he knows how to drive an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), and has three years experience driving one. The other children are getting an education from a school located near their house.

Kosar baji stays at home and sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors and relatives. She charges $2 per dress. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband as his salary is insufficient to fulfill the needs of the family.

Kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son.

Kosar baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy ladies shoes for her shoe selling business. Yasmeen baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a television and a refrigerator on installments for her electronic items shop. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen K. is a villager in Pram Bey Chhaum village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries for her business to earn more profits. Mrs. Yen K. is a 56-year-old widow.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business to earn more profits.

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
Es un banco comunal compuesto por 18 personas, la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican al comercio D. ganado, ropa, cosméticos, frutas y venta D. comidas.
LIDIA I. C..- Es la líder del banco D. emprendimiento, es una D. las fundadoras del banco.
La Sra. Lidia vive en el barrio Arco Iris del km.9, D. la localidad D. El Torno en el Departamento D. Santa Cruz, cuenta con casa propia, tiene como actividad la venta D. comida actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2 años en su mismo domicilio.
Su esposo el Sr. German Moncada se dedica al transporte urbano. El objetivo D. ambos es comprarse un vehiculo propio.
HERNAN L.- Es el secretario del banco comunal, vive en el barrio Arco iris, en una casa alquilada, la actividad a la que se dedica, es el servicio D. transporte urbano con el que viene trabajando desD. hace unos 10 años.
El Sr. Hernán se encuentra en el quinto ciclo D. préstamo en este banco comunal, durante este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad, es D. esta manera que se le ha dado el cargo D. tesorero del banco.
Su esposa la Sra. Neneth Soruco se dedica al comercio y elaboración D. horneados en el mismo barrio en el que vive.
INGRID V. A..-  LA sra. Ingrid es la secretaria del banco comunal la cual vive en el mismo barrio que los anteriormente mencionados, en el barrio arco iris la Sra. Cuenta con casa propia, se dedica ala actividad D. peluquería con la cual trabaja desD. hace unos 2 años atrás.
Ella tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposo el mismo que tiene como actividad D. chofer.
Su objetivo D. la Sra. Es ahorrar un poco mas D. dinero para colocar su propio salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
This community bank is composed of 18 members and the majority of its clients sells cattle, clothes, cosmetics, fruits and food in general. LIDIA I. C. is the bank's entrepreneurship leader and one of its founders. Lidia lives in the 9th Kilometer's Arco Iris municipality, situated in El Torno in the department of Santa Cruz. She owns her own home and from that location she has been selling cooked food for the past two years. Her husband, Mr. German Moncada, is engaged in urban transportation. Their main objective is to purchase their own vehicle. HERNAN L. is the community's bank secretary. He lives in Arco Iris in a rented house and, for the past ten years, he has maD. urban transportation his business activity. Mr. Hernan is in his fifth loan cycle with this community bank and during this period of time he has demonstrated to be a responsible person (eventually, he was named the bank's treasury officer.) His wife, Mrs. Neneth Soruco, sells and fabricates ornaments that are sold in the same neighborhood where she lives. INGRID V. A. is also the bank's secretary and she lives in the same municipality previously mentioned. Mrs. Cuenta owns her home and she has worked for a hair salon for the past two years. She has two sons and lives with her husband who is as a driver. Her objective is to be able to save some money to open up her own hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital growth

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian G. is married and has no child. She has received no formal education. Vivian manufactures palm oil for sale at the Elmina first port. She has had this business since 1992. Her husband is a fisherman. Vivian uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Vivian will use the loan to purchase more ingredients for a mass production of the palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to save towards the completion of the house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients for a mass production of the palm oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary F. is 60 year old married woman with four children. All of her children are currently working. She lives with her family in Twifo which is located in the central region of Ghana. For the past two years, Mary has been baking bread and other pastries in order to provide fore her family. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread etc and retails her pastries to her customers. She makes sure her that the quality of the food meets her customer’s expectations. Her customers book their order in advance and before they arrive at her stand their order is ready. She also retails pastries to individuals for their morning breakfast through hawking which is house to house selling. The price of commodity is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. Mary needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood to supply her stand.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
As well as being an entrepreneur, Abena S., 35, takes care of her four kids: two boys and two girls. Currently, all of her children are pursuing their education at the junior high and primary school levels. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to achieve the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her family in a family house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Abena is a restaurant operator. 

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain. It is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Abena says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly. She needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production costs. She expects to make higher profits if she receives her loan. She wants to invest the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

She is a member of a group called Gold Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and firewood for restaurant business.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф – мужчина 1977 года рождения. Женат, имеет 2-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий. Кондитерские изделия ему пекут для продажи жена, а также дочка помогает печь кондитерские изделия. Абдурауф старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим он хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Абдурауф пришел в нашу организацию в первый раз брать кредит. Он надеется, что кредит очень поможет ему.
texts.en:
Abdurauf is a man born in 1977. He is married and has two children. He sells sweets and confections. His wife and daughter help him in making of the confections. Abdurauf tries to expand his business and buys imported candy and sweets to increase the assortment. He wants to increase the income for the family this way. Abdurauf has come to our organization for a loan for the first time. He hopes that the loan will help him a lot.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of confections

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognogontala sont toutes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans  et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire, après avoir remboursés les prêts précédents sans aucune difficulté.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de produits alimentaires, ménagers et des prestations de service.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 150 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni), 2 balles de tissus (pour hommes et femmes), 1 douzaine de laine de couleurs différentes, 5 aiguilles et crochets, des colorants  et de la soude caustique. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour la santé et la nourriture des enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
