Les femmes du groupe Kotognogontala ambitionnent augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kotognogontala are all married and have an average age of 32 and three children. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and are now on their eighth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid. The women operate diverse businesses, including the sale of food items and household products, and they offer a range of services. With this new loan, they intend to buy a truck-load of firewood, 150 bars of traditional soap (farakourouni), 2 bales of fabrics (for men and women), a dozen units of wool of different colors, 5 crochet needles, some dyes, and some caustic soda. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at the different markets of Sikasso and in the districts. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 10,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for the health and nourishment of the children, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nakawuka Epharance Group

texts.en: Ephrance is the leader of a 4 member group.  She is a 34-year-old single mother of three children, aged between 11 and 15 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in a rented one-roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Ephrance sells vegetables in Bwaise Market, one of Kampala suburbs. She sells to all categories of people, an average of 10 customers a day. She works six days a week. Ephrance buys the vegetables from Nakasero Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala, and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her daily routine of moving door to door. Margaret has been with MCDT for over ten years and requesting her twentieth loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more fruit and vegetables. Ephrance aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a small entrepreneur from Pavlograd where she sells furniture in one of the local malls. She is married and has two daughters who are 22 and 7. Olga’s little store is known for its nice selection of good quality furniture pieces. Moreover, it has a favorable location which makes it very convenient for potential customers. Olga has been in the trade for three years. Her business has grown up to 70,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas.  

Olga is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to open her second vending location. She has proved to be a reliable borrower as she has promptly repaid all previous loans without any delinquencies. Olga is hoping to keep her business sustainable and grow it consistently as she seeks to provide for her family’s needs and make sure they have everything they need.

loans.use: To open a new vending location

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La maestra Bertha Z. es soltera, ella labora para una escuela desde hace 29 años, vive con una hija en edad escolar. Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que se acercara la temporada de lluvias y su techo quedo dañado por el granizo.
texts.en:
Bertha Z. is unmarried and has worked in a school for the past 29 years. She lives with her school-age daughter. Ms. Z. is asking for this loan in order to water-proof her roof, since rainy season is coming and it was damaged in a hail storm.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: water-proof roof

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Opportunities have never been scarce for Firuza, who has worked incessantly in diverse trades to support her family. Firuza is a widow and mother of two children. For more than five years, she has worked on the land, cultivating different kinds of crops. She has formed her own businesses depending on the circumstances and the demands of the community.

With her earnings, Firuza has been able to provide food for her children and send them to school. They are now grown and have become productive members of the community. Firuza feels happy that she has completed her work as a mother, although this job truly never ends because she will always be concerned for their wellbeing. What Firuza urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for cultivating her land. Firuza doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Baguida à Lomé et exerce comme activité la vente de charbon de bois. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1989 et ce commerce lui permet aussi d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir à l’éducation scolaire de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend du charbon lourd et léger, ce qui fait qu’elle a beaucoup de clients en tout temps. Actuellement elle a besoin d’argent pour couvrir ses frais de transport vers Atakpamé pour renouveler son stock qui finit. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 sacs de charbon. Elle est très connue de beaucoup d’hôtels et de restaurants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Baguida district of Lomé. She has a business selling charcoal. She started it in 1989, and it also enables her to help her husband financially to provide an education for their two children. She sells both hard and soft charcoal, and so she has many customers at any given time. Currently, she needs money to cover the costs of transport to Atakpamé in order to renew her stock, which is depleted. This is why she’s requesting a WAGES loan for buying 50 sacks of charcoal. She is well-known by many hotels and restaurants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario de nombre Mujeres Unidas  está compuesto por Maria Benita Rodríguez S. y Maura Estela E.. Ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como las siguientes: Doña Maria tiene 45 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Doña Maria es la venta de cerdos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio por lo que con la ayuda de su amiga Maura han decidió unirse para realizar un financiamiento que sea de apoyo para ambas. La Señora Maura tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maura. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que los financiamientos son el apoyo para que su negocio salga adelante y unida con Maria solicitan un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así cada una pueda invertir en sus respectivos negocios. El sueño de ambas es que Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones siempre estén dispuestas a brindar la ayuda para mejorar la situación.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group called “Mujeres Unidas” (Women United) is composed of Maria Benita Rodríguez S. and Maura Estela E.. Both women are engaged in different business activities such as the following: Doña Maria is 45 years old and has 1 child. She has been selling pigs for more than 7 years and has steadily increased her business with the help of her friend Maura. They have decided to apply jointly for a loan that will help them both. Sra. Maura is 44 years old and married. She has been operating a grocery store for more than 8 years. She knows that financing will help her business succeed, so she has joined with Maria to request a loan so that they can invest in their respective businesses. The dream of both women is that Fundación León 2000 and other organizations continue to provide assistance to anyone looking to improve their situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga C. and her husband, Mr. Ang Chea, have been married since 1986 and have three children: one daughter, who sells vegetables, and two sons. One of them is in university. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
 
Nga and her husband are farmers. They grow many types of vegetables, such as tomatoes, papayas, and spinach, on their own farmland. They sell their products to middlemen in the village who then sell the products in Phnom Penh. 

One of Nga’s sons is attending university and she hopes to support her son's further education so he has a good job when he is finished with his studying. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to pay school fees for her son. She will use part of her loan for farming as well.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who attends university

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children. She runs a small business in the Central market of Melitopol. She sells yarn and knitting supplies which is a unique type of merchandise. There are few other persons working in this sphere of trade. Yelena has been in this business for over eleven years and she has a great deal of experience. Her enterprise has benefited from lending assistance. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in stock. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yelena is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas in order to increase her working capital. She is a true entrepreneur – enterprising, decisive and determined. She is striving to make a better life for her family. We believe Yelena’s natural talent to adequately assess the current environment and take advantage of it will stimulate her business to grow and keep it sustainable and profitable helping Yelena achieve independence and security in life.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun C. is a villager in Srae Beong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  She has a problem with this farming because her rice field has infertile soil, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Leoun Sareth, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Bun C. is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are two and five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 50 años, vive junto a su esposo, sus  dos hijos, sus dos nietos y su hermano. 
Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwiches, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, donde ya cuenta con clientes fieles quienes no dejan de ir a consumir sus jugos desde muy tempranas horas. Su rutina diaria empieza a las 5 de la mañana y termina antes del medio día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes, además que se mantiene ocupada, y sobre todo se entretiene. 
Por otro lado, considera que le es muy rentable porque todos sus productos (frutas, huevos, azúcar, etc.) lo compra en ese mismo mercado a bajos precios, está en una buena zona y tiene ingresos diarios.
Para el futuro, le gustaría alquilar un local adecuado para instalar su juguería.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y desde ya ha notado que las personas de su grupo son honestas, trabajadoras y sobre todo, responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir un kiosco más grande para su negocio, donde pueda tener mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years-old and lives with her husband, her two children, her two grandchildren, and her brother. For 17 years Blanca has been selling juices and sandwiches. She has a stand in her local market, where she has loyal customers who always come, starting early in the day, to purchase her juices. Blanca's daily routine beings at 5 in the morning and ends before noon. What she likes best about this job is providing good service to her customers, but it also keeps her busy and entertained. Also, Blanca considers this business very profitable because all her ingredients (fruits, eggs, sugar, etc) she buys in the same market at a low price. The stand is in a good location and provides daily income. In the future, Blanca would like to rent a store apt for selling her juices. This is her first loan with MFP, but the people in her group are honest, hard-working, and, above all, responsible. With the funds from this loan Blanca will build a bigger kiosk for her business, one where she will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bigger kiosk for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda G., 59 years old, like many women entrepreneurs in the Philippines, earns money from buyng and selling cosmetic items and apparel from prominent direct-sales companies (Avon, Sundance, Natasha, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc.) which is a tried and tested alternative source of income for housewives.

Rosalinda’s family lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite. Her husband Edito, 64, is now receiving his pension as a retired employee. They live with their grandchildren. She enjoys her business a lot, going to her friends on a house-to-house basis to sell her items. She earns P7,000 a month and even more during the holiday season.

She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2005. The loans provided by the cooperative helped her to pay for cosmetic items from the dealers in cash (otherwise she must pay for them on a consignment basis) so she could take advantage of large discounts and rebates which she also infuses back into her business. Currently, she's applying for a P12,000 loan from CCT to get more cosmetic items from her dealer in anticipation of the upcoming Christmas season.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: purchase more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Rosario Marlene

texts.es: Rosario Marlene M. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. La señora Rosario posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa frutas y verduras. Ya cuenta con ocho años de poseer el negocio el cual le ha permitido ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Debido a que Rosario cuenta con una familia muy extensa, ella solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras, y de esta manera poder aumentar las ventas, ya que desean poder brindarles una vida digna a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario Marlene M. A. is 33 years old, and she lives in San Martin with her husband and four young children. She has a food stall where she prepares breakfasts and lunches, and also sells fruits and vegetables. With eight years of running her business, she has been able to help her husband with all the household expenses. Because she has a large family, she asks for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. She plans to thereby increase her sales, for she wishes to offer a proper upbringing to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Umarat

texts.en:
In the photo you can see Umarat who is applying for her second loan from Kiva. Before, she sold chairs but having improved her business she started a fruit and vegetable business.

Now, Umarat needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, la señora Elizabeth A. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado que ella misma ha llevado a cabo con el propósito de brindarle las condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto ama.
Ella es una dama que siempre está trabajando en el engorde y alimentación del ganado habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en esta tarea. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para proceder con su engorde y de esta manera sacarles el máximo provecho para continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the town of El Viejo in Chinandega, Sra. Elizabeth A. raises livestock as way of supporting her family whom she lives dearly. She has always worked on a farm and has vast experience when it comes to feeding and fattening livestock. For this reason, she has requested a loan from CEPRODEL in order to purchase steers for fattening. Elizabeth hopes to gain the maximum benefit from this investment so that she can continue to develop financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50 años y desde muy joven no deja de trabajar, sólo así logró educar a sus 4 hijos, quienes ya son adultos. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Lucho.
Desde que empezó a trabajar, se dedicó a la costura, pero desde hace 4 años emprendió el negocio de la compra y venta de pescado, con la meta de implementar un taller de confecciones que hoy es una realidad. Hoy en día, desde las 4 de la mañana ya está en el centro de acopio de pescados, compra su mercadería y luego la vende en la puerta de este lugar. Su esposo es el encargado de repartir el pescado en los puestos de algunos mercados, donde tienen clientes; y a su vez, envían este producto a otras ciudades.
Isabel está muy satisfecha con su negocio porque es muy rentable y gracias a éste logró su objetivo de tener un taller de confecciones donde ahora trabajan sus hijos trabaja.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que gracias a estos préstamos ha progresado en su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de pescado para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years and, from a young age, has not stopped working. She has managed to pay the educational expenses for her four adult children. Isabel currently lives in her own home with her husband Lucho.

When she started working, Isabel devoted herself to sewing. Four years ago, she started a business of buying and selling fish with a goal of opening a clothing store, which is now a reality. Today her schedule begins at 4am when she arrives at the fishing collection center to buy her merchandise before selling it at the entrance of the center. Her husband is in charge of delivering the fish to vending posts in different markets where they have customers. Sometimes she ships her product to other cities. Isabel is very satisfied with her business because it has proven to be profitable and helped her achieve her goal of opening the clothing store where her children are now employed.

This is her sixth loan from MFP. Isabel, once again, promises to make her payments on time because these loans have helped her progress in her business. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more fish to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Fulgencia

texts.es:
Maria Fulgencia T. A. tiene 29 años y su estado civil es casada.  Vive con su esposo y 7 hijos.  El hijo menor tiene 10 meses y el mayor tiene 13 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura y siembra mora, papas, y maiz.  Sembraron el maiz en diciembre.  Hace las ventas de sus productos en la comunidad mismo cuando vienen los comerciantes. Tiene casi toda su vida en esta actividad y ayudaba a sus padres con los cultivos cuando era niña.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y remedios para el cultivo de mora.

Le gusta a Maria coser ropa para su familia y ver lo que está estudiando los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Fulgencia T. A. is 29 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and her seven children. Her youngest son is 10 months old and the oldest is 13 years old. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries, potatoes and corn. She planted corn in December. She sells her products in the community when merchants come by. She has been doing this almost all of her life. She used to help her parents with the harvest when when she was a small girl. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and remedies for the blackberry harvest. Maria likes to sew clothing for her family and to follow what her children are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and remedies for the blackberry harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Grimaldo D. 65 años, quien es su compañero D. toda su vida y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

El salón D. belleza que con tanto esfuerzo puso en su juventud le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Ahora su negocio ha crecido bastante y se ha convertido en uno D. los más importantes D. la ciudad, donD. cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales son fieles a sus cortes y cambios D. imagen.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y lo hace con mucho cariño y profesionalismo; lleva 30 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el olor D. los químicos D. los tintes D. cabello, ya que muchas veces le causan mareos. Para el futuro, desea convertir su salón D. belleza en un spa, donD. pueda brindar un servicio más completo a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo D. María con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si desea obtener otro crédito posteriormente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos D. belleza para su salón, ya que desea implementarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old. She is a happy and kind woman. She lives with her husband Grimaldo (65), who has been her partner all of her live, and she hopes to lead a calm life in her twilight years. The beauty salon that with so much effort she started as a young woman has provided her with the necessary income to support her family. Now her business has grown a lot and has become one of the most important salons in the city. They have many loyal clients who visit the salon for their hair cuts and styling. What she likes most about her job is taking care of her clients with care and professionalism. She has worked in this business for 30 years and she thinks the most difficult part is dealing with the chemical smell of the hair dyes, which sometimes make her dizzy. In the future she hopes to turn her beauty salon into a spa where she could offer a broader range of services to her clients. This will be Maria's first loan with MFP. She understands that she has to make her payments on time if she wants to receive another loan in the future. With the 2,000 new soles from the loan she will buy beauty products for the salon.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana Francisca L. es soltero tiene dos hijos los dos estudia, vive junto a su familia en el barrio san Agustín, es trabajadora activa de la alcaldía municipal desde hace seis años como conserje en la intendencia del bisne  
La Juan Francisca L. tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel ha cancelado tres crédito demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anterior obtenidos han sido muy importante ya que he mejorado mi casa brindando condiciones favorables a mi familia.
texts.en:
Juana is single and has two children. Both attend school. She lives with her family in the San Agustín neighborhood and works as a porter for the city hall. Juana has been working with CEPRODEL for the past four years and has had three prior loans. She has proven to be responsible and her previous loans have been very helpful and have allowed her to make improvements to her home, which has given her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia D. is 44 years old and from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Relais Djilakh Group

texts.fr: Le groupement les Relais de Djilakh est un groupe dynamique qui travaille dans le secteur de la vente de bétail il les achètent,les élèvent et les revendent dans les marchés hebdomadaires . Ce prêt va entrer dans le cadre du renforcement de leur activité commerciale et génératrice de revenu ce qui les permettent de disposer des bénéfices qui seront repartis sur le nombre de personne membre de l'association
texts.en:
The Relais de Djilakh grouping is a dynamic group which works in the livestock sales area. They buy them, raise them and then resell them at weekly markets. This loan will serve to reinforce their commercial, income-generating activity and allow them to make a profit, which will be divided between the number of people in the association.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal fattening

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren V. is a 55-year-old and she is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saren V. is a farmer while her husband, Mr. Thay Long, can earn a small income to support their family by selling rice. Since her husband's business is going well and in order to increase their income to support the family better, Mrs. Saren V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to enlarge her husband's business. This couple has a child who is a staff member of Acleda Bank. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti C., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishapati, lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Ram Kumar C. and he works in a private office. Her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. C. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She grows different types of vegetables on her farm. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. Nepal is an agricultural country, but new technology has not been introduced yet in farming. Therefore, the production of vegetables is not enough to feed the population of the country.

Mrs. C. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the morning and the evening. She is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. B. has been in the farming business for years. Since 1979, she has planted various crops to earn a living. Her husband (in the photo) works with her on the farming business. This older couple has been married for years and has a child who is already married. B. has been spending her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. B. faces a problem: her farmland is located far from the watering system so the crops often do not grow well. To resolve this obstacle, B. is pursuing a loan to purchase a machine to irrigate her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en: Ariel C.'s main source of income comes from providing haircutting services to local community members in his barbershop. He is 36 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Ariel has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ath Ny Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people who live in Sdok Prei village in Takeo province are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Sam Ath N. is a village bank president who is 47-year-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a congee and palm sugar seller who can earn some money to support her family and a side this she is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Sam Ath N. is seeking for a loan to buy more palm sugar to resale. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other two are chauffeurs, and the other is attending in local school to help all her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar to resale

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El señor Bernardo cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes y papelería, llamado “Papelería L.” el y su esposa tienen poco con el negocio, pero quieren que sea una tienda mas grande y con mas mercancía, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, son una pareja joven y todavía no tienen hijos, pero quieren tener una estabilidad económica para cuando los tengan. El señor Bernardo requiere de este crédito para invertir en el negocio de la tienda, surtiendo mas abarrotes y así aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Bernardo runs a grocery store and stationary shop called Papelería L.. He and his wife have little in their shop, but they would like to have a larger store with more merchandise, since it is their only source of income. They are a young couple that don't have any children yet, but they would like to be financially stable when they do have them. Señor Bernardo will use the loan that he is requesting to buy more groceries to stock his store and thereby, increase his clientele and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to stock his store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the village of Burgos. She is 33 years old. Irene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene is just starting this business.

In 2010, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Irene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Romely

texts.en:
Romely S. is from the city of Migcanaway Tangub City. She is 30 years old. Romely is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Romely owns & operates a business raising fish for sale. Romely has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Romely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Romely is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Romely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien T. N. is 42 years old. She is living with her family in Duong Yen village. She has two children who are going to graduate from vocational schools. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy a motorbike for them to go to work. 

Participating in SEDA’s credit program since 2004, she has used loans effectively in providing good educational conditions for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike as a means to go to work

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis de 44 años que es taxista, y sus 2 hijos jóvenes que le ayudan en el negocio, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida que lo expende diariamente a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son trabajadores de una empresa aledaña a la zona donde vive. Cada día se despierta al amanecer para preparar sus platillos y al mediodía reparte sus platillos previamente pedidos un día antes. Se siente satisfecha con su labor pues le permite obtener regulares ganancias que le ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de 2 vacas y 3 docenas de gallinas, de las que obtiene leche fresca diaria y huevos que comercializa al menoreo. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de comida e instalar un restaurante campestre, ya que por el lugar donde vive no hay nadie quien ofrezca este servicio. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marlene tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el pago de la inicial de un auto, ya que su esposo tiene el propósito de brindar el servicio de transporte, de esa manera espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 40, lives in her own house with her 44 year old husband, Luis.  Luis is a taxi driver.  They also live with their two young children, and they help her with the business.  They live together, and they have a great desire to get ahead.  They live to the north of the city.

For four years she has been selling food every day.  Most of her customers are workers for a business that is near where they live.  Every day she gets up at dawn to prepare her dishes.  At noon she distributes the dishes that were ordered the previous day.  She feels satisfied with her work.  It allows her to obtain regular earnings, and it helps her husband with the steady household expenses.

She also raises two cows and three dozen chickens.  She gets fresh milk daily, and she sells the eggs.  This enterprising woman plans to expand her business of selling food and set up a rural restaurant.  In the place where she lives there is no one who provides this service.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the individuals that made these funds possible.  This contribution will allow her to continue working and searching for progress.  Marlene plans to use the requested loan to make the initial payment for a car.  Her husband intends to provide his own transportation services, and they hope that this will improve their income.

loans.use: Buy a car so that her husband can provide transportation service

loans.name: Blanca Nubia Hurtado Cruz

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca Nubia H. C. ella  es Trabajadora activa del colegio Público CERMA desempeñándose como Maestra de educación Primaria  tiene  veinte años de trabajar como docente es casada actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando  para ampliarle a su casa con un muro alrededor de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca Nubia H. C. actively works at the public school CERMA as a primary school teacher. She has been working as a teacher for twenty years and is married with two school-age children. She has had eight loans with field partner CEPRODEL and she has used each one to purchase building materials to improve her house. She is requesting this loan to expand her home with a wall around her house. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly because she has been able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone quarry, iron, gravel etc.

loans.name: Eddy Alexis

texts.es: Eddy Alexis es un joven de 22 años, que se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio pues ha sido un joven muy emprendedor. Tiene 1 hijo de 2 años a su cargo el se encarga de trabajar para proporcionarle a su hijo y esposa lo necesario. Su Papa fue quien le enseño este medio de vida para que el lograra salir adelante en un futuro con su familia, así fue como Eddy se encargo del negocio, actualmente el tiene su propios clientes. Pero está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ganado ya que se acercan meses muy buenos como noviembre y diciembre que son muy buenos.
texts.en:
Eddy Alexis is a young man (22 years old) who buys and sells cattle.  He has had this business for more than three years because he is an enterprising young man.  He has a two-year-old son in his care, and he works to provide for the needs of his wife and son.

Eddy's father taught him this way of life so that he could have a comfortable future with his family.  That is how Eddy began in the business, and now he has his own customers.

He is asking for the loan to buy cattle since November and December, which are very good months for him, are approaching.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” , ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 65 años de edad, es  viuda y no tiene hijos,  la señora  no cuenta con estudios.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 04 años,  su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de ganados.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de más ganado.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar sus ganados y así obtener mejores ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 65 years old, widowed and doesn't have any children.  She did not receive any schooling.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for 4 years.  Her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling livestock.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying more livestock.

Juana's dream for the future is to improve her livestock and thereby obtain better profits.

What she most likes about her community bank are the savings.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Mujeres De La Hondonada Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the group Mujeres de la Hondonada (Women from Hondonada). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and one child.

Santa has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business, which supplies salons in her neighborhood with hair products. With this loan she intends to purchase hair products such as shampoo, rinse, and conditioner. She believes that this will allow her to supply more salons and to distinguish herself by always having what is needed in stock, while providing high quality products. She will use the profits to invest in her business, to address some needs in her family and to save. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients and eventually have enough profits to purchase her own home.

loans.use: To buy hair products such as shampoo, rinse, and conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more peanuts, pepper, oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Eudiviges  Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eudiviges; ella tiene 73 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. costureria  y tejidos ella elabora sus tejidos D. su casa y con la ayuda D. sus hijos, a la vez la socia es jubilada D. una empresa privada en el área D. auxiliar en contabilidad, dé esta forma la socia hace lo que le gusta y se entretiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. materiales para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Los Heraldos community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Eudiviges. She is 73, married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her seamstress and weaving business. She makes her weavings in her house with the help of her children. She is retired from a private company where she was an accounting assistant. She now does what she likes to do. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: for the purchase of materials for her business.

loans.name: Iris Lorena

texts.es:
Doña iris, tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos y su madre, en el Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tamales y atol de elote, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, y su forma de vender es a través de un coche de tricicleta, en este instala la venta y sale por las calles ofreciendo sus productos.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar elotes para el atol y para los tamales  maíz, pollo y condimentos, prácticamente está adquiriendo toda la materia prima para poder hacer sus ventas. Con esta ayudara realizara sus ventas sin mayor atraso y sin preocuparse por los ingredientes, progresando de esta manera hacia un negocio mejor y con mayores ganancias para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Iris is 44 years old and lives with her three children and mother in Puerto el Triunfo in the department of Usulután.  She sells tamales and cornflower drink from her tricycle cart that she drives through the streets offering her products.  She has been conducting this business for 4 years now.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn for the beverage she makes and corn, chicken and condiments for the tamales.  This is bascially everything she needs for her sales.  With this help she will be able to continue her sales without delay and without worrying about how to acquire her ingredients.  She hopes her business will increase and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, chicken and condiments for her tamales and cornflower drink

loans.name: Marina

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 30ans, célibataire, mère de 2 enfants qui est dans la vente des friperies en détail depuis 2005 au coin de sa ruelle.

La gestion du  prêt passé à été pour elle  comme une école d’apprentissage, ou elle a perfectionnée sa manière de gérer ses revenus et son  stock au travers les enseignements reçus.
Elle a donc renforcé son activité en achetant  2 ballots de : tee-shirts pour femme et pantalons /jupe, elle avait fait un très bon choix pour ce qui lui générer des revenus.

Avec le prochain prêt, elle va encore augmenter son stock de marchandise, elle achètera :
      -1 ballot de chemises cintrées
      -1 ballot des ensembles légers
      -1 ballot  des tee-shirts.
Elle est sélective dans le choix de ses ballots car elle a pour but de vendre plus pour satisfaire ses clients.
Ses ventes journalières sont passées de 7000f jours à 20000f.les bénéfices en fin de vente sont entre 50000f et 60000f quand tombe sur une fin de séries.
Elle veut prospérer dans ce commerce pour aider ses enfants et ses frères dans leurs études .
texts.en:
This is a young woman of 30 years, unmarried, and the mother of two children.  She has been selling used clothing retail in and around her lane since 2005. Managing her last loan has been like an apprenticeship for her, and she perfected her method of managing her revenues and inventory through the lessons learned.  And so she has boosted her business by buying two bales of women's T-shirts and of pants and skirts. She made a good choice for what brings in the revenues for her. 

With the next loan, she is again going to increase her stock of merchandise by buying:
- 1 bale of cinched shirts
- 1 bale of light-weight outfits
- 1 bale of T-shirts

She is selective in her pick of bales because her goal is to sell more to satisfy her customers.  Her daily sales have gone from 7,000 to 20,000 francs. After-sale profits are from 50,000 to 60,000 francs upon the end of a series.

She wants to prosper in commerce in order to help her children and her brothers with their studies.

loans.use: Buying bales of used clothing for men and women

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Balbina después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se va a trabajar a un restaurante como cocinera. Ella nos cuenta que uno de sus hijos trabaja en una orquesta llamada “Laguna Azul” y por lo tanto ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una guitarra para su hijo.  
 
Balbina pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Balbina is 52 years old, has four children and lives in Cusco, Peru.  In addition to taking care of her household chores Balbina works as a cook in a restaurant.  She tells us that one of her children plays in an orchestra called "Laguna Azul" (blue lagoon) and therefore she needs a loan to buy him a guitar.

Balbina is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank and the Arariwa Association.  She is very grateful for this opportunity and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a guitar for her son

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
La señora María José Z. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de venta, reparación y recarga de batería para vehículos desde hace 10 años. Este es un negocio familiar donde trabaja junto a su hermano y papá. 
Ella con el crédito comprara especialmente accesorios para vehículos con el fin de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María José Z. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  She has had a small vehicle battery sale, repair and recharge shop for 10 years.  This is a family business where she works alongside her brother and father.

She will use the loan especially to buy vehicle accessories to expand the business.

loans.use: For car parts.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
La Sra. Lleny pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Decididas”  del distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Tiene 32 años, es conviviente y es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad.  Lleny pudo estudiar la secundaria completa.

En la búsqueda de nuevos ingresos para su hogar y con la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja con el mantenimiento de su familia, impulsaron a Lleny a acondicionar su casa y empezar el negocio del alquiler de dormitorios. 

Con 3 cuartos, poco acondicionados, pero muy ordenados y limpios, Lleny y su pareja implementaron el negocio de alquiler  de habitaciones.  Gracias a ello ahora ha podido construir nuevos dormitorios.

Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 planea adquirir nuevas camas, cómodas, cortinas para implementar y decorar sus cuartos, los que alquila a estudiantes universitarios, viajeros de otros pueblos y alguno que otro turista.

Lleny manifiesta estar muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo constante y las capacitaciones que les brinda a mujeres como ella para poder incursionar en el campo laboral.

En la foto la podemos ver con uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lleny belongs to the "Mujeres Decididas" community bank in Tarapoto district, San Martín province. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and four young children. Lleny completed secondary school.

The search for new sources of income for her home and to help her partner support their family prompted Lleny to set up rooms in her house for rent. Lleny and her partner started this business with 3 rooms, very basic but neat and clean. Thanks to the rental of these rooms, they have been able to build new rooms. 

With a loan of 1,000 PEN, Lleny plans to buy new beds, dressers, and curtains to set up and decorate rooms that she will rent to university students, travelers, and other visitors. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the constant support and training that it provides to women like Lleny who are venturing into business.

Lleny is pictured in the photo with one of her children.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and beds.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita V. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora  Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Carmelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Loni

texts.en:
Loni B. is a 30-year-old, married woman from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She and her husband have two school-age children. To earn a living, Loni owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. Specifically, she operates a small restaurant. Her primary source of income is derived from serving a variety of different traditional Filipino meals (such as afritada, caldereta, and bulalo) to customers in her local community. Loni has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Loni joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she is better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Recently, Loni successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Loni is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325), which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, spices, and meats. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Loni from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and its aim is to reach out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional food ingredients (e.g., vegetables, spices, and meats)

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is 68 years old and married to Rebecca Rotich. They are blessed with three children, 16, 14 and 12 years old.  Barnaba is a livestock farmer in Mutwot and has been doing this work for a period of 15 years, earning  a monthly income of ksh 10,000.

He has requested a loan of KES. 25,000, his fourth loan after successfully repaying the previous loans.  He hopes to use the money to purchase one cow for his farm.  The profits will be used to educate his children.

He hopes that he will own a big dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one cow

loans.name: Blanca Yolanda

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 51 años de edad, no cuenta con hijos menores de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo.  EL  lugar donde vive es en el centro poblado menor Chacupe bajo en el distrito de La victoria, el lugar donde vive no tiene servicios de agua y desagüe, ya que el consumo de agua lo realiza mediante un pozo o noria.

Blanca se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. 

Ella  desea comprar mas cantidad de animales para su crianza y venta, así como también sus respectivos  alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante esta  temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Blanca  es una madre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Blanca is 51 years old.  She does not have any dependent children and lives in her own home together with her husband.  She lives in a small village called Chacupe Bajo, in La Victoria district.  She does not have piped water or sewerage services.  She gets her water from a well or waterwheel.

Blanca raises and sells animals and poultry.  She raises hens, ducks and turkeys out the back of her home and, when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.

Blanca would like to buy more animals to raise and sell and also feed for her birds since demand rises during this season.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Blanca is a woman who is committed to her family and always watches over their well-being and development.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn is a 36-year-old mother with three school-aged children. To support the needs of her children, Jovilyn operates a hog raising business where she earns PHP 4,000 when she sells one of her pigs.

Wanting to have a bigger income, Jovilyn is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional breeding pigs and pig feed. 

In the future, Jovilyn hopes that her loan will pave the way for her to earn an income and be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding pigs and feed

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past 4 years, Faith has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and those that pass by. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation for the business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Faith dreams of expanding her business and operating as a wholesaler in the future. She wants to purchase chicks for her poultry business with the Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: To purchase chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
Cefferino Gustavo tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Cefferino se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar los productos a vender en las ferias.

Le gusta hacer deporte, y festejar las fiestas de patrono del Recinto en Octubre.
texts.en:
Cefferino Gustavo is 43 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their children. He lives in El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

This area is called V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, which is found located in Recinto Las Blancas, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This area has ten members who are dedicated to short-cycle farming planting maize, rice and beans.

Cefferino is dedicated to farming, especially maize, rice and beans. He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his necessities and expand production. His dream is to have a car to transport the products he sells at the markets.

He enjoys playing sports and celebrating the holiday of the patron of Recinto in October.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gbigbodote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBIGBODOTE est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même famille et qui résident tous ensembles dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sidonie est âgée de 38 ans et mariée à un certain Dossou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Sidonie et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sidonie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et apporter une aide à son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille, Sidonie mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la vente de repas. Sidonie prépare en effet de la nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs), qu’elle vend à son domicile. Sidonie s’approvisionne au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Sidonie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Sidonie et les autres membres du groupe GBIGBODOTE  sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Gbigbodote group is a group of three people from the same family, living together in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group’s representative, Sidonie, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  This is the third time the group has come to Alidé to request financial support to improve their business.  Sidonie is 38 years old and married to a man named Dossou.  The couple has four children, all attending school and living with them.  Sidonie and her husband work together to provide for their family’s expenses.  Sidonie only attended school for a short time.  For about 15 years, in order to meet her needs and help her husband provide for the family, she has been working selling meals.  She actually makes food (rice and cornmeal) and sells it out of her home.  Sidonie buys her supplies in Benin.  Demand from her customers is growing, and with her limited resources, Sidonie is no longer able to meet that demand.  Because of this demand and her limited resources, she and the other members of the Gbigbodote group are together requesting a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and corn

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: LA Señora Matilde es cliente antigua de la institución trabajando con nosotros desde el año 2002 con el grupo clavel, actualmente esta trabajando con el crédito individual, doña Matilde es una de la persona afectadas con el deslizamiento de Callapa ya que su casita se vino a bajo por el desastre que sufrió la zona , pero pese a ello doña Matilde sigue adelante ya que tiene el sueño de volver a construir su casita que le a costado tanto, ella se dedica a la venta de leche por la zona sur y a una compañía que el compra la leche el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de una vaquita lechera para así tener mas ingresos para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Matilde is a long-time client who has worked with Emprender since 2002. She was previously a member of the solidarity group “Clavel” (Carnation) and is now receiving an individual loan.

Doña Matilde was one of many people affected by the landslide in Callapa. Her home was destroyed since it was located in the disaster area. Nevertheless, Doña Matilde continues to press forward. Her dream is to rebuild her home, which will be a great cost.

Matilde sells milk throughout the southern district and to a company that buys milk. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow so that she can earn more money for her two children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ronald Francisco

texts.es:
Ronald, se dedica a vender especias y además es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo, trabaja distribuyendo a tiendas las especias, él tiene 3 años de dedicarse al negocio, las labores agrícolas las aprendió por su padre.
El necesita un préstamo de $300.00 para comprar mercadería y surtir el negocio, ya que comprara especias como pimienta, achiote, comino, entre otros que son necesarios para el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara para tener mayor tranquilidad con el negocio.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para sostener a su familia en buenas condiciones, contribuyendo a la superación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ronald sells spices and is also a farmer. He has three years of experience supplying spices to local stores. He learned farming from his father. Ronald lives with his wife and son.

He needs a $300 loan to buy merchandise to restock his business. He will buy spices in high demand such as pepper, annatto, and cumin, among others. The increased inventory will provide Ronald's business with a secure supply of spices. His goal is to work hard to support his family, and to help his son succeed.

loans.use: To buy spices such as pepper, annatto, and cumin.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Tessie has a shop that sells used clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is married with four children. She knows the importance of education very well and that’s why she has enrolled all of her children in school. She is a very active person and supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesale markets and sells to her local area clients at a profit. She has been doing her business for the past 10 years and has good knowledge about clothes and quality. Her husband is also very skillful and makes shoes. He supplies shoes to different shoe factories and shoe-selling shops. Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer more variety of clothes to her clients and increase her profits.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a restaurant since 2008; he prepares such Iraqi foods as kebabs. He has fifteen years' experience in this field, and a deep understanding of local consumers and he has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area. His restaurant is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He is requesting a $2800 loan to renovate and fix his restaurant’s floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his restaurant’s floor.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a businessman who sells clothes to earn a living.  With income from his business, he is able to provide for his wife and two children.  He has been running his business for eleven years and he has employed one person.  He has managed to grow the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.

Robert hopes to open other outlets of his business within five years.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 54 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. 
Florentina is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows. She has been raising cows for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice is a 38 year old woman. She has 2 children, ages 12 and 18.  She describes herself as jovial, understanding and persevering.  

She operates a clothing business where she sells to the local people in a busy shopping center.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Eunice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes.  Her business goal is to grow into a wholesale operation within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will open another clothing sales business.

loans.use: to increase stock of clothes

loans.name: Tuinuane A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tuinuane  in Western Kenya!Gladys is the facilitator of the Tuinuane A. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gladys takes care of three children at home, together with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund  in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Gladys had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Gladys was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales,Gladys will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tuinuane A will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 48 years old and married with four children. She takes care of three children. Venantie owns a restaurant business selling food and drinks such as beans, rice, potatoes, bananas, meat, soda etc.

This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 8:30 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Venantie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant by buying more food and soft drinks such as beans, rice, potatoes, bananas, meat, soda etc to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save in her future, reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant by buying more food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is a farmer from the village Kutiri, West Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband, Nikoloz, and a 31 year-old son and daughter-in-law. Tsitsino and Nikoloz lead the agricultural business of the family. They have 4 milk cows and produce, on average, 70 kg of cheese per month. They sell it at the local market. Also, the family has a pig and sells, on average, 10 piglets per year. Along with the above mentioned, Tsitsino and Nikoloz grow tomatoes, cabbages, peppers and greens on a family-owned plot of land. Tsitsino sells harvested vegetables locally to greengrocery retailers. Her son works in the local hospital as its security service employee and his wife works in the same hospital as a laundress. 

Total average income of the family is 950 Laris per month. Tsitsino plans to purchase an additional milk cow with the loan. Cheese production and sales will be increased by 25%. Tsitsino will use the increased income for covering medical costs related to the treatment of her husband, who has health problems.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ediman

texts.en:
Ediman is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Ediman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ediman has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ediman hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth, está decidida por un nuevo préstamo, para comprar productos para el negocio, como maíz, aceite, leña, condimentos, para fortalecer el negocio, esta nueva inversión le ayudara para darle seguimiento a la buena atención  a los clientes, con la intención de no bajar el nivel de ventas.
Su aspiración en torno a estos préstamos, es que administrando de manera responsable el dinero de los préstamos, continuara trabajando en la institución para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is taking out a new loan to buy products for her business such as corn, oil, firewood and seasonings.  This will strengthen her business.  The new investment will help her to continue providing her customers with a good service and ensure that her sales levels do not fall.

Ruth's aspiration for these loans is, by managing the money responsibly, to continue working with the institution so that she can develop her business.
