loans.use: to buy corn, oil, firewood and seasonings

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 30 year old a married woman with five children, and all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Aida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Florabel

texts.es:
Florabel es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio, tiene 30 años, es dueña de un negocio de ropa, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca desde hace 4 años, aprendió en Finca a poder ahorrar, la puntualidad le ayudó mucho y lo mejor que ha podio lograr es que su negocio pueda crecer, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder mejorar su carácter, a ser mas responsable.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para la campaña de Fin de Año.
texts.en:
Florabel is a member of the communal bank Milenio.  She is 30 years old and owns a clothing business.  She is the mother of 2 children and has been a member of Finca for 4 years. From Finca she learned to save, that being punctual helps her a lot, and the best thing, that she can grow her business.  The training has helped her improve her character and to be more responsible.  

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy clothing for the end of the year sales season.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 33 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Charity used her last loan to purchase adequate supplies to prepare food. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to purchase new items to expand product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Patricia Onorinda

texts.es:
PATRICIA ONORINDA tiene 35 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo.

PATRICIA ONORINDA se dedica a la venta de Ropa para damas y caballeros. Solicita el crédito para comprar calentadores, pantalones de gabardina, sueteres de hombres, camisetas, licras. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar más mercadería para satisfacer a los clientes. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. 
El sueño es tener incrementar el negocio y tener un local propio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia.
texts.en:
Patricia Onorinda is 35 years old, and is the single mother of two children, ages 10 and 5. She and her children live in the city of Chimbo, where she makes a living selling men's and women's clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including pants, shirts, men's sweaters, tights and other items which she can use to meet the demands of her clients.

Patricia buys her merchandise in Guaranda. One of the challenges she faces daily is competition from other vendors. Her dream is to grow and expand her business, and to eventually have her own physical location for her store. In her free time, Patricia likes to be with her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale, including gabardine pants, men's sweaters, shirts, tights and other items.

loans.name: Ilhan Ahmed

texts.en: Ilhan Ahmed is a 25-year-old single woman. She is a university student at  Alpha University College. Her problem is the lack of a laptop. She uses her friend's laptop during class presentations but it is very difficult for her when preparing assignments, as her friend is very far away. Kaaba provided her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. Now she uses her laptop for any required activity in the university.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.fr: Madame Zaninga est présidente de l’association d’affaire Uvumilivu.  Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont 5 enfants scolarisés. Elle débuta  le petit commerce en 2008 à partir de fonds reçu de son mari avant de rejoindre Hekima. Le crédit demandé va faciliter l’achat de 200kg  de farine de mais. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, rehabiliter sa maison  et payer les frais scolaires pour ses 5 enfants. Elle bénie  Hekima et le remercie.
texts.en: Zaninga is president of the Uvumilivu business association. She is 35 years old and married to a businessman; together they have five children who are all at school. She began her small trading business in 2008 with funds from her husband before she joined Hekima. The loan she has requested will facilitate the purchase of 200 kilos of cornflour. She would like to expand her business, do up her house and pay her five children's school fees. She blesses and thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to facilitate the purchase of 200 kilos of cornflour.

loans.name: Edissa

texts.en:
Edissa is 46 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 20 years, They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn is married and a mother of two. She operates a motorcycle transport business to support her family needs.  She applied for a loan of $150 from Pemci to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. She plans in the future to get a bigger loan and start a spare part shop. With the motorcycle the local community is able to transport their sick and especially expectant pregnant mothers during emergencies. The old, too, can pay for a ride from Carolyn’s Motorbike. This mode of transportation has been able to solve a transportation problem for her community. Carolyn is very focused and hardworking and we are proud to be associated with her.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. O. is married with four children. She is in business in order to put her kids through school. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business. She knows a little bit about accounting.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.en:
Sopiah is 34 years old and is married with three children. The first two are girls and the last one is a boy. Her husband, Akmi, sells vegetables. 

Sopiah and her family live in Sepatan in the  Tangerang District. To supplement her husband’s income, Sopiah sells household goods such as sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other toiletries in a small store in front of her house. In a day Sopiah can earn $10. She needs a loan of $50. With this loan, she will buy more goods to sell in her store, and thus more or less double her income. Sopiah very much wants to earn more money for her childrens’ education and give them a better life than what she grew up with.

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: When the people are good, the sales are high.  When the people are good, the money is good.  These are the thoughts of Naomi M., an elei printing businesswoman.  Because Naomi has six children in school and a husband to provide for, she sells her products from Monday to Saturday at the Permanent Block she has at the Flea Market.  Many people fret but she doesn’t because she says, the sales are quite outstanding.  She thanks S.P.B.D. for the loan because it has helped her business grow rapidly.

loans.use: To acquire material and textile ink for business

loans.name: Rabiba

texts.en: Rabiba is a 46 year old local resident of the Khachmaz Region, which is located in Northeast Azerbaijan. She has a small canteen in Khachmaz. She has been engaged in this business since 2002. In 2005 she borrowed her first loan in the amount of $200 to invest in her business. Now she wants to buy kitchen equipment for her canteen so she she has applied for a loan of $800.

loans.use: To Buy Kitchen Equipment

loans.name: Nasar

texts.en: Nasar lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and has a car parts shop in the main city of Kabul. He is the only person who supports his family because his father died during the war in Afghanistan. The shop is his only source of income. Now he wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and increase his business. He wants to make a good monthly income to improve his family's living standard. He is happy now.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Jen

texts.en: Jen is a 35-year-old widow who lives with her parents. She runs a beauty salon in her house, and is especially good at applying make-up. In a typical month earns about $40, and uses her income to support her parents as well as herself.  She has applied for a loan of $100 to expand her business, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Concepción De Maria

texts.es:
Maria Medreno is known to her friends as Conchita. She works selling costume jewelry of all kinds, and has her business in the market called Israel Lewites, in the city of Managua.

She began her business 10 years ago with money from her savings and help from her father. Later, she was able obtain a space in the market. She has realized several loans with Ceprodel which have helped her a great deal, allowing her to reconstruct part of her market stall, and to acquire greater quantities of products which keep her sales constant.

Her goal in life, as a mother, is that her small son will be able to complete his studies and have a profession in the future. For that, Conchita realizes she will have to put a great effort into building her business.

Concepción de Maria Medreno conocida comúnmente como conchita, es una dama que se dedica a la venta de bisuterías de todo tipo. Tiene su negocio en el mercado de Israel Lewites en Managua.

Desde hace 10 años comenzó su negocio con una inversión de C$ 5,000 (cinco mil córdobas) obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros y apoyo de su padre, luego a medida que pasó el tiempo fue surtiendo más sus productos hasta obtener el local en el mercado.

Hoy en día ha realizado prestamos en CEPRODEL que le han beneficiado grandemente, ha reconstruido en parte su local, ha adquirido mayores cantidades de productos y de igual manera ha podido mantener constante sus ventas. Su anhelo en la vida, como toda madre es que su pequeño hijo pueda realizar sus estudios y coronar una carrera profesional en el futuro pero para esto, ella está conciente que lo logrará esforzándose muchísimo en este trabajo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE INVENTORY FOR HER COSTUME JEWELRY BUSINESS, ALLOWING HER TO PROVIDE FOR HER SON'S EDUCATION AND FUTURE.

loans.name: Ladi

texts.en: Mrs. Ladi J. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells smoked fish and foodstuff and has been a LAPO member for 7 years. She has been in business for over 10 years and is requesting an $850 loan to enable her buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 40-year-old woman. She lives and works in Borj El Barajneh. Sahar owns a clothing shop. This is her seventh loan from Al Majmoua. Sahar is planning to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Zahra's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Zahra is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children. Zahra owns a small shop, called Khanga, which she started in 2005. Everyday she begins at 8 AM and ends at 8 PM. She earns a total of $90 in profits a month from her business.

Zahra is now hoping for a loan to purchase more items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Fatma, who also runs a small business herself.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en: Nana Ama A. is a fishmonger and also sells food items. She is divorced with two children. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for additional capital to buy more fish and food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish and food items to sell.

loans.name: Anwari's Group

texts.en:
Anwari B., wife of Z. A., lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of two children: one daughter, Waheed, and one son, Hadia. Waheed is in the 9th standard grade. Hadia is in the 6th standard grade.  Anwari’s husband makes plastic sheets. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years and sells his work to different areas and cities. Anwari B. successfully completed her frist loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She applies for this loan for her husband’s plastic sheets business.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Razia B. wants a loan for her wheat selling business. Kaneez B. wants a loan for her scrap work. Shamshad B. wants a loan for her livestock business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna M., is hard-working businesswoman, and a mother of three. She runs a small shop selling household items and utensils, a business she has been doing for two years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margaria used to occupy herself full-time with caring for her house and her family, but decided to invest her time in setting-up a business. So, one year, she set-up a small shop in her house. At the same time, Margarita learnt how to make natural yoghurts, so that for the last six months she has been able to sell these products. She offers them to her neighbours and her acquaintances in the market.

The loans she has asked for have allowed to invest in her shop and to make some renovations in her house. She would like to sell fruit juices in the market.

.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita solo se dedicaba al cuidado de su casa y de su familia, por lo que decidió invertir su tiempo en algún negocio. Fue así que hace 1 año instaló una pequeña tienda en su casa. Igualmente, Margarita aprendió a hacer yogures naturales, por lo que desde hace 6 meses se dedica a vender estos productos. Los ofrece a sus vecinos y a sus conocidos en el mercado.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para invertir en su tienda y para hacer algunos arreglos a su casa.Ella quisiera vender jugos de frutas en el mercado.

loans.use: To invest in her shop and to make some renovations in her house

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed I. is a 30-year-old businessman. He is a husband and the father of two kids who are currently in school. He trades in goats. He buys the goats from the northern part of the country and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Goat meat is enjoyed by many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable.

His business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the goats from the farmers. With the loan, he wants to buy more goats to serve his customers with good quality meat for their meals. He believes the loan gives him more resources to meet the demands of his customers. He also hopes to save more to support his kids in school.

He belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio trabaja como chofer de servicio publico en el Trufi 88 (Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa), es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre los gastos familiares (esposa e hijo pequeño). Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Pasankeri, ladera de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la transformación de gasolina a gas natural comprimido en su herramienta de trabajo.

Es su primer con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar la solicitud de Julio Cesar.
texts.en:
Julio works as a public transit driver in the Trufi 88 (Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa). This is his primary source of income with which he covers the family expenses (he has a wife and a small child.) He lives in his parents’ home, which is located in the zone Pasankeri, on the hillside of the city of La Paz. This loan would be used to change from gasoline to compressed natural gas for his working tool. This is his first loan with IMPRO; the qualification test approved the request from Julio Cesar.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Change Taxi Fuel to Natural Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gavhar would like to expand her business making national head-dresses.

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es:
La señora Noelali pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 638, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera con 2 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de bebidas (agua mineral, Pulp, gaseosas). Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos para administrar su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas, 6 cajas de pulp (néctar), 3 paquetes de agua mineral, etc.

Noelali manifiesta felicidad porque gracias a su habilidad para el trabajo su negocio crece día a día.
texts.en:
Noelali is a member of the Banco Comunal "Las Divinas," located in Jr. Salaverry Nº 638 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 44 years old and is a single mother with two adult children. With her first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of carbonated beverages. She has been working with the village bank for a year. Currently, she has a business selling beverages (mineral water, Pulp, sodas). She has the support of her children in the administration of her business. With this loan of S/. 1.200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 crates of soda, 6 crates of Pulp (juice), 3 packs of mineral water, etc. Noelali is happy because thanks to her aptitude for her work, her business grows everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 crates of soda, 6 crates of juice, 3 packs of mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a motorcycle repairer for five years. He has requested a loan of $1000 dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for motorcycles. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
Ahmad is speciA. in his work because he is unique in his area. The loan will also help him support his parents.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Edu

texts.es: Edu tiene 19 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en el pueblito de Cabana, a pocas horas de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive solo en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se viene dedicando al negocio de la venta de casacas desde hace 5 años, ayudaba a su familia en el negocio familiar, y es así que con todo lo aprendido decidió poner su propio negocio con el cual espera salir adelante, y progresar. Le gusta su trabajo porque es muy tranquilo y tiene independencia para realizarlo, a pesar de su juventud Edu es muy responsable en su trabajo y quiere hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro tener una familia a la cual brindarle solo lo mejor. Edu trabaja sin descanso durante todo el día, y como le pone mucho entusiasmo, termina agotado, pero se siente feliz porque sabe que es joven y aun puede dar mucho de sí. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y se ha comprometido a ser muy puntual en los pagos, con la responsabilidad que lo caracteriza. Con el dinero solicitado comprará casacas al por mayor para lograr mejores sus ingresos para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Edu is 19 years old and is a very hardworking young man. He lives in the small town of Cabana, a few hours away from the city of Juliaca. He lives alone in the home his parents left him. For the past 5 years he has earned a living by selling coats. He helped with his family business and with everything he learned, he decided to start his own business, which he hopes to grow in order to get ahead. He likes his work because it is calm and he has the freedom to complete his work. Even though he is young, Edu is very responsible with his work and wants to increase his business. Someday he will have a family and he wants to be able to give them the best. Edu works without breaks during they day, and since he gives it a lot of effort, he ends up exhausted. But he feels happy because he knows that he is young and still has a lot to give. This is his first loan with Microfinanaza Prisma and he promises to be on time with his payments since this is a known responsibility. With this loan he will buy coats at a wholesale price in order to increase his earnings and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirasol B. is 32 years of age, married, and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman. Their business started when her husband worked on big fishing boats and earned a meager income. With the challenges of living as a couple, they have opted to run their business on their own. It's a matter of making a little sacrifice especially in the changes of weather, slow buying or availability of fish. Sometimes, they even get zero catch.

Both of them have to manage their business well and they work together to sell their catch at the nearest market. They wanted to apply for a Php 7,000 loan from Paglaum MPC. They want to improve their business and hopefully build a house of their own. Above all, Mirasol wants to save for their old age. She says thanks to Paglaum MPC for the continued support, not only for herself but for her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Grinssis Del Carmen

texts.es: Grinssis Del Carmen V. C. vive en San Martin ubicado en el oriente del país, Grinssis es madre soltera, una mujer luchadora que se las ingenia día a día para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, en la casa de Grinssis viven sus tres hijos que son menores de edad y su hermana , que es de un gran apoyo para esta mujer, Grinssis monto una tienda en su casa pero al contar con la ayuda de su hermana Grinssis decidió salir de casa dedicándose a la venta de pollos y embutidos en el mercado de San Martin. Ahora Grinssis solicita un crédito para surtir ambos negocios, ya que su venta de pollo tiene mucha demanda y muchos clientes le solicitan mayor cantidad de pollo de la que su capacidad económica puede cubrir. Con este préstamo esta mujer luchadora lograra expandir sus negocios y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Grinssis Del Carmen V. C. lives in San Martin, located in the east of the country. Grinssis is a single mother, a born fighter who thinks up ingenious ideas day to day to be able to cover the necessities of her home. In Grinssis's house live her 3 young children and her sister. Grinssis decided to leave home, dedicating herself to the sale of chicken and sausages in the San Martin market. Now Grinssis is seeking a loan to stock up both businesses, now that there is a great demand for her chickens and many clients are asking for a larger quantity of chickens than her economy capacity can cover. With this loan this fighting woman will achieve the expansion of her businesses and will obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell at market

loans.name: Abdul Jamil

texts.en:
A. Jamil is the son of A. G.. He lives in District 16 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has six children. He owns land in which he works hard to earn money and to achieve all the goals of his family members. 

He has been involved in agriculture since he was a child.  His father was a farmer and he learned how to work on the land from his father. He is very interested in farming and would like to progress well, so he wants to take an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.

He would like to mention that this is the best process to support all entrepreneurs to help them expand their businesses and be good businessmen in the future.

loans.use: Progressing and buying additional farming tools

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is 45 years old and she is married with three children. All her children are currently in school.  She lives at cape coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, and lanterns etc. She has been trading for eighteen years now. She attracted a lot of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan amount to buy more supply of the products such as cooking utensils. Which is frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make a lot of profits to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Mary wants to increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is 42 years old and vending has always been a good source of income for her. She was married to Cresencio who is 5 years younger than she. They were blessed with three children: Michelle Joy - 22 years old, Kenneth Mark - 19 years old and a third year high school student, and Atasha Mae - 4 years old, and a pre-school student. They are happy living in Luna, Isabela.

She is engaged in wholesale and retail sales. She sells fresh eggs and dried fish in the market. Her weekly net income is around 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $61) which they budget to support the basic needs of their family. However, it is not sufficient to satisfy their needs; she and her husband are working hard to sustain their business for their future. For this she decided to request a loan amounting to 16,000 pesos. She believes that strong determination and patience are the keys to success.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: BINETA K. EST UNE JEUNE FEMME QUI HABITE CHEZ SES PARENTS AU QUARTIER GOUYE SOMBEL DE THIES .ELLE EST ENSEIGNANTE DE PROFESSION ET EST CELIBATAIRE SANS ENFANT.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE  TERMINER LES TRAVAUX DE CONSTRUCTION DE LA MAISON FAMILIALE AVANT L'ARRIVEE DE L'HIVERNAGE.
texts.en:
Bineta K. is a young woman who lives with her parents in the Gouye Sombel neighborhood in Thies. She is a professional teacher and is still single and has no children. She is asking for this loan with the intention of finishing building the family house before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: finishing building her parents' house

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De N’Tjila Group

texts.fr:
A majorité  des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux,  Benkadi 2 est un regroupement du village de N’tjila de la  préfecture de Bougouni, région de Sikasso (république du Mali)
 Elles se sont connues par des relations associatives hivernales. Elles ont aménagé 5 hectares pour la campagne agricole dont 3 hectares pour le sorgho et  2 hectares pour l’arachide.
Afin de renforcer leur productivité agricole, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire la culture du sorgho et d’arachide.
 Elles sont à leur troisième prêt agricole et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 15 petites houes pour semer et sarcler, 80kg d’arachide graine pour la semence, directement achetées sur marché de Bougouni.  
A la récolte, elles comptent sur une production de 1 tonne 320 kg de graine d’arachide et 4,5 tonnes de sorgho. Les produits sont vendus sur le marché de Bougouni au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec un prix de 300FCFA, le kilogramme d’arachide et 100FCFA le kilogramme sorgho, elles espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA chacune à la fin de la campagne qui sera utilisé selon elles dans les activités génératrices de revenus pour les faire occuper pendant la saison sèche.
texts.en:
The majority being married women having an average age of 28 and three children, living in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children, and husbands, "Benkadi 2" is a group from the village of N’tjila of Bougouni prefecture, Region of Sikasso (Republic of Mali). The women know one another through off-season social ties. They have cleared five hectares for the planting season, including three hectares for sorghum and two hectares for peanuts. To bolster their agriculural production, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow sorghum and peanuts. They are now on their third agricultural loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With the current loan, they intend to buy fifteen small hoes for planting and weeding and also 80 kg of peanut seeds for planting, purchased directly at the Bougouni marketplace. Upon harvest, they are planning on a production of 1.32 tonnes of peanuts and 4.5 tonnes of sorghum. The produce is sold in cash at the Bougouni marketplace. Their customers are composed of men and women. With a price of 300 francs CFA per kilo for peanuts and 100 francs a kilo for sorghum, the group members each hope to obtain a profit of 40,000 francs at the end of the crop year. Their profits will accordingly be used in revenue-generating work to keep them busy during the dry season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy minor supplies and equipment for farming and planting

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra M. is a resident of Barangay Lamo Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is a simple mother of three and a loving wife to Ligion M.. Her children are presently studying in high school and in elementary grades. Despite the hardships of life, the couple remains strong and perseveres for the progress of life.

Her husband drives a passenger jeepney while Myra manages a hog-raising business. Because of lack of financial capital to sustain her business, Myra was encouraged to borrow PHP10,000 from Kiva as financial assistance with her hog-raising business. She will buy stock of hog-growing feed and, somehow, an additional piglet to further grow her business. She realizes that the livestock business is also a good livelihood to help cope with the difficulties of life.

loans.use: To purchase hog-growing feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old and is studying law and political science at the National University of Ucayali in the city of Pucallpa. Karina has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a little more than two years and belongs to the communal bank, "Los Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes). Karina dedicates herself to her studies and also works at the social program "A Crecer" (Toward Growth), a government enterprise which helps poor women and their families.

Karina invests in a small food stand/cafe run by her mother and two employees at the Amazonian Intercultural University (UNIA). She plans to use this loan of 1,300 Nuevos Soles to invest in basic food products for her mother's cafe. Karina hopes to continue to finance her university studies with profits from this little business, in which she also invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) from Manuela Ramos.

Karina is very thankful for the financial support from Manuela Ramos. She is committed to being responsible with her loan and punctual in her payments.

loans.use: Basic food products for a cafe/ food stand

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina sells provisions, drinks, bread and recharge cards and she has been in the business for the past 4 years. Tina lives in Lagos. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. Tina is grateful to KIVA lenders for their financials support adding that she will increase her business. Tina hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more provisions and recharge cards to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Atito Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la couture mais elle n’a pas trouvé les moyens pour ouvrir un atelier de couture. Elle est mariée, mais en 2001, son mari est décédé. Cette veuve a donc décidé de se lancer dans la vente des articles de merceries comme des fils à coudre, des tissus kaki et popelines. Cette nouvelle activité lui permet désormais de subvenir aux besoins de ses 03 enfants. Pour renouveler son stock presque épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 rouleaux de kaki, 12 rouleaux de popelines blancs, 12 rouleaux de popelines carreau rouge, 12 rouleaux de popelines carreau vert et 20 rouleaux de diverses couleurs. Elle a ouvert sa boutique de mercerie dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman learned how to sew but she did not find the means to open a seamstress shop. She got married, but in 2001 her husband passed away. This widow therefore decided to begin selling sewing supplies such as thread, and khaki and poplin fabrics. This new business allows her to meet the needs of her 3 children from now on. To renew her almost exhausted supply she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 4 rolls of khaki, 12 rolls of white poplin, 12 rolls of red checkered poplin, 12 rolls of green checkered poplin and 20 rolls of various colors. She opened her sewing store in the Baguida neighborhood of Lomé.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and sewing supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia D. is from the village of Dulag, Iligan City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Amalia owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdull Wahid Group

texts.en: A. Wahid is the group leader of the A. Wahid group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 20,000 Afghani.Shafeqa wants to take out a loan for her business of quilt.Najellah wants to take out a loan for the business of tailoring. And A. Wahid wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. They thank Kiva lenders that can support poor people.

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin  sells sarongs in front of her house and has been in the business for the past 8 years. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children.   She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State and she has been with LAPO for years. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sakomah Group

texts.en:
This is the Sakomah Group, made up of Memuna K., Kadiatu C., Yeabu K., Sallay K., and Niamatu T.. They are seeking a loan of 2.5 million LE from SMT (a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone, Waterloo) and Kiva lenders.

Memuna (second from left) is the group’s leader, and she owns a bar and restaurant where she sells drinks and food such as fried chicken and shwarmas (sandwich-like wraps of shaved meats).

Memuna is 43 and is married to a retired army major, and together they have two children, both of whom are currently attending secondary school.

Memuna has been working in the restaurant business since the age of 12. Twenty years ago, she opened her own, and now she is seeking a loan so that she can expand the stock of drinks she keeps on hand.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
el sr. HENRY S. tiene 2 1/2 años de haber iniciado con su pulperia, misma que opera bajo el nombre de "Púlpería ANY" ademas de su negocio tambien tiene un molino de Maíz, sus negocios los tiene ubicados en su casa de habitación.
Don Henry, se levanta a las 4:00 A.M a moler el maíz para las personas que se dedican a la venta de tortillas y otras mujeres que se levantan para moler maiz para su consumo ya que tienen que hacer las comidas temprano a sus esposos que salen a trabajar en las fincas y montañas en comunidades de Oculi.
sus clientes lo prefieren por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que él ofrece, hasta los otros dueños de pulperías dicen que don Henry es el que vende mas barato de la comunidad, el
lo hace así para tener mayor rotación de inventario y ganarse cada dia mas a su clientela.
El Sr. S., es casado y padre de 4 hijos, los cuales dependen a un 100% del matrimonio y su esposa se dedica a la Sastreria (modista) misma que recibe sus ingresos extra y en lo poco que ella puede colabora a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar y cubre sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry S. has been working for 2.5 years with his grocery store, which operates under the name "Pulperías ANY". In addition to his business, he also has a corn mill. Both businesses are located in his home. Mr. Henry wakes up at 4:00 am to grind corn for people engaged in the sale of tortillas, and other women wake up early to grind corn for consumption as they have to make meals for their husbands who go to work early on farms and mountains in the communities of Oculi. His customers prefer him for the attention that he gives them and the prices he offers. To the other owners of similar grocery stores, they say that Mr. Henry is selling too cheap to the community, which means he has higher inventory turnover and earns more from his customers every day. Mr. Sullivan is married and has 4 children, who are 100% dependent on Henry and his wife, who focuses on tailoring (as a dressmaker) for which the family receives extra income. What little she can save goes to cover certain household and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, butter, soap, salt, coffee, seasonings, corn and wheat flour, instant soups, juices, churros, margarine and eggs

loans.name: Ghena

texts.en: Ghena is a 28-year-old single woman. She has owned a roasting business since 2004. She serves the neighboring villages. Today, Ghena is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase her purchases in order to augment her sales and make a good income.

loans.use: Increasing purchases

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian B. L. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San miguel, junto a su esposo y su nieto de 5 años de edad. Ella tiene una venta de antojitos típicos, los cuales son comidas típicas salvadoreñas, como yuca frita, tamales, ayote en miel, entre otros más. Cada día Ana Mirian coloca su venta frente a su casa con el deseo de poder obtener una buena ganancia, la cual le permita llevar el alimento a su hogar. Ella solícita un préstamo ya que desea vender otro tipo de productos como verduras y frutas, lo cual le permite percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian B. L., 43, lives in San Miguel department with her husband and 5-year-old grandson. She sells typical Salvadoran snacks like fried yucca (manioc, cassava), tamales, candied ayote (squash), among others. Ana Mirian sets up her stall in front of her house every day hoping to earn good profits that will allow her to provide food for her household. She is asking for financing because she wants to start to sell other kinds of products, like fruits and vegetables, which will increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her four children in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her children live in a Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger." Her eldest daughter, 22, attends university, and her eldest son, 20, is in the army; her younger son, 17, is disabled while the youngest son, 9, goes to a local secondary school.

Chimedtsogzol supports her family by operating a door-to-door grocery and dairy product retail business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with working capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD). Over the years of business operation she gained much experience and is well known among her customers. Now her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). She attributes her business success to her good accounting and communication skills. She says, "For the future I am planning to expand my business further, but my main business goal is to provide quality products to my customers." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase dairy products to sell this coming winter when dairy products become scarce and prices for these products rise.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Edwin Henry

texts.es:
Edwin Henry G. G. tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero.  Tiene 2 hijos, se llaman Kevin Alexander (4 años) y Leidy Liliana (2 años).  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Edwin se dedica a la agricultura.  Suele sembrar en enero y cosechar en agosto.  Vende sus cosechas de maíz, choclo, papa, chocho, y cebada en las ferias en San Miguel los días jueves.  Además crece ganado y tiene 7 vacas las cuales también vende en la feria.  Los desafíos principales que enfrenta Edwin son la sequía y los precios de los productos.  A veces los productos son muy baratos y los insumos cuestan más que los productos mismos.
Solicita el crédito para insumos de la agricultura y para la compra de fertilizantes.  Mu meta para el futuro es comprar su terrero propio y tener una casa.  Actualmente trabaja en el terreno de sus padres.
Su hobby es la carpintería.  Le gusta hacer muebles para su casa y también como un negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin Henry G. G. is 26 and single. He has two children; Kevin Alexander is four, and Leidy Liliana is two. He lives in the San Miguel region in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raise small animals. Edwin is a farmer. He plants in January and harvests in August. He sells his corn, sweet corn, potatoes, Andean lupin beans, and barley at the fairs in San Miguel on Thursdays. He also raises livestock. He has seven cows, which he also sells at the fair. The challenges Edwin faces are drought and the prices of the products. Sometimes the products are very cheap and the supplies cost more than the products themselves. He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers. His goal for the future is to buy his own land and to have a house. He is currently working his parents’ land. His hobby is carpentry. He likes to make furniture for his house and also as a business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Sánches es una persona muy inteligente que inició su negocio de venta de calzados en el mercado El Bisne en Chinandega y hasta el momento ha logrado suplir el negocio de calzados por lo que a diario varios clientes llegan a visitarle para comprar el producto.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los calzados principalmente los colegiales para ofrecerlos por lo que ya inició el año escolar y debe venderlos a lo inmediato. Ella espera que el crédito le sea otorgado y así seguir mejorando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla is a very bright woman and began her business of selling shoes in the “Bisne” marketplace in Chinandega. Until now she’s been able to maintain her business because she has customers who buy from her daily. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in more shoes, particularly school shoes, as the school year has begun, and she must begin selling them immediately. She hopes that this loan will be granted so that she can continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in shoes for resale

loans.name: Feliciana Rumiana

texts.es:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. tiene 46 años y es madre soltera.  Vive con sus 4 hijos que se llaman Angel Pedro de 22 años, Segundo Julian de 12 años, Holgo Piedad de 9 años, y Nancy Veronica de 6 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Feliciana trabaja en el cultivo de mora desde hace unos 20 años atras y siembra mora, maiz, papas, y mellocos.  La mora vende en la comunidad, el resto de los cultivos para el consumo y vende en el mercado en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, liquidos de fumigación, y fertilizantes.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su terreno.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta coser ropa y ver tele.
texts.en:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. is 46 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her 4 children: Angel Pedro is 22, Segundo Julian is 12, Holgo Piedad is 9, and Nancy Veronica is 6. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. She has been growing blackberries for 20 years now; she grows blackberries, corn, potatoes and mellocos (a plant grown primarily as a root vegetable, secondarily as a leaf vegetable; it can be cooked like a potato). She sells the blackberry in the community, the rest of the crops are for consumption and sale at market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers plus liquid pesticides to fumigate. Her dream is to have more land in the future. In her free time, she likes to sew and watch TV.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic and chemical fertilizers plus liquid pesticides to fumigate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Madame Sophie M. est une femme mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 21 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Baye Laye et est membre de la caisse depuis octobre 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 2 prêts antérieurs. Lorsqu’elle a pris sa retraite elle s’est orientée vers le commerce de tissus saints, de balaies, de détergents  et de savons antiseptiques. Madame M. a choisi cette activité  car elle ne voulait pas rester oisive. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renouveler son stock de tissus saints et de détergent. Ceci lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son commerce et d’augmenter ses ressources.
texts.en:
Sophie M. is married and the mother of 8 children, ages 10 to 21 years old. She lives in Baye Laye and has been a member of the bank since October 2005. She has already received 2 previous loans. When she retired she started selling cleaning cloths, brooms, detergents and antiseptic soaps. Mrs. M. chose to start this business because she didn't want to be idle. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 frs to restock on cleaning cloths and detergent. This will enable her to make her business more profitable and increase her resources.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning supplies

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. His son is a primary school student and his daughter attends kindergarten.

Currently Janarbek operates a firewood transportation business with a truck he owns. Previously he operated an auto repair service for several years, and he purchased a truck which now he uses for his business.

He is an experienced driver and a very hardworking person. Janarbek says, “I would like to create my own auto repairing center in the future.”

He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to transport firewood from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Santa Rosita Group

texts.es:
L. venta D. comida ha dado algunas ganancias a Edith, por las mañanas venD. gelatinas, flan, y otros productos, a medio día venD. menú a los clientes que ya L. conocen, y por las noches venD.  frituras como: salchipapas, hamburguesas, Todo esto realiza para tener mayores ganancias y mantener a sus 6 hijos, elL. comenta que no es suficiente pero se esfuerza por darles lo necesario.
Hace 5 años Sulma venD. ropa ambulatoriamente, elL. es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo también aporta en casa. ElL. desea invertir en L. compra D. ropa para dama ya que se acerca el día D. L. Madre y tendrá muchos pedidos.
Olimpia aperturo una tienda hace varios años, como todo comienzo es difícil elL. no fue L. excepción  ya que no contaba con mostradores para exhibir sus productos, con los prestamos y mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir lo necesario para seguir adelante con su objetivo, ahora elL. está contenta ya que tiene clientes y por enD. algunos ingresos para vivir. Estas personas son algunos socios D. L. Alcancía Comunal Santa Rosita que son puntuales y responsables con sus pagos. 
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Selling food has brought Edith some income. In the mornings, she sells jellies, flans, and other products. At midday she sells lunch food to customers who know her well, and in the evening she sells fried food such as fries with sausage and hamburgers. She does all this in order to have a better income and look after her 6 children. She says that it is not enough, but that she strives hard to give them what they need. For 5 years, Sulma has been a travelling saleswoman dealing in clothes. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband also helps with the household expenses. She wants to use the loan to buy women's clothing as it is close to Mothers' Day and she will have many orders. Olimpia opened a store some years ago. Every beginning is difficult, and hers was no excepcion as she did not have cabinets to display her products. With the help of loans and a lot of effort, she was able to add what she needed to be successful and she is now happy to have customers and, consequently, income to live on. These people are some of the members of the savings group "Santa Rosita". The members are timely and responsible about their repayments. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Nare

texts.en:
Loan Term (low and high range):	20 months

Mrs. Nare K. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy K., live about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 1992 and have five sons. Three of their sons attend school, one is a garment factory worker and another one is still young.

Nare has been a garment factory worker for more than two years. Her husband has been a policeman in Phnom Penh for more than twenty years and he also drives a motor taxi when he is free. Nare is applying for a loan of $800 to concrete her house foundation.

Pictured: Mrs. Nare K. and her husband.

loans.use: To concrete her house foundation.

loans.name: Mrs. Sorn San Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Sampan Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sorn S. was selected as the village bank president by the other members who will each use a part of the loan for different purposes. She is 64 years old and is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops to sell to support her family's living. Her problem now is that it's the right time to grow crops on her field but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Sorn S. is asking for a loan to buy cane to grow and fertilizer; with the rest of the loan, she will rent a plow machine to plow her field. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a waiter and the other does farming.

loans.use: To buy cane to grow and fertilizer, and to rent a plow machine

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Buying and selling animals is part of 31-year-old Mr. Leak S.’s daily routine. Leak S. always leaves home to buy animals and fatten them for a while at his house before selling them to gain income. 

He has another financial earner in his wife, who sells Khmer noodles in the village. This couple has two kids who are still young and not enrolled in school. 

Because his current business is the main financial contributor for his family, Leak S. wants to accumulate its capital and sustain its growth. Leak S. is asking for a loan in order to purchase more animals, such as cows and water buffalo, to resell to raise profit. 

Leak S. was not available when the photo taken, so his wife and their children are pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase more animals to resell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice L. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Janice operates a family member's business operating motor transport services. Janice has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Janice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janice is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Janice from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. >About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is persistent in reaching her vision of growing her “sari-sari” (variety) store into a full-fledged mini-grocery store that has a huge quantity of inventories. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business (because she cannot re-invest her profits since it is also the main source of her family's daily expenses), Nenita is optimistic that one day her dream will land on the palm of her hand. For that reason, Nenita wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the time same to continue its operation. With Nenita’s passion of giving her children a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband meet the needs of her family.

Now, Nenita’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long term goals are to help support her children's education, invest, build a better house for the family and have a full-fledged mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To support the needs of her sari-sari store and continue its operation.

loans.name: Las Flores De Fortin Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa  de Inocencia M., un integrante del grupo  Las Flores de Fortín, que está ubicado en el Estado de  Veracruz  en México. Se ve  la entrada de la casa en donde se ubica la papelería de la señora Inocencia  en la foto. Ella se dedica a  la venta de artículos de papelería y regalos  que inició hace  3  años. Solicita el préstamo para  pagar mercancía que ya encargó pues se acerca la entrada a clases y tiene que estar bien surtida . Sus clientes  la ven como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Su papelería se ubica cerca de dos escuelas que son las que lo mantienen rentable . Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente  entusiasmada ya que se acerca una buena temporada de ventas. Tiene  58 años, estudio hasta el 6 año de primaria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total  4 hijos 3 mujeres y 1 varones. Quiere este crédito para pagar mercancía que ya pidió como libretas cuadernos plastilina y regalos También espera  el negocio le pueda ayudar a mejorar su vida y de esta forma apoyar a su hija con la crianza de sus nietos.
Salome A.   es la presidenta del grupo Las Flores de Fortín estudió hasta el tercer año de preparatoria y tiene en total  1 hija. Ella se dedica a venta de lencería que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para iniciar la venta de pasteles.
El grupo esta conformado por 12 de integrantes. Los otros integrantes son:
Yasmín S.(venta de verdura), 
Petra M.(venta de antojitos), 
Gladis M.(venta de comida), 
María Basilisa M. (venta de gorditas), 
Marcela Natalia A. (venta de cloro), 
Camerina L. (venta de pan), 
Matilde L. (venta de cosméticos), 
Concepción M. (bordados y tejidos), 
Gloria E. (Papelería) y 
Yuly Vianey E. (Renta de cuatrimotos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Inocencia M.’s house. She is a member of the Las Flores de Fortín (The Flowers of Fortín) group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. You can see her in the entrance to her house, which is where her stationery store is located. She has been selling stationery products and gifts for three years. She is requesting the loan to pay for merchandise she ordered. School will soon be starting, and she has to be well stocked. Her customers see her as a responsible and hard-working person. Her stationery store is located close to two schools, and they keep her business profitable. She is enthusiastic about requesting the loan because the season for good sales is approaching. She is 58 years old, and she has a sixth grade education. She is in a common-law marriage; and she has four children, three girls and a boy. She wants this loan to pay for merchandise that she has already requested. She will buy things like notebooks, folders, clay, and gifts. She also hopes that the business will be able to help her improve her life. That way she can help her daughter raise her grandchildren. Salome A. is the president of the Las Flores de Fortín group. She went to school until her third year of high school. She has one daughter. She has been selling lingerie for two years. She is requesting a loan to start selling pastries. The group is comprised of 12 members. The other members are: Petra M.(sells snacks), Gladis M.(sells food), María Basilisa M. (sells “gorditas”, which are small, thick, corn flour tortillas), Marcela Natalia A. (sells bleach), Camerina L. (sells bread), Matilde L. (sells cosmetics), Concepción M. (embroidery and weavings), Gloria E. (stationery store), and Yuly Vianey E. (rents four wheel drive ATV)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for merchandise

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group Amor y Amistad 1 & 2 (Love and Friendship). She makes her home here in a simple structure, living with her parents. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study and get professional knowledge.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and visiting the beach.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 6 years, starting with an initiative to have a business, with which she can help her family. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells gasoline and motor oil on the road close to her home, and to buy clothing to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in the business and to save, because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she believes everybody is involved with her in this loan; they are like family. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, motor oil and clothes

loans.name: Rosita Dela Cerna's Group

texts.en:
Rosita D. C. is from the village of Sangay Diot, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married and has four adult children. Rosita is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosita D. C.'s Group.

To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has just started this business.

In March 2010, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the first loan that Rosita has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell and provide working capital

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Mrs. Nak Pon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up a village bank loan located in Sdau Aem village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Nak P., 50, as the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Nak P. and her husband, Mr. Chan Nak Tom, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice on. They sell their yield to support their family and they are also basket makers. Her problem is that it's time to grow rice, but her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to fertilize it. So, to improve production, Mrs. Nak P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With any remainder of the loan she will hire a plow to plow her field and farming laborers. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a jeweler, while two others are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the fourth is studying in school.

 Mrs. Seun Port is a group guarantor so she is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señorita María Zhining es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al bordado labor que realiza hace 5 años y ha sido su hermana quien le enseño a trabajar en esta actividad, labora en su casa y no tiene un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y pollos  que son para el consumo de su hogar y en alguna necesidad los vende.
 
La Señorita María es soltera y tiene una hija de 8 años de edad que estudia en la escuelita de la comunidad, su padre tiene casa propia y nuestra socia vive solo con su padre ya que su madre ha fallecido hace 18 años.

Es socia fundadora de la banca comunal y ha llegado a tener un gran vínculo de amistad con todas las socias,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y así poco a poco bordar por su cuenta y hacer un negocio propio ya que ahora solo trabaja realizando obras para otras personas.
 
Su meta es entregarle a su hija un buen estudio para que llegue lejos y también comenzar  su propio negocio de bordados.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Zhining is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in the city of San Pedro, which belongs to the Victoria del Portete parrish, where most of the population works in farming and agriculture. And, where most of the people have moved to the city searching for a better job.
 
Maria embroiders for a living and has been doing so for 5 years - she works at home.  It is a craft that was taught to Maria by her sister.  Maria also breeds animals like guinea pigs and chickens, some which are for home consumption and some which she sells when she needs the income.
 
Maria is single and has one daughter (8 years of age), who is currently attending the small school in her community.  She lives with her father, who has his own home.  Her mother passed away 18 years ago. 

Maria is a founding member of the community bank and has come to have a great bond of friendship with all its members.  The loan will be used to purchase fabric and she hopes that little by little her embroidery business will take off on its own, since right now she is working for other people.
 
Her goal is to give her daughter a good education so that she can go far in life, and to start her own embroidery business.

loans.use: Comprar tela (To purchase fabric)

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es:
a Sra.Mayra  es una persona que esta pencionada por discapacidad y depende
de su esposo ah tenido con nosotros 2 creditos mas en los cuales ah demostrado tener
muy buena cultura de pago esta muy contenta con el apoyo que fundacion le ah 
dado uno de sus proyectos puso el vitropiso de su casa es una persona muy humilde,
trabajadora y y en esta ocacion va poner el porton de su casa porque tiene una niña de 
8 añitos y quiere tener mas seguridad ya que para ella la seguridad de su pequeña hija 
es muy importante.
texts.en: Mrs Mayra no longer works because of a disability and is dependent on her husband.  She has had two previous loans with us and has been very reliable with her payments. She is very happy for the support which our foundation has given her.  One of her projects was to put down tiled flooring in her house.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman and on this occasion she is going to install a front door in her house because she has an 8 year-old daughter and she wants to keep her safe.  The safety of her small daughter is very important to her.

loans.use: To install a front door and lay a concrete slab

loans.name: Amina Adjoa Daama

texts.en: Amina Adjoa Daama K. is married and has six dependents. She has received junior high education. Her husband works with a hospital dispensary. Amina sells second-hand clothing at Asenadze near Abura. She often moves around in the locality to sell her goods. Amina will add the loan to her capital to expand her clothing business. Amina uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her profit from the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: expand her clothing business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario, se dedica al servicio de transporte Urbano, tiene 31 años y su Esposa la Sra: Eynny de 34 años es ella quien le ayuda Ejerciendo Trabajos de Manicurista  en la zona donde vive. Los trabajos lo realiza  en las tardes en la misma zona y a veces se va a otros lugares donde ya tiene clientes fijos, en el transcurso de la mañana, Ella se Dedica a vender gaseosas   en su propio Domicilio, Tienen dos Hijitas una De 2 y otra de 4 Añitos.  Viven en el barrio 15 De Agosto, de la Zona de la Villa Primero de Mayo, El señor Mario se levanta desde muy temprano para trabajar y regresa casi siempre muy tarde , Solicitaron el Credito para poder dejar en mejor estado su Herramienta de trabajo el cual es, su vehículo. son personas responsables y buscan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario (31) is a taxi driver and his wife, Eynny (34), works as a manicurist. She does this work in the evenings and occasionally goes to other towns in the mornings, where she has regular clients. 

She also sells soft drinks from her home. They have two daughters, aged 2 and 4. They live in the 15 de Agosto district, in the Villa Primero de Mayo zone. Mario gets up early every day to go to work and generally gets home very late. The loan is to refurbish the tool of his trade, i.e. his car.

They are both responsible people who want to improve their living standards.

loans.use: Mechanical and electrical repairs of a taxi

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to passengers and earns income by dropping them at their designated places. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw and continue his transport services. Currently, his rickshaw is in trouble and doesn’t work well, which is affecting his earning. Perveen is hopeful that through the investment her husband’s rickshaw will become fully repaired and he can drive it for longer hours to increase his monthly income.

Perveen is 59 years old and lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and famous for its culture and history. She has been living there with her family for over 20 years. In order to financially support the family, Perveen does a job in a local school. She has only one son, and he operates a mobile repair shop in the market. 

Perveen is a very good and responsible person. Besides her job, she fulfills her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She is willing to marry off her son within a year, and she is hopeful that the improved business condition of her husband will help her save money for his marriage. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has  established a good credit record by paying her installments on time. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand up is Perveen.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and is single. He manages a clothing store for women and children in Kigali city center that is open from 8am until 7pm every day. This is his twelfth year in business. His business is well-known and organized. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan to purchase additional products to sell, such as clothes and shoes. Emmanuel will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit. With this profit, Emmanuel will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Roly Andres

texts.es:
Roly Andres tiene 24 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Roly Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y casa.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Roly Andres is 24. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He does not have any children. The V.R.C. Jerusalen group is located in the Caimito area, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Parish in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend much time doing this activity. Roly Andres works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. He purchases his products in the Garcia and Lopez Markets and sells in the Vaca Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, rice and gandul beans. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car and a house. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Cinthya Grimaneza

texts.es:
Cinthya Grimaneza G. A.  tiene 21 años, Es Soltera vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Cinthya Grimaneza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ser Doctora

Le gusta bailar, hacer amigos, festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Cinthya Grimaneza G. A. is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province.  She doesn't have any children.

The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) community bank is located in San Luís de Zapotal neighborhood, in Ventanas canton.  The 12 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Cinthya Grimaneza is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Agro Servicios in San Jacinto and sells her products in the same place.

Cinthya Grimaneza is requesting this loan so that she can sow her corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and seeds.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to become a doctor.  She likes dancing, making friends and celebrating Carnaval.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Ines Alfonso

texts.es: Inés Alfonso se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos, el es profesor y su salario era tan bajo que decidió experimentar con la venta de cerdos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues él es un hombre responsable y se encuentra muy contento con su actividad.
