Ines sale todos los días a su lugar de trabajo y ofrecer sus productos que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, concentrado entre otros que son los productos que mas solicitan.
texts.en:
Inés Alfonso buys and sells basic grains. He is a teacher, but his salary is low, so he decided to experiment with selling pigs. This is not the first time he has received financing. He is a responsible man who is very happy with his business. Inés sells every day at his place of work and offers his products to the majority of customers who request them.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, concentrated beverages, and other products that are most in demand.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Rosalia es cheff y trabaja en seguro social de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja en el área de nutrición y se encarga de las dietas de los pacientes. Ella tiene un pasa tiempo que consiste en colecciona cosas turísticas, ella nos cuenta que con estas cosas será para implementar el restaurante turísticas que piensa abrir. Ya son varios años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien.  Rosalia requiere el préstamo para comprar de utensilillos y muchas cosas más.
   
Rosalia pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Rosalia is a chef and works in the Social Security offices, in the city of Cusco.  She works in the nutrition field and is in charge of the patients' diets.  Rosalia's hobby is collecting tourist items.  She tells us that she plans to use these items in the tourist restaurant that she is planning to open.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going well.  Rosalia needs this loan to buy utensils and many other items.

Rosalia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Yahuar Maqui” community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To equip the tourist restaurant that she plans to open

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia inicia en la costa su negocio de venta de buñuelos, empanadas, arepas de huevo, pero después de un tiempo decide regresar a Medellín y en la parte de afuera de la casa monta su negocio de comidas.

La delicia de sus productos le ha incrementado sus clientes y por esto necesita comprar varios utensilios que le permitirán tener mayor variedad de productos y podrá además atender mejor a sus clientes.

Su gran sueño es poder tener un mejor espacio no solo para sus oxidad sino también para poder vender jugos naturales  y carne asada.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia started a business on the coast selling buñuelos, turnovers and egg arepas but after a time decided to return to Medellín and set up a food stand outside her house.

Her dishes are so delicious that the number of customers has grown so she needs to buy several utensils that will allow for greater variety of products as well as better customer service.

Her great dream is to have a better space not only for the food but also to be able to sell natural juices and grilled meat.

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Marlene Monserrate

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Marlene, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres niñas de 9, 8 y 3 años de edad, las dos mayores están en escuela. El marido  se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella trabaja en sociedad con su hermano, tienen un negocio de venta de frutas como: sandias, melón,  pepino, etc. Su forma de trabajar es la siguiente: ellos compran a agricultores de la zona, luego todas las mañanas se desplazan hasta el mercado en la ciudad de Portoviejo para  vender tanto al por mayor como al menudeo.  Trabajan de lunes a sabados desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00, dice que lleva ya algunos años que se dedica a esto y que gracias a este negocio a podido mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este crédito es para comprar: melones, sandias, pepinos, plátanos, piñas, manzanas, etc.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta por el apoyo y ayuda que ha recibido. Su sueño es mejorar su casa que está un poco deteriorada.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mejorando El Futuro” (Improving the Future) communal bank meet every other week in an area called Tierras Amarillas in the Rocafuerte canton.  This sector is known for its agriculture because most of its inhabitants grow short cycle crops.

This is the place where we find Marlene.  She is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has three daughters, ages 9, 8, and 3.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She works with her brother.  They have a business selling fruits like watermelon, cantaloupe, and cucumbers, etc.  This is the way they work:  they buy from farmers in the area, and then, every morning, they go to the market in the city of Portoviejo in order to sell wholesale as much as retail. 

They work from Monday through Saturday from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.  She says that she has been doing this for some years.  Thanks to this business she has been able to improve the quality of her life.

This loan is to buy watermelon, cantaloupe, cucumbers, bananas, pineapples, and apples, etc.  She has been in her communal bank for six years.  She likes the support and help that she has received.

Her dream is to improve her house, which is a bit rundown.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, cantaloupe, cucumbers, bananas, pineapples, apples and other fruits

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Rorn was born in 1979.  She weaves silk cloth to sell to earn money to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Voeun, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice to feed his family.   Although they try to work hard, they only earn a small  income.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Sa Rorn is asking for a loan to buy a breeding cow to start a new business. This couple supports three children who are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 25-year-old, single mother of two children living in her parents' house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of of the family with the help of her mother. Her dream is to buy land and construct a commercial house. For 3 years she has been selling clothes. The business is growing steadily despite challenges in irregular sells due to the seasonal nature of the business. Margret needs the loan to buy clothes to sell. Her dream is to own a boutique one day.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es:
En la parte de atrás de la humilde casa de Antonio José B. se encuentra un espacio destinado a la producción de arepas y aunque vive a unos 15 minutos de Santa Bárbara al suroeste de Antioquia, esto no es impedimento para que su producción sea vendida diariamente en el municipio y a sus vecinos. 

A sus 63 años de edad cansado de trabajar como empleado esporádicamente y con pocos ingresos para sostener a su esposa y cubrir los gastos del hogar, desde hace algún tiempo decidió enfrentarse solo para ganarse la vida. Actualmente se ha incrmentado el número de pedidos por lo que necesita de un préstamo para construir una estufa eficiente que le permita responderle a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the back of Antonio José B.'s humble home is a designated space for making arepas. Although he lives about 15 minutes away from Santa Barbara, in the southeast of Antioquia, this does not keep him from selling his product daily in the city and to his neighbors.  

At 63 years old, tired of working sporadically as an employee and having little income to support his wife and cover household expenses, he decided to go out on his own to make his living. Currently, his orders have increased which is why he needs a loan to build an efficient stove that will allow him to respond to his customers and to improve his income.

loans.use: build an efficient stove.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Adriana Gurdián es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de tres hijos, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para el aprendizaje de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda la que pretende mejorar poco a poco para el bienestar de sus hijos por eso una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir materiales de construcción como ladrillos, zinc y cemento para construir un cuarto y ampliar tal vivienda, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en: Adriana Gurdián is a native of the municipality of El Sauce.  She is the mother of 3 children, and she works as an elementary school teacher in a school in her area.  She has been teaching children for more than 20 years.  Adriana has her own home, which she is attempting to improve little by little for the benefit of her children.  At this time, one of the things she needs is to acquire construction materials such as bricks, sheets of corrugated metal roofing material and cement, so that she can build a room and expand her house.  For this reason, she decided to request her 3rd loan from Ceprodel so that she can accomplish this objective.

loans.use: to buy bricks, corrugated metal sheeting and cement

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Rehema has a business of outside catering, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business of selling second-hand clothes.

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rehema hopes to expand her second business.  Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. 

For the past year, Halima has operated a business selling mahamri (dumplings) at the market to her neighbors and villagers. She also operates a hairdressing business as another source of livelihood. Halima faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes difficult for customers to come to the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Halima plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Primavera Ii Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Sra. Agustina, que vive en la ciudad de Concepcion. La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando lsa metas que cada una tiene para su futuro.
Formaron juntas el comité denominado Primavera, el cual cuenta con 15 miembros actulmente, todas ellas con un gran espiritu de lucha, ya que cada una desea el progreso para sus familiares, asi como para ellas mismas.
Todas se dedican a la venta de minutas, como empanadas, tortillas, y demas, cuentan con una variedad un poco limitada para lo que ellas desean, por lo cual les gustaria poder invertir un poco mas en su negocio.
Solicitan el crédito para poder hacer una inversion en su pequeño local, con lo cual podran aumentar la variedad de sus productos y asi atraer mas clientes. Sueñan que en un futuro no muy lejano les estaria produciendo una gran cantidad de alimentos con lo cual podan aumentar sus ganancias.
Todas tienen un gran espiritu de lucha y quieren un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to Agustina who lives in the city of Concepción.  The president was motivated by the idea of creating something for her fellow group members, giving them all a sense that, through the committee, they would be reaching the goals that they each have for their future.

They created a committee called 'Primavera' (Spring) which currently has 15 members who all have a great fighting spirit since each one of them would like to make progress for the sake of their families as well as themselves.

All the members of the group sell snacks such as empanadas, tortillas, etc.  The range of snacks they offer is a little limited so they would like to be able to invest a little more in their business.  They are requesting this loan to invest in their small business.  This will enable them to increase the range of products that they offer and thereby attract more customers.  They dream that, in the not-too-distant future, they will be producing a large quantity of food which will enable them to increase their profits.

All of the members of this group have a great fighting spirit and want a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making the food that they sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria tiene 38 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Ana Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia. 

En los tiempos libre le gusta ver la television y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 38 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Ana Maria is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Ana Maria is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to own her own home.

In her spare time, Ana Maria enjoys watching television and playing with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia D. 51 años, es viuda, vive sola en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio D. agua solamente, ubicada en el distrito D. Mórrope que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Antonia desD. hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral (pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son amplios, los mismos que alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que lleguen a su peso y talla óptima para  ofertarlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga mayores ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.

Desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas aves D. corral, por lo que a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles, D. esa manera podrá satisfacer la necesidad D.  sus clientes y con los ingresos por sus ventas podrá pagar su crédito y salir adelante.  Antonia es una mujer que a pesar D. las dificultades que a tenido en la vida a sabido sobre llevarlas para mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonia, 51, is a widow.  She lives alone in her own house which only has running water and is located in Mórrope District that belongs to Lambayeque Department.  The zone is noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Antonia has been raising barnyard fowl (turkeys) to sell for the last ten years.  Her corral is in her back yard; it’s spacious.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural rains so that they will reach optimum size and weight and can be sold at the various local markets and obtain higher profits to cover her personal expenses.

She wants to expand the business buying more barnyard fowl so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to be able to meet customer demand and be able to use income from her sales to repay the loan and get ahead.  Antonia is a woman who despite the difficulties she’s gone through in life has known how to overcome them and improve in life.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of barnyard fowl of all species.

loans.name: Lidieth

texts.es:
Doña Lidieth S. tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Humilde y muy trabajadora. En la actualidad vive con su esposo y la hija menor de 8 años. Ella se dió cuenta de la Fundación por medio de una cuñada que es clienta hace varios años. Ella llevó cursos de corte y confección en la academia Loly Verona y hace cinco años se dedica a la confección de ropa íntima, pijamas, bolsos, set de baños y costuras a la medida. Inició su negocio porque le gusta; además para generar ingresos y cubrir algunos gastos tanto personales como familiares.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la toma de decisiones de su actividad. Su meta es tener un taller de costura grande y dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Doña Lidieth S. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She is humble and hardworking. At the moment, she lives with her husband and eight-year-old daughter. She found out about Fundación Mujer from her sister-in-law, who has been a client for many years. Lidieth took sewing and dressmaking courses at the Loly Verona Academy five years ago and learned how to make lingerie, pajamas, handbags, bathroom sets, and custom-tailored garments. She started her business because she enjoys sewing and wanted to generate income to cover a few of her personal and family expenses.

Lidieth has the support of her husband when making decisions about her business. Her goal is to have a large sewing workshop so that she can employ other people.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 41 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 17, 16 and 13.

Rosemarie has been a farmer for 18 years. She and her husband till land in Banga, South Cotabato. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Rosemarie requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for their business to be stable and would enable them to sustain their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya and has been in mixed farming for four years with his produce of milk, cabbages and tomatoes being sold to the local market. He runs a grocery within the local market to supplement his farming income. He is 21 and single.

Joseph has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. He says improved farming income will help him pay for his college education as well as make his farming business more reliable in meeting his daily needs. He is optimistic he will be a major supplier of goat's milk since many people have not ventured into the business.

He says, however, that lack of organized markets for the farm produce remains a challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Gillena

texts.en:
Gillena is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with three children and  she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the tailoring business for six years and she acquired the initial funds  to start the business from farming and bought a sewing machine. Her hardships are limited capital to meet the different tastes of customers and high taxation and  and her vision is a boutique plus educating her children.

Gillena needs the loan facility to buy a designer sewing machine and clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy a designer sewing machine and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town. He is single and has two children, ages  4 and 14; both of them are currently in school. He has been operating a provision shop for the past two years. Now he has more customers, so he wants to expand his business, but he has a small amount of capital that he operates his business with. He's requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for his business. He plans to build a house for his children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for his business.

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en:
Meldrina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Meldrina has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for seven years now.
In the future, Meldrina would like to save money to expand her business and repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 44 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Estela runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Estela has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  In the future, Estela hopes to alleviate their living condition from being poor through the continued support of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom attends school. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her outside catering, selling popcorn. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more popcorn for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling food. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more popcorn for resale

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
One of Wilfredo's goals is to improve his farmland and increase his yields to earn a larger income. He is 54 years old and married with six children. Three of his children settled for early marriage, two are college students, and the youngest is in elementary school. Wilfredo did not finish his studies because he didn't have enough money for his education, so he is doing his best to earn a living.

Wilfredo has been involved in agriculture for almost 30 years. He devotes his time to maintaining his rice fields to increase his income. He is thankful that his wife is supportive in improving their lifestyle. She raises hogs and helps Wilfredo with his farming activities. 

Wilfredo would like to purchase certified seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides, but he cannot afford them because of the high cost of basic commodities. In addition, he lacks sufficient income to pay for the labor costs of sowing, transplanting, and tilling the rice farm. He is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. With this loan, he hopes to improve their financial status and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides and pay for labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Joevelyn

texts.en:
Joevelyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Joevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Joevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joevelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza, tiene 51 años, es madre tiene 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 7 años.
Silvia tiene un puesto en el Grifo Ayacucho, antes trabajaba en la guardería de la Beneficencia, y su esposo le dio la idea de poder cambiar de negocio, y con un bajo capital empezó su negocio. Una amiga le invitó a Finca y desde la fecha no se retira, se siente muy feliz y da gracias que siempre la ayudaron con las capacitaciones, solo así pudo progresar ahora le va muy bien, con este préstamo comprara gaseosas, panteones y leche.
texts.en:
Sivia is a member of the “Firmeza” communal bank.  She’s 51 years old and the mother of three children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for the past seven years.

Silvia has a point of sale in Grifo Ayacucho.  She used to work in the public daycare center, and her husband gave her the idea to change businesses, so she started her business will a little capital.  A friend invited her to join Finca and since then she has not left.  She’s very happy and thankful that they have always helped her out with training.  It was this way that she was able to progress and things are going very well for her now.  She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, snack cakes, and milk.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 25 years old and single.  He is a farmer with four years of experience in dairy farming.  His produce of milk is sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his employment as a machine attendant.

Thomas has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to boost his farming income. He says it is economical to have many dairy cows in order to reduce the overall cost, especially that of treatment and transportation on animal feeds. He is optimistic with the business, saying he will manage to run a farm of five dairy cows.

He reiterates the major challenge he faces is on treatment for the animals.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 31 años es una joven muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante, desde pequeña supo que todo se puede conseguir si lo hacemos con dedicación y esfuerzo, a Alicia le gusta mucho cocinar y es por ello que uno de sus platos favoritos es el “Arroz con pollo”. Alicia ha estudiado hasta el quinto grado de secundaria,  pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser una Ingeniera agrónoma porque le gustaba mucho el campo; Alicia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos ; el mayor de sus hijos tiene 12 años y se llama “Joseph”,  se encuentra en sexto grado de primaria y el menor tiene 7 años se llama “ Mayte” y cursa el segundo año de primaria, es por ellos que Alicia lucha cada día por sacarlos adelante y porque ella nos dice que ellos tienen que ser mucho mejor que ella.
 
Alicia tiene su Fuente de Soda llamado “Mayte y Joseph”, y le puso ese nombre porque así se llaman sus hijos, en este negocio Alicia se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas, sándwich, ensaladas de frutas; ella le dedica a este negocio  alrededor de 13 horas diarias y atiende a 60 clientes diariamente, Alicia puede ganar hasta S/. 250 en un día, pero si es un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 300, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buen gusto para la comida y porque tiene mucha fe en Dios que es quien nunca la abandona.

Alicia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado, ya que con este apoyo podrá mas mercadería para su negocio y poder ampliar su local, con eta mejora tendrá muchos ingresos y así podrá ahorrar para poder cumplir su sueño: “Tener un local en una plaza Comercial”.
texts.en:
Alicia is 31 years old and is a woman who has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life. Every since she was young, she has known that anything can happen with dedication and effort. Alicia really likes to cook, and one of her favorite dishes is arroz con pollo (rice and chicken). Alicia studied through fifth grade, but she would have liked to keep studying to become an agricultural engineer because she really liked the country. Alicia is a single mother and has two children: 12 year old Joseph is in sixth grade, and 7 year old Mayte is in second grade. Alicia works hard every day to help them get ahead and she tells us that they have to be much better than she.

Alicia has a cafe she named "Mayte and Joseph" after her sons. She works here selling fruit juices, sandwiches, and fruit salads, and she works around 13 hours a day and serves 60 customers daily. Alicia can earn up to 250 nuevos soles in a day, but if it is a very good day, she can earn up to 300 nuevos soles. She believes her business is going very well for her because she has a knack for food and because she has a lot of faith in God who will never leave her.

Alicia is very thankful for the Kiva lenders for the help they have given her, as this support will provide more merchandise for her business and allow her to expand her restaurant. With this improvement she will have higher earnings and will be able to save to realize her dream of having a restaurant in a retail zone.

loans.use: buy merchandise (fruit) and expand her business

loans.name: 030813-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to to purchase fish and shrimp to resell. Thủy is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Thủy is the leader of a six-member group, the 030813-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Pictured above is Patrick, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Born in Yeaben, which is in northern Sierra Leone, the 39-year-old is married to a businesswoman. The couple has three children who attend primary schools. Patrick has been a staff member at his company for 10 years now. 

In addition to his work at the company, Patrick is also an agriculturist. He has requested this loan in order to invest in his farm. 

Staff members at various institutions typically come to SMT for loans. With the help of these loans, they are able to meet certain financial criteria that they could not meet with their salaries alone. At the end of each month, a finance officer will deduct their payments in order to repay SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: H. H. lives in the village in Jeliazovo that stands 35 km away from Bourgas. He is married and has a son. His wife and his son also help in the family business. H. is 46 years old. Previously he has been a driver in Bourgas chemical factory but he decides to try some work abroad and for 6 years works as a cook in Germany where he has relatives. After he comes back to Bulgaria ten years ago he founds this farming business in the native village of his wife. Now H. and his family breed 46 cows and calves. Each ear they increase the number of animals they breed. Now they need a specialized milking installation that costs $ 2 000.

loans.use: For a specialized milking installation

loans.name: Simón

texts.en:
Mr. Guzman has tried for several years to expand his business, but he hasn't yet been able to. He is asking for a loan to acheive this expansion. He says, "My wife and I have been able to maintain the business, but we aren't advancing. We are asking for a $1200 loan to build a stand."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

El señor G. lleva varios años tratando de expandir su negocio, hasta la fecha no lo ha logrado, el solicita el apoyo para dar ese salto. "Entre mi esposa y yo hemos podido mantener el negocio pero no estamos avanzando por lo que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para construir un puesto".

loans.use: Increase business size.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna was married in 1992 and she has 3 children. They all are studying. She learned to weave silk from her aunt and then she trained her husband to weave silk after they got married. Vanna has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 5 cycles. The current loan amount is $300. To continue and expand her existing silk production she will use this loan to buy 4 pieces of silk materials; each piece costs $60. In addition, she will use some of this loan to purchase sewing thread. Since she borrowed money from MAXIMA, her family is getting better from day to day. They are sure to have the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Claudia Selene

texts.es:
Claudia is an enterprising young woman with great wishes of self-improvement. She is single and to be able to cover the costs of her studies, she decided to start her own business offering her services as a beauty stylist a year and a half ago. Her taste for this trade has helped her to realize work of very good quality. Now she also applies acrylic nails and eyelash extensions. Little by little she has made herself known and has increased the number of her customers.

Claudia wishes to be able to continue growing her business and requests a credit of $475 that she will use in the purchase of supplies to be able to cover the demand for her services. She commits herself to repay this amount in just three months. Be part of Claudia's successes; she is very grateful for the opportunity that you offer for improvement and belief in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, es soltera y para poder cubrir los costos de sus estudios decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista hace un año y medio, su gusto por este oficio le ha ayudado a realizar trabajos de muy buena calidad, ahora también aplica uñas acrílicas y extensiones de pestañas, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha incrementado su número de clientes.

Claudia desea poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y solicita de un crédito de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para poder cubrir la demanda por sus servicios, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo tres meses. Se parte en los logros de Claudia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorara y hacer creer su negocio.

loans.use:
Purchase of supplies for beauty salon - 

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
My name is Fermina M.. I am dedicated to making and selling "baleadas" (small burritos). I have had my business for three years. My clientel is very good because my product is a very good quality and has a very good taste. My goal is to make more baleadas and gain a better income, which I need to be able to feed my family and pay for the education of my son.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Fermina M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de baleadas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto es de muy buena calidad y un muy buen sabor, mi meta es producir mas baleadas y asi obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesito para poder alimentar mi familia y poder costear la educacion de mi hija.

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, beans, oil, margarine, and butter.

loans.name: Thi Lien

texts.vi:
Ms Liên was born and grew up in a poor village in the district of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school age children. She had occupied different jobs: a laborer for hire, sells metal waste material, sells vegetables that she cultivated. She does not have money to start up any kind of business. She has always wished to have some funding that would enable her to be self employed and generate a revenue. She is very happy to learn that the funding program just became available in her village and she is able to qualify based on her situation. She will buy chicks to raise, she will pay back with the money from the sale of the chickens.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Liên sinh ra và lớn lên tại tại một làng quê nghèo ở huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Chị đã làm rất nhiều nghề để kiếm sống như đi làm thuê, buốn sắt vụn, trồng rau mang ra chợ bán. Vì không có vốn nên chị phải làm ăn nhỏ lẻ. Chị luôn ước mơ có vốn để hỗ trợ cho chị trong các hoạt động tạo thu nhập. Khi được biết có chương trình tài chính vi mô về tận thôn, chị rất vui mừng vì hình thức cho vay rất phù hợp với hoàn cảnh của chị, chị không phải thế chấp cái gì mà vẫn có vốn. Chị mong có vốn để mua gà về nuôi và thu nhập từ việc bán gà sẽ dùng để hoàn vốn.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicken to raise

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
This is Tereza M.. She is 40 years old and married to Zabron, with whom she has one daughter, Lucia, 20. Since 2006, Tereza has run a ‘mgahawa’ (restaurant). The mgahawa is popular with locals and visitors alike and serves local dishes such as rice, beans, plantain (a savoury cooked banana), ugali (maize porridge), meat and vegetables, with a range of sauces. Tereza requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase stock, such as sodas and ingredients, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase soda and ingredients for her restaurant in bulk.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 56 years old, married ,and has three children. He engaged in animal sales. Ibrahim purchases  animals from the  livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) He is one of Normicro's best clients. Now he needs $600 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his small animal husbandry business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is a 22-year-old, single mother of 2.  She has been a trader for 3 years and works extremely hard to support her children.  Esther currently doesn’t have a business stand so she sells her cooking supplies by walking through residential areas and local markets to find customers.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional bowls, cooking utensils and pots. Esther is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional bowls, cooking utensils, and pots.

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es:
Edita G. is a hardworking woman from the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega. For the past 3 years she has been selling a variety of products from a small general store she has set up in her own home.

It is important to note that she is married and the mother of three school-age children. Edita and her husband work very hard to provide for their children. This is the reason why she is seeks help from Ceprodel in the form of a loan that will allow her to improve their financial situation and to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Edita G. es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio desde hace 3 años es la venta de productos variados teniendo su pulpería en su hogar de habitación propio.

Es necesario destacar que es madre casada y con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Junto con su esposo se esfuerza grandemente para suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Es por este m0otivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted products

loans.name: Ziada's Tuzinduke Group

texts.en:
Ziada is 31 years old, married, and has 4 young children. Ziada sells fresh fish, and began her business in 2007. Everyday she works from 7 AM to 4 PM at her business, and earns around $110 a month from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase the number of fishes she can sell at her business. She will also share the money from the loan with her co-group members, Mariam and Ashura, who both run small businesses as well.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina N. sells food items. She is married and has four children. Business is going very well. She wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for additional capital to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en: Lonise G., 65, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the clothing business. She sells to the village community and also town area shops 4 days per week. She has had 7 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $187 USD).  SPBD loans are Lonise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to improve her business and to help out in paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine of overlock brand ,thread , and all materials for sewing

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., 55 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. Her husband passed away for quite a while; therefore, she was on her own to take care of the family. She is a hard-working woman. She raised her 3 children by herself. After joining the TYM Fund, she used the borrowed money in breeding chickens. Since she learns the experience from other people and vaccinate her chickens regularly, they are all free of diseases. Her activity has been going very well and helps improving her fmaily economy. She helps her children in building their own family. This time, she wants to borrow 1125 USD to invest more in breeding chickens. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Hà 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 chồng mất sớm nên mọi công việc gia đình đều đè năng lên đôi vai chị, bản chất là người phụ nữ chịu thương chịu khó, chị đã vượt qua bao khó khăn để nuôi 3 con lớn khôn trưởng thành, các con chị đều rất ngoan nghe lời chị nên chị phần nào cũng đã bớt đi những khó khăn, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi gà thịt, học hỏi kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi của bà con trong vùng nên các lứa gà gia đình chị nuôi ít khi bị mắc bệnh chị, thường có lịch tiêm phòng chống các dịch bệnh theo định kỳ. Vậy việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất phát triẻn, kinh tế khá lên rât nhiều, chị đã xây dựng gia đình cho các con chị. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.500.000đ/tháng.

loans.use: breed chickens

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Luisa is 39 years old, is single, and the mother of two children of 12 and 16 years of age who are both students. Twelve years ago Doña Maria Luisa started her business of selling cosmetics which has allowed her to survive and get her children ahead. Doña Maria Luisa's sales are on credit and the difficulties that she has had over the years have been when a customer does not pay her for the purchased items. The goal of this loan for Doña Maria Luisa is to improve her home. She will buy construction materials to make a porch in her home and this way be able to give her children and her home greater safety.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Luisa tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y madre de dos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Hace 12 años Doña Maria Luisa empezó el negocio de la venta de cosméticos el cual le ha servido para poder subsistir y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Las ventas de Doña Maria Luisa son al crédito, y las dificultades que ha encontrado a través de los años es cuando un cliente no le paga los artículos adquiridos. El motivo del préstamo de Doña Maria Luisa es la mejora de su vivienda, comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un porche en su casa de habitación y así poder dar mayor seguridad a sus hijos y a su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of Materials to Build a Porch

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Su juventud no es impedimento para que quiera ser exitosa, Juana atiende en unas cabinas de Internet, que con ayuda de sus padres, puso alquilando un local en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Atiende su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche, según se quede la clientela.Lo que más le gusta a Juana es poder utilizar el servicio de Internet investigando y navegando en la red, lo difícil es tener que permanecer durante todo el día y a veces hasta altas horas de la noche atendiendo su negocio.
Al terminar la secundaría y no poder continuar estudiando, quiere asegurar su futuro con el negocio.
Con el dinero que le podamos facilitar podrá emplearlo en comprar más accesorios para sus cabinas, como audífonos, cámaras web, entre otros, para mejorar la atención y en el futuro comprar más computadoras, le gustaría tener una sucursal en otra calle de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Juana is 19 years old and lives in her parents' house. Her youth is no obstacle for her desire to succeed. Juana tends to some internet booths which she set up in a commercial space on a high traffic street in the city of Juliaca with the help of her parents. She tends to the business from 8 in the morning until 10 or 11 at night, depending on her customers. What she likes the best is being able to use the internet service, researching and browsing the web; the hard part is being there all day and sometimes even until late at night, tending to her business.

Having finished highschool, and without the ability to keep studying, she wants to secure her future with the business.

She will use he money we can offer her to buy more accessories for her booths, such as earphones, web cameras, among other things, in order to improve the service and in the future buy more computers. She would like to have another location on a different street in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying different computer accessories for her public internet booths. (Compra de diferentes accesorios de computadora para sus cabinas públicas de Internet.)

loans.name: Fouai

texts.en:
Fouai T., 38, is married with one child. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells taro, taamu, and bananas to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

Fouai has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy equipment such as knives, chemicals, and pesticides. Her husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, knives, chemicals, and pesticides

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 42 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her parents. She owns an internet café and also sells candies in her café. Sanna wants to expand her business and also develop her business by purchasing accessories like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. She has asked for a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua. This is her fifth cycle and she always pays on schedule

loans.use: To expand her business by also selling accessories

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana V. conocida comúnmente por Juanita se dedica a atender su negocio siendo una pequeña tienda de ropa el cual atiende con mucho entusiasmo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Ella es una dama soltera que tiene la obligación de mantener su núcleo familiar y por este motivo es que se esfuerza grandemente para mejorar su nivel de vida brindando mejores condiciones para su negocio. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado para suplir sus estantes de mercadería ofreciéndosela a sus clientes en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Ms Juana V., better known as Juanita, dedicates herself to her business, a small clothing store which she manages with great enthusiasm in the central market of the town of Chinandega. She is a single woman whose duty it is to care for her household and for this reason she is making great efforts to improve her standard of living by providing better conditions for her store. Today, she hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can stock her shelves with merchandise to offer her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia D. is a palm oil producer at Ntsiman near Elmina. Emelia has received her senior high school education.  She is single and has no children. Emelia has been selling palm oil which she produces since 2005. She is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand the business and increase her income..

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 14 años. Hace 9 años empezó a vender comida de manera ambulante, animada por su hermana, quien la apoyó en mérito a la buena sazón que tiene, es así que ella continuó realizando este trabajo, al cual está dedicada diariamente. Vende su comida en las mañanas y en las tardes, ofreciendo los más variados platos de desayuno y de almuerzo en su establecimiento que se ubica en un mercado cercano a su casa. Sus comensales quedan muy satisfechos, de esta manera garantiza el retorno de sus clientes y por ende, que continúe su negocio, del cual depende económicamente su familia. Para Lidia es una gran satisfacción cocinar cada día y seguir adelante por el bienestar de su familia. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y todo este tiempo de trabajo ha demostrado ser una de las mejores socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita, con una parte, comprará abarrotes, tales como; sacos de arroz, de azúcar y demás productos de primera necesidad no perecibles; y con la otra parte comprará mesas y sillas nuevas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Lidia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old daughter. Nine years ago she began selling food as a street vendor, encouraged by her sister who helped her. She continues working at this job daily. She sells food in the mornings and afternoons, offering a variety of breakfast and lunch dishes at her stall located in the market near her home. Her customers are always satisfied and this is how she guarantees return customers and in turn, the continuation of her business, which her family depends on. Lidia takes great satisfaction in cooking each day and working for the well-being of her family. This is her third loan with MFP and she has demonstrated that she is one of the best members of her community bank. With part of the loan money she will buy groceries such as: sacks of rice and sugar and other necessary products. With the other part of the loan she will buy new tables and chairs for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare her food

loans.name: Maria O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Maria M. from Mbeya is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child, age of 4.  Maria has been running a crops selling business since 2006. Maria’s business is to purchase crops in whole sale bases from farmers and sell them in town in retail bases.

Maria works at her business between 9 to 12 hours per day, 3 days per week. Maria currently earns about $210 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $600 in order to purchase crops and eggs to resell. In the future, she plans to start new business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops and eggs for reselling

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Абдуназарова Шаходат жительница города ДУшанбе. Возраст 22 года . Имеет высшее образование. Но занимается шитьем. Работает портнихой уже пять лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы купить Вышивальную машинку. Это даст возможность ей увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг. То есть она сможет вышивать платья , что привлечет новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahodat A., 22, lives in Dushanbe. She has a college education, but works as a tailor. She has been tailoring for five years. Shahodat applied for this loan to purchase an embroidery machine. With the new machine, Shahodat will be able to offer additional services and attract new customers. Shahodat will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр после окончания школы поехал в Россию на заработки. Проработав там несколько лет, он решил вернуться и стал заниматься бизнесом на местных рынках. Абубакру 29 лет, он женат, его жена нигде не работает и воспитывает 2 детей дома. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает давно, и приобрел репутацию отличного клиента. Абубакру необходимо получать займы, так как он отлично справляется с полученными займами и извлекает максимальную прибыль, которая расходуется им как для увеличения бизнеса, так и для покрытия расходов семьи. Абубакр и дальше собирается сотрудничать с МикроИнвест.
texts.en:
After finishing school, Abubakr went to Russia to make a living. Having worked there for several years, he decided to return home and became involved in his own business at local markets. Abubakr is 29 years old, married; his wife does not work and raises their 2 children at home. He has been partnering with MicroInvest for a long time and achieved a reputation of an excellent client. It is necessary for Abubakr to obtain loans because he has been repaying all of his loans and managing to receive maximum profits that he uses to expand his business and to support his family. Abubakr plans to continue his partnership with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: Léocadie D. est une femme de 55ans, mariée avec des enfants en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité d’élevage porcine. Ceci pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léocadie D. is a 55-year-old married woman who has children to support. She would like to bolster her business raising pigs. This is to improve her children's lives in terms of health and schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
Pilar es conviviente tiene 44 años, tres hijos el mayor  de 17 años esta preparándose para ingresar a la universidad y el de 15 y  13 años están estudiando  en la escuela estatal. 
El papa de Pilar trabajo haciendo instalaciones eléctricas, hasta que se jubilo, le dejo el negocio a ella y a su hermano, también  una cartera de clientes, empezó a trabajar con su hermano, pero hace ocho años ella se independizo, aprendió mas del negocio, ha contratado personal que trabaja para ella, se dedica a dar servicio de  cableados a casas y  edificios.  
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cables eléctricos, interruptores y luminarias. 
Desde que esta en Finca, gracias a los prestamos puede cumplir con los contratos que hace con sus clientes.
El sueño de Pilar es crear una empresa que de servicios  eléctricos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the community bank Grandioso Milagro. Pilar lives with her partner and is 44 years old. She has three children, the oldest is 17 years old is preparing to start college, the 15 and 13 year olds are studying in public school. Pilar's father worked doing electrical work until he retired. He left the business to her and her brother and also left them the client portfolio. She began working with her brother but eight years ago she became independent and learned more about the business. She hired employees that work for her and she is dedicated to providing cable services to homes and businesses. Pillar needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy electrical cables, switches and lights. Since she has been in FINCA, thanks to the loans, she can fulfill contracts she makes with her clients. Pilar's dream is to establish an electrical services company.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical cables, switches and lights.

loans.name: Muti

texts.en:
Muti is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and drinks.

She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. Muti lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.en: U. Umarjon is 41 years old, married, with three children. He has had a butcher shop, running a meat selling business for nine years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with necessary food. Now Umarjon is requesting a loan of $2,200. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. He is counting on your help. Your support will really help him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing cattle for his butcher shop

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Ma N., 42, is married with four children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $10 every day selling porridge and cooked rice. She is also supported by her husband who is a mechanic. Ma N. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase mechanic’s tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools for her husband

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is thirty-three years old. She is married and has three daughters, who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Francisca trades in soft drinks and pastries. She buys the drinks from big towns and sells them in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy drinks and pastries in bulk, in order to expand her business. She desires to give her children a quality education and support would be much appreciated.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Beasito

texts.en:
Beasita S. is mother to twelve: four daughters and eight sons. Six of her children are of legal age and the others are still dependent on her. She is married to Jesus, a 52 year old carpenter. Considering the number of her children, Beasita found it hard to sustain the needs of her family her as her husband’s income is unstable. She strives hard to look for income and so, she was driven to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006.

Beasita’s previous loans were used in retailing charcoal and retailing of ready-to-wear clothes. But she has opted to put a big slice of her loan now to the resale of ready-to-wear clothes. This, she believes, could bring her enough income for her family.

Now, on her 4th loan, she proposes to borrow 20,000 pesos to pay for assorted products such as, pants, t-shirts, shorts and many other products for her retail business. She is positive that her business will be popular as, aside from waiting for customers to arrive, she also roams around the village to sell the products.

Beasita’s dream is really to send her children to school so as they will not suffer the same life that she is experiencing. She also dreams to have her own space for the display of her products.

loans.use: To pay for inventory for retail business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy M. Z. tiene 20 años y concubina con el señor Maximo Hidalgo Sanchez por 5 años. Tienen 1 hijo de 6 años que asiste a una escuela de la zona.  La señora Nancy vive en el pueblo de Tiraque en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 maquinas para la confección de ropa, con las cuales confecciona ropa femenina Polleras (La polllera es una vestimenta femenina tradicional de Bolivia). La señora Nancy después de fallecer sus padres y quedar huérfana a la edad de 12 años comenzó como ayudante de una costurera de Polleras y luego de poder ahorrar lo suficiente se compro las maquinas para poder confeccionar polleras ella sola. 

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de material para la confección de prendas de vestir(Tela y Rollos) por que la demanda de su producto subió considerablemente en el último año por ser de muy buena calidad. Su deseo es poder seguir incrementando el número de polleras vendidas para poder ahorra y en un futuro comprar un terreno y construir una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy M. Z. is 20 years old and lives with Mr. Maximo Hidalgo Sanchez. They have lived together for 5 years and have a six year-old son who attends a local school. Mrs. Nancy lives in the town of Tiraque in Cochabamba. She has three sewing machines, which she uses to make “Polleras”, the traditional skirt in Bolivia. After her parents died and she became an orphan at age 12, Mrs. Nancy started to work as an assistant seamstress of Polleras. She was able to save enough money to buy her own sewing machines to make the Polleras by herself.

This loan will be used to purchase sewing material (fabric and spools) to be able to meet the increasing demand for her high quality products. Her wish is to continue to increase the number of Polleras sold, and save enough money to buy land and build a house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing material to make traditional skirts (Polleras )

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'articles électroménagers

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 32 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su pequeño niño Ricardo de 10 años, a quien quiere mucho y desea darle una buena educación. Su carretilla de golosinas se encuentra ubicada en uno de los parques más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Su día normalmente comienza a las 8 de la mañana y termina pasadas las 6 de la tarde, durante este tiempo ella aprovecha algunos minutos de poca venta para ir a ver a su hijo, quien estudia a unas pocas cuadras de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, a la vez que cuida su carretilla de golosinas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todo el día. Para el futuro espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecerles mayor variedad de productos.
Este es el primer préstamo de Paula con MFP, por lo que se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Paula, 32 years old, is a hard working mother who lives in a rented room with her young boy Ricardo, 10 years old, who she loves deeply and wants to give a good education. Her cart of sweets can be found located in one of the busiest parks in the city of Juliaca. Her day usually starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends after 6:00 in the afternoon. During this time she uses a few minutes when sales are slow to go see her son who studies a few blocks from her business. What she likes most about her work is the freedom that she has to do other activities while she is managing her sweets cart. She has eight years in this activity and thinks that the most difficult part of her work is having to remain under the harsh sun all day. For the future she hopes to be able to have a store where she can serve her clients better and offer them a greater variety of products. This is Paula's first loan with MFP, so she feels the responsibility of making her payments on time, since she wants to have access to credit in the future. In her community bank she is one of the most active members. With the 800 new soles she has requested, she will buy more sweets to improve her cart's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Pashton Group

texts.en:
Pashton is the group leader of the Pashton group, which has three members. All of them would like to receive money for his/her business.
Pashton and Fawzeya want a loan for the business and Roshan would like a loan for her general store. They all want to see progress in their business and earn more money to better support their families. 
They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business.

loans.use: expand their business

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam A. sells cloth and footwear in Kwamikrom. Enyonam has received junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman.

Enyonam has been selling cloth and footwear for the past 5 years. She is responsible for paying the children’s school fees, and helping her husband in paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of the cloth and footwear for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: to buy more of the cloth and footwear for resale

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana G. is single and has one child. She has received junior high education.

Diana sells smoked fish at Elmina near Bantama, which she has been doing since 2002. She uses her income to pay school fees, utility bills and apartment bills.

Diana will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de cinco hijos mayores de edad, su esposo no trabaja porque esta delicado de salud. Doris se dedica a la venta de comida regional, ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en productos para preparar comida y luego vender.
Ahora necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos e insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos. La meta de Doris es tener un local para la venta de comidas regional.
texts.en:
Doris is a very dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 53 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband can’t work due to health issues. Doris prepares and sells regional food. She has been a member of the communal bank “María Montessori” for two years. Her first loan was of 300 soles, which she invested in food preparation products. This time, Doris needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will also be used to buy ingredients for food preparation. Doris’ goal is to have her own restaurant where she can sell regional food.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Omolade

texts.en: Omolade is excited to take a Kiva loan with LAPO. She will use this loan to invest in a business selling natural honey which she will buy in bulk to get a better price. She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. She helps her husband to support the family. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN150,000 to purchase more natural honey to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more honey to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza N. is from the village of Bucana in Sicayab. She is 62 years old. Lorenza is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lorenza sells "bibingka," a sweet pudding made from rice and fresh coconut milk, in the local community.  Lorenza has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lorenza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Lorenza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make her treats. This loan will be Lorenza's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jacinto Cell A Candiru Farida Group

texts.en:
C. Farida is thirty-two years old and is the cashier of this group. She is married with seven children of whom six are going to school. She is also taking care of one dependent who is going to school too.

Farida operates a business selling breakfast coffee, black tea, milk tea, bread, boiled cassava and a mixture of maize and beans as accompaniments. She is using the loan to purchase cups, flasks and sugar bowls as well as tea ingredients, boiled maize, bread, boiled cassava, and so forth.

Farida is an active businesswoman who is struggling to move on with life, as in “live a changed life”. Her future hope is to work very hard to get profits to enable her to obtain a plot of land and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Nuestro socio AUGUSTO, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, El socio vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 11, 9 años, Nuestro socio es ganadero, él compra y vende todo tipo de animal vacuno, el socio estuvo ahorrando un dinero para comprar un ganado esta vez y así aumentar su ganado, él verá recién si se anima por una vaca o un torete, por lo pronto el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar unas llantas para su  camión, el también alquila su camioncito para trasladar ganados.

El  socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Augusto is a member of the Communal Bank “Pro Desarrollo” (Pro Development). He lives in Pisac, which lies in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Pisac is located 40 minutes away from the city. It is small town that inherited beautiful Incan structures, which is required sightseeing by all tourists who visit the city of Cusco.

Augusto is 41 years old, married, and has three children (ages 17, 11, and 9). He is a rancher who buys and sells all types of cattle. Augusto began saving money so that he could buy one head of cattle at a time to increase his herd. He has yet to determine whether he will buy a cow or a bull with the funds he will be receiving. Augusto has an immediate need to purchase tires for his truck because he is currently renting a small vehicle to transport his cattle.

He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his truck & invest in his cattle business

loans.name: 09.2.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Ly H. T. (17) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh hoa. Ly is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09.2.2 Nam Ngan (02.09.2.2).


Ly is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Ly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Ly has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
