1.  N. T. Hang (19) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


2.  N. T. H. Phuong (20) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  D. T. V. Ha (21) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  N. T. Du (22) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling religious items.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ly H. T. (17) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoa.  Ly là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.2.2 Nam Ngan (02.09.2.2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ly thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ly kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Ly đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ly đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hang (19) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  N. T. H. Phuong (20) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  D. T. V. Ha (21) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  N. T. Du (22) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán các vật dụng tôn giáo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica Maria tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que tiene sus 2 hijos menores de edad de 6 y 10 años respectivamente. Ella comenzó una pequeña cantidad de maíz, por lo que es en su casa en donde realiza todas sus labores como la elaboración de tortillas, cuidar a sus hijos y ayudarle en sus tareas escolares. Es una mujer muy abnegada y responsable ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima maíz, bolsas plásticas, cal y leña. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Angélica María works selling tortillas. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, as she has two young children who are 6 and 10, respectively. She began with little, which is why she completes her work such as making tortillas at home, caring for her children and helping them with their schoolwork. She is a very selfless and responsible work and she is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw material such as corn, plastic bags, lime, and firewood. Her wish is for her children to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar Antonio de 33 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 niños estudiando educaciòn primaria, trabaja para el MINED Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años  en la colonia Caracito,  esta solicitando su 5to credito para mejorar su vivienda, pues desea construir una habitaciòn para asì brindarle mayor comodidad y privacidad a su familia y contar con mejores condiciones en el hogar. Actualmente està estudiando una Licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn en la Universidad URACCAN para mejorar sus conocimientos e impartirlos a sus alumnos,  es un docente con muchos deseos de superaciòn profesional y laboral, se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesto y de buenas costumbres.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio, 33, is married and has three children, who are in elementary school. He has worked for MINED (Ministry of Education) in Nueva Guinea for 10 years in the Caracito neighborhood. He is asking for his 5th loan to make home improvements because he'd like to build a bedroom so that his family can have greater comfort and privacy as well as better living conditions in the home. He is currently completing his bachelor's degree in education at URACCAN (Universidad de las Regiones Autónomas de la Costa Caribe Nicaragüense) so that he can improve his command of the subject matter and be a better teacher. He is a teacher who wants to improve both professionally and personally. He is responsible, honest and of good habits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Mariama Cire

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  Cire D. est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 16 ans. Elle est âgée de 27 ans et habite dans la localité  de Baye Laye. Elle évolue  dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques  depuis 4 ans. Auparavant elle a beaucoup voyage vers le Mali, la Mauritanie et aussi vers la Gambie pour acheter des tissus et autres articles destines a la vente. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité  de sa grand-mère  et de sa mère qui vivait à Dakar et y pratiquait l’activité  de commerce. Mais plutôt c’est sa grand-mère  qui  lui confiait ses marchandises pour qu’elle  les vende lorsqu’elle vivait  avec elle  a Tambacounda jusqu'à ce qu’elle  eut  l’amour du commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer sa boutique en produits cosmétiques  car c’est la période de froid qui est plus favorable a son commerce. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Mariama Cire D. is married and mother to three children between the ages of 3 and 16. She is 27 years old and lives in Baye Laye. For four years, she has grown in the cosmetics business. She has traveled a lot in Mali, Mauritania and also around the Gambia to purchase fabrics and other goods for sale. It is an activity that she inherited from her grandmother and mother who lived in Dakar and who practiced the business. More so, it was her grandmother that entrusted her with merchandise to sell around Tambacounda where Mariama lived, until she found love for the business. She requests a loan of 200,000 FRS to build up her cosmetic products, but its the cold period that is best for business. The increase of her profits will allow her satisfy her daily needs.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen funds for cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bottle water to sell.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Juana del Socorro C. T. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 25 años tiene un tramo verduras y una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el reparto la florida.
La Señora C. trabaja de lunes a domingo  para mantener a sus cuatro hijos que dependen de ella y estan estudiando a parte de sus hijos la mamá de la Señora C. depende de ella  sus financiamiento lo solicito para hacerle una mejora a su venta que tiene en su casa ya que el negocio del mercado lo esta administrando un sobrino.
Su negocio lo empezo  con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 que fueron ahorros, tiene de trabajar año y medio con ceprodel y sus financiamientos le han ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
La Señora Juana del Socorro C. T. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 25 años tiene un tramo verduras y una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el reparto la florida. La Señora C. trabaja de lunes a domingo para mantener a sus cuatro hijos que dependen de ella y estan estudiando a parte de sus hijos la mamá de la Señora C. depende de ella sus financiamiento lo solicito para hacerle una mejora a su venta que tiene en su casa ya que el negocio del mercado lo esta administrando un sobrino. Su negocio lo empezo con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 que fueron ahorros, tiene de trabajar año y medio con ceprodel y sus financiamientos le han ayudado a salir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar productos para mi venta

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam K. is 45 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Krang Thnong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Rin Pov, is an ice cream seller who can earn a small income to support his family's living. In order to support his ice cream business, Mrs. Nam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle to support her husband's transportation needs to sell ice cream. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the last one is a construction worker. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Robert Leonard

texts.en:
Robert Leonard G. is from the village named Barangay Roxas, in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 27 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a  specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately $390 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Robert Leonard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings, and tries to help his father with the family expenses.

In 2003 he started working with a friend painting houses. Four years later after making his own connections he started working on his own.

He is now requesting a $500 loan to purchase a new machine for painting houses, which will help him become more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase a painting machine for his housepainting business.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn C. is from the city of Barangay 5 Tangub City. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jerlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Roeurn Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who are villagers in Sdok Prei village in Takeo province. Mrs. Roeurn T. is a village bank president who was born in 1968, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to not sell to support her family moreover she is a potato, sugar palm, and palm fruit seller while her husband, Mr. Hak KoA., is a palm juice collector. Since her business has been going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Roeurn T. is applying for a loan to buy more potato and sugar palm to resale. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are coconut sellers, while the others are attending in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more potato and sugar palm to resale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: La señora Josefina es viuda y tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Abarrotes Martínez” tiene ocho años con la tienda, que se a permanecido con mucho esfuerzo ya que  La señora Josefina se quedo viuda desde hace varios años y vive sola. Ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio y tener mas ventas, requiere de este crédito para comprar mas mercancía como, abarrotes y comida enlatada  para el negocio, refrescos y dulces. La señora Josefina quiere formarse un patrimonio para su vejez.
texts.en:
Josefina is a widow and has a grocery store called “Abarrotes Martínez” ["Martínez Groceries"]. She has operated this store for eight years, and she has kept it going through hard work. Josefina has been a widow for several years, and she lives alone. She would like to expand her business and increase her sales. She needs this loan to buy more merchandise such as canned foods, soft drinks, candy and other grocery items for her store. Josefina would like to save up a fund for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marino  es casado con la señora  Olinda hace varios años, una  hija menor  que aún está cursando la escuela primaria.
Marino es taxista; tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo.
Además de su trabajo, Olinda trabaja como vendedora  de ropas que trae de la Argentina y el Brasil  para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en casa propia.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a su hija, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.

Hemos confiado en don Marino en otros créditos anteriores  y ha cumplido con total cabalidad con sus compromisos.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto y solicita el préstamo para la reparación de su taxi.
texts.en:
Sr. Marino and his wife, Sra. Olinda, have been married for several years. They have a young daughter who is in elementary school. Marino drives a cab and, after much hard work, he managed to buy a vehicle that he now owns. Olinda also has a business, selling clothing that she brings from Argentina and Brazil. The revenues from her business help meet the family's expenses. The couple own their house and, thanks to their hard work, they can give their daughter an education and buy the everyday things they need to live. Marino has demonstrated that he is responsible and honest about his commitments. We have trusted Marino with other loans in the past and he has met all the commitments he has made to us. Olinda, too, is a responsible person with a strong drive to get ahead in the world. Marino has an open and entrepreneurial spirit that leaves us in no doubt that he will meet the goals that he's set. Marino will use the loan to repair his cab.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs for taxi business.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. H. P., 31, is a mother of one child. She runs a fashion shop. It is always crowded with customers so she earns 150,000 VND profit per day. Receiving loans since 2008, she has invested in her business successfully. Currently, she needs to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy more dresses with new designs to meet the demand of customers.

Oanh T. N., 26, has two small children. She works in an electronic goods factory and wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to improve her toilet system.

loans.use: To buy more dresses to meet customer demand

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan S., 55, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

S. sells groceries and snacks, earning an income of $2.30 per day. Two of her children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $80 each per month to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia C. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 58 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Sonia has grown rice to sell for the past eight years. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Sonia from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth A. es originaria de la ciudad de León, actualmente se desempeña como odontóloga en el centro de salud del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene siete años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita para la compra de ladrillos y cemento con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda
texts.en: Ms. Elizabeth A. is originally from the city of León. Currently she works as a dentist at the health center in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Penon, where she has worked for 7 years. This is the first loan she has requested and will be used to buy bricks and cement with the aim of improving her house.

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es:
Tiburcina pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, su último hijo tiene 7 años. Tiburcina se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne, pollo y tripitas lo hace en forma ambulatoria en el Puente del Ejercito, con su negocio se ayuda en la manutención de su familia pues su esposo no tiene trabajo permanente, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de costales de papa, aceite, vinagre y demás condimentos para la preparación de los anticuchos.
Le gusta Finca porque puede acceder al crédito, pues en otras instituciones no le darían, porque es ambulante, en las capacitaciones aprendió ahorrar, trabajar y quererse.
Su sueño es poder alquilar un local para poder vender sus anticuchos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Tiburcina belongs to the Agua Viva community bank. She is 52 years old, is married, and has 7 children. Her youngest son is 7 years old. Tiburcina sells anticuchos (grilled meat on a stick) of beef, chicken, and tripe. She does this as a walking vendor on the Puente del Ejercito (Army Bridge). Her business helps support her family, since her husband doesn't have permanent work. The loan that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of sacks of potatoes, oil, vinegar, and other ingredients for the preparation of the anticicuchos.

She likes Finca because she can have access to credit, since in other institutions they would not give it to her because she is a walking vendor. In the training she has learned to save, to work, and to respect herself.

He dreams are to be able to rent a location where she could sell her anticuchos and for her children to have careers.

loans.use: Buy sacks of potatoes, oil, and vinegar.

loans.name: Martha Elma

texts.es: La señora Martha Elma G. Martínez y su esposo han trabajado mucho para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Hace ya doce años adquirieron su vivienda de interés social, por lo que son pequeñas y angostas, por tal motivo esta familia pensó en construir un cuarto mas para ampliarla y así tener mas espacio. Para terminar su cuarto ellos necesitan poner la losa.
texts.en: Mrs. Martha Elma G. Martínez and her husband have worked hard to offer their children a better quality of life. Twelve years ago, they acquired middle-income social housing, which was small and cramped. This motivated them to construct a larger room so that they would have more space. To complete the room, they need to pour the slab.

loans.use: To pour slab

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. cerveza, ella tiene una tienda donD. venD. cerveza, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas D. cerveza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Josefina, 61, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with being a beer merchant.  She has a store where she sells beer.  She is open from 8am until 10pm and wants to expand the beer sales.  She is asking for a loan to buy more cases of beer.

She thanks all those who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Jefferson Alexi

texts.es:
Jefferson Alexi tiene 21 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jefferson Alexi se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y una casa.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Jefferson Alexi is 21. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 2 children. The V.R.C. Jerusalen group is located in the Caimito area, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Parish in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend much time doing this activity. Jefferson Alexi works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. He purchases his products in the Garcia and Lopez Markets and sells in the Vaca Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, rice and gandul beans. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a plot of land and a house. he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las palmas que se integra de cinco señoras quien cada una cuenta con su actividad, la razón del nombre de su grapo es porque son puras señoras.

      La señora María del Carmen Hernández Hernández, vive en localidad de Benito Juárez, municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Rosemberg  Hernández Jiménez, en donde procrearon tres hijos quienes a un están a su responsabilidad y son: María Elizabeth de veintidós años, Olga Leticia de de quince años de edad,  en tercero de secundaria y el ultimo es Carlos Antonio de de once años de edad.

    El préstamo que a estado solicitado lo  invierte en la compra y venta  de productos agrícolas como el guineo que se vende  muy bien las comunidades cercanas, en esta actividad lleva  cuatro años  y le a dado buenos resultados.
 
     Inicio  por si sola ya que  en su ribera se da ese producto y el cual la gente lo compra mucho, y pues ella tiene su propia cosecha, así es aprovechar  el producto.

      De las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte para comprar más guineo y así  tener regular, como mejor sea su resultado y con ello ser de manera puntual  en sus pagos del préstamo solicitado.
Su deseo es que con esta actividad logre a horrar, para que con esto trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logren apoyar a sus dos hijos que están estudiando y así logren terminar una carrera.

     Las persona que integran el grupo son  las siguientes:.

      María Del Carmen Sánchez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  de productos agrícolas cono es el guineo.
     Rosa Vázquez Castellanos: invierte el préstamo en la compra de de ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces típicos de la región, como también se dedica a la engorda de marranos.

    María Guadalupe M. Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de guineo, como también surte su refresquería.

    María Rosalba Juárez M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos de rancho para venderlo en el mismo municipio.

    María Del Socorro Jiménez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  y venta de marranos.
texts.en:
The name of the group is "Las Palmas" and it is made up of 5 women, each owning their own business. The name "Las Palmas" was chosen because the group is exclusively made up of women. 

Maria del Carmen H. H. lives in the region of Benito J. of the Copainala municipality, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married with Mr. Rosemberg H. J., and they had three children together, all of whom are still in their care. They are: Maria Elizabeth, 22 years old, Olga Leticia, 15 years old and in grade 9, and the youngest is Carlos Antonio, 11 years old. 

The loan requested will be invested in the business of buying and selling agricultural products such as bananas, product that sells very well in the nearby communities. this business is four years old and it has been very successful. 

She started the business on her own, seeing that this product grows very well in her region and it is in high demand.  she has her own plantation and so she is able to benefit from her harvests.

The profits she earns are invested in the purchase of more bananas to maintain a steady income. She will therefore be able to make the payments for the loan she requests. 

Her wish is to be able to save money through her business so that she will be able to support her two children while they are in school, and to see them accomplish training for a career.

The individuals who make up the group are the following: 

Maria Del Carmen S. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of agricultural products such as bananas. 

Rosa V. Castellanos: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make sweets that are traditional to the region. She also raises pigs.

Maria Guadalupe M. H.: she will invest her loan in the purchase and resale of bananas, and to supply her canteen. 

Maria Rosalba J. M.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens which will be resold in the same municipality. 

Maria Del Socorro J. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs for later resale.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria de 22 años, empezó a vender productos de uso personal de marca Yanbal con el código de una amiga. Después de algún tiempo decidió ser independiente y comenzar con sus propias ventas y código de vendedora por catalogo. 

Poco a poco se ha convertido en vendedora de productos Yanbal. No tiene horario fijo en su trabajo porque tiene que promocionar en distintos lugares y personas. Vende cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. Tiene muchas aspiración en seguir vendiendo los productos ya que ella comprar en una cantidad proporcionada. Por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere incrementar la mercadería que vende y asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old. She began selling Yanbal brand personal products on a friend's account. After some time, she decided to be independent and start her own catalog sales account.

Little by little she has become a Yanbal saleswoman. She does not have a fixed work schedule because she has to promote products in various places to various people. She sells cosmetics, perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. She aspires to continue selling these products and has to buy a proportionate amount. With the loan, she would like to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants. In the future, she wants to increase the amount of merchandise she sells and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 23 years old and sells clothes at local fairs/markets. She always travels to Lima to buy her merchandise which she sells in Ayacucho. Nelida will use her next loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy more clothes in order to increase her capital. Nelida has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. With her previous loan she was able to buy the material needed to set up her fair stand and to increase her business. 

Being a member of FINCA also provides her with the opportunity to study education at the local university. She enjoys the opportunity of saving and the training sessions provided have inspired her. She has learned to value herself more and to be responsible. Her goal is to open up her own clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina, de 60 años, es una mujer generosa y buena. Es separada, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores, de los 6 que tiene en total. Esta emprendedora madre de familia, toda su vida ha trabajado arduamente en diversos negocios, pero hace 10 años se estableció en un lugar muy concurrido. En donde a partir de las 4 de la tarde vende café y panqueques calientes hasta 11 de la noche. En este negocio le va muy bien, pero llegada las 5 de la tarde sola no se abastece, por ello últimamente trabaja con la ayuda de su sobrina y otras veces de su hija. Trabajando de esta manera ha logrado educar a sus hijos y construir una parte de su casa, por lo que se siente realizada. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho; por lo que es independiente y muy rentable. Por ello, se aferra a su trabajo y de ese modo logre construir un cuarto más en su casa y lo alquile, para captar  otros ingresos a su economía. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a sus dos compañeras de crédito con quienes trabaja todo este tiempo, ya que este aporte le permite continuar trabajando en busca de su progreso. Agripina, cada fin de semana invierte en mercadería como harina, aceite, azúcar y balones de gas para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará estas mercaderías para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Agripina, age 60, is a generous and good-natured woman. She is separated from her spouse and lives in her own home with two adult children. Agripina has six children in total. This enterprising mother has worked hard all of her life in various businesses, but for the past ten years, she has established herself in a very busy place. Starting at 4pm, she sells coffee and warm pancakes until 11pm. Her business is doing very well, but when 5pm arrives, there are times when she runs out of supplies. Lately she has been working with her niece as her assistant and sometimes with her daughter. By working in this manner, Agripina has been able to provide her children with an education and build part of her home, which makes her feel like she has accomplished something. She enjoys her business because it is profitable and allows her to be independent. For this reason, Agripina continues to work so that she can add another room to her house which she will make available for rent. This will help generate additional income.

She is receiving her eleventh loan from MFP. Agripina promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint two of her fellow group members with whom she works with all the time. These funds will allow her to continue working and making progress. Each week, Agripina invests in merchandise such as flour, oil, sugar, and tanks of gas for her business. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy these products so that she can continue working.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, sugar, and tanks of gas

loans.name: Nacaria

texts.en:
Nacaria O. is from the village of Damayuhan, Gingoog City. She is 62 years old and married with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nacaria  buys and sells vegetables like kamote tops (kamote is a type of sweet potato) and leafy vegetables. She also sells fruit like sweet bananas. Nacaria has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nacaria joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nacaria is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables and fruit to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nacaria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her children. She is a widow and does her best to support her six children.

Catalina is a farmer and has been growing rice for 20 years. She usually earns about 3000 PHP from this farming. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Catalina works hard for her children.

Catalina's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn A. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Annalyn is married and has one infant child. Annalyn owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing videoke or karaoke services to local community members. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Annalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Reyna Florentina

texts.es:
Reyna  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Wiñay”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y  departamento de Puno, tiene 56  años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 2 hijos independientes.  Tiene grado de instrucción  educación primaria. 
Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y carne de cordero.  Trabaja   con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace más de seis años, el préstamo  inicial fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará golosinas,  gaseosas y galletas, estos productos los compra en Desaguadero para luego venderlos en la ciudad, en el negocio le ayuda su hijo y su esposo quien trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 56, is married and has two grown children. She is a member of the communal bank “Wiñay" in the Puno district of the Puno province in the department of Puno. Reyna has primary school education. 

Reyna makes her living selling sweets and lamb meat. She has been working with the Manuela  Ramos organization for over six years; the initial loan was for 300 soles which she invested in her business. 

Reyna will use the new loan of 2000 soles to purchase sweets, soft drinks, and cookies. She buys her inventory in the town of Desaguadero and later resells it. Her son and her husband, who works in construction, also help her with the business. Reyna's dream is to have a well-appointed grocery store; what she likes best about her communal bank is the team spirit and the sense of responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana pequeña comerciante de alquiler de sillas y mesas con más de veinte años prestando el servicio a la comunidad. Madre de cinco hijos que junto a su esposo han logrado  buena educación para sus hijos. Cuatro de ellos casados y solo el menor están estudiando.
Con el apoyo de Afodenic ha mejorado parte de su casa, como la inversión de su negocio. Teniendo cinco ciclos en la institución el cual ha pagado en plazos que le ha facilitado un mejor equilibrio en su economía.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara láminas de zinc, clavos, cuartones para poder reparar el techo.
texts.en:
Juana is a small business owner who rents chairs and tables. She has been providing this service to the community for more than 20 years. She is a mother of 5 children and together with her husband they have given their kids a good education. Four of them are married and only the youngest is still in school. 

With the support of Afodenic she has improved part of her house and invested in her business. She has been through 5 loan cycles with the bank and paying them back over time has helped her to keep her budget more balanced. 

With this new loan she will buy sheets of tin roofing, nails and beams to be able to repair the roof.

loans.use: to buy tin roofing, nails, and beams to repair the roof.

loans.name: Munansi Development Group B

texts.en:
Teddy, 24, is a hard-working mother of one. She has been involved in her general merchandise retail business venture for the past seven years in Mubende. 

After the completion of her university studies, Teddy decided she had to do something that could bring value to her life. It's with that resolve that she set the ball rolling in her business under the financial auspices of a close friend.
 
She says her weekly sales profits are now to the tune of UGX 120,000. 

With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
Cesar Adolfo tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cesar Adolfo is 22 years old; he is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the Canton Ventanas Province of Los Rios.

This group is called Narcisa de Jesus; it is located in the San Temistocles Building in the Canton Ventanas zone. This group pertains to agricultural work for the short planting season for corn and rice.

Cesar works in agriculture, especially in planting corn. It is a family tradition to work in this business. He purchases the seeds locally each month and sells [the produce] in the local market.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help him financially to provide for his needs in the face of challenges such as plagues, crop diseases, and climate changes. He dream is to purchase a house.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: El Sol X Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "EL SOL X", nombre que adoptaron porque “El Sol”, tiene un significado importante pues emite luz y energia además el nombre las motiva a seguir iluminando y dando prosperidad y constancia a sus vidas. El grupo se localiza en estado de Puebla, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 09 integrantes. La señora PATRICIA, es la Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 46 años de edad y estudio unicamente la preparatoria. Vende Cajas de madera en las cuales guardan y transportan frutas y verduras, ella es casada y tiene una hija  de 15 años. La señora es reconocida por sus compañeras por ser una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha ido progresando desde hace 18 años, el prestamo lo requiere para invertir mas en su negocio y comprar por mayoreo cajas para fruta que les vende a los comerciantes de frutas y verduras que le hacen compras de grandes cantidades para toda su mercancia. Con las ganancias quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar para la educación de sus hija pues su gran sueño es verla como profesionista, tambien desea apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: The name of this group is "El Sol X", a name that they adopted because "El Sol" (the sun) has an important significance because it emits light and energy. Additionally, the name motivates them to continue illuminating and giving prosperity and constancy to their lives. The group is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members. Patricia is the president of the group. She is 46 years old and only finished high school. She sells wooden boxes in which fruits and vegetables are stored and transported. She is married and has a daughter who is 15. She is recognized by her colleagues for being a responsible person and she has gotten ahead in the face of adversity, being a native of this community, she has been progressing for 18 years. She needs the loan to invest more in her business and to purchase at wholesale boxes for fruit that she sells to fruit and vegetable vendors and that she buys in great quantities for their merchandise. With the earnings, she wishes to continue investing in her business and save for her daughter's education since her great dream is to see her become a professional. Also, she wishes to support her husband with the home expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale boxes for fruit.

loans.name: Mauricio Michael

texts.es:
Mauricio Michel tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Mauricio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como las plagas que dañan alos cultivos. Su sueño es instalar un sistema de riego a los cultivos y seguir estudiando en la universidad.

Le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Mauricio Michel is 20 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Mauricio is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Mauricio is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests which damage his crops.  His dream is to install an irrigation system amongst his crops and continue studying at university.

Mauricio enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Costa Del Sol (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el balneario San Jacinto cada 15 días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Costa Del Sol. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la pesca, servicios y  comercio en general. Ellos hace un tiempo atrás  decidieron unirse  para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y están muy contentos con los beneficios que reciben el grupo con los créditos.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Silvia, tiene 32 años  de edad, es madre soltera tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y en escuela, ella vive sola con sus hijos.

Para llevar la dura carga de criar  a sus tres pequeños hijos desde hace un tiempo atrás ella se dedica a lavar rora ajena, aunque también se gana un dinero extra poniendo inyecciones y sueros pues esto lo aprendió en un curso de enfermería que recibió, nos cuenta que es muy duro el tener que criar sola a sus hijos pero que de alguna manera ha logrado salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo.  Con este crédito ella quiere comprar una lavadora para que le facilite su trabajo ya que se le hace muy difícil lavar cuando la ropa es muy pesada y para lavar forros de asientos de carro que también lo hace para ganarse algo extra.
 
Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crudito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a través de los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son darles un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y que a ellos no les falte nada.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de dos socias que por motivos de fuerza mayor pudieron estar presentes el día que se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Costa del Sol” (Sun Coast) meet every 15 days in the resort town of San Jacinto. They engage in different business activities in the fishing, service, and retail sectors. Some time ago, the members decided to form a group so that they could access the loans provided by Fundación ESPOIR. This is their fourth loan as a Communal Bank and they are very pleased with the benefits and the loans they have received as a group.

One of the group members is Sra. Silvia. She is 32 years old and a single mother with three children (ages 12, 10, and 7) who attend either high school or elementary school. Silvia lives alone with her children.

Left with the difficult task of raising young children, Silvia decided some time ago to provide laundry services for other people. She also earns extra income by administering injections and serums since she learned this skill through a nursing course that she took. Silvia says that it is very hard to raise children by herself, but somehow she has managed to succeed through her effort and work. With this loan, she will buy a washing machine to help make her job easier. It can be difficult to do laundry when the loads of clothing are extremely heavy. Silvia also washes car seat covers in order to earn some extra money.

This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans. Her dreams include providing a better future for her children so that they lack nothing.

The smaller photograph of two of the members appears because, due to reasons beyond their control, they were not able to be present on the day the group photograph was taken.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Yolima de 35 años es la propietaria de “Cosas y cositas Jehová Yirét”, negocio donde  vende prendas de vestir, zapatos y accesorios en la línea masculina y femenina, ella tien una experiencia  de  con 3   y  como propietaria del negocio tiene un año.   Yolima inició su negocio como una gran oportunidad, pues  trabajó primero  como empleada en él,  durante dos años,  y su propietaria  una vez Yolima  tomó las riendas de su manejo le  propuso vendérselo por motivos de viaje y mediante cuotas lo  fue pagando. Sus compras las hace en las ciudades de Bucaramanga y Medellín desde donde las recibe; su negocio funciona   con una  clientela fija y ocasional y especialmente personas del sector, por lo cual está planeando   desarrollar una nueva estrategia de ventas, mediante el plan separe, que consiste en lograr que cada persona pueda con una cuota inicial separar el producto que va a  comprar e irlo pagando hasta que termine, momento en el cual lo recibe.  Yolima  quiere hacer  crecer su negocio y requiere invertir para mejorar el surtido y adecuarlo a las nuevas necesidades de su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios femeninos. Financieramente este negocio presenta estabilidad en sus ventas, pues  son generalmente de contado,  por ello sus activos corrientes están representados en efectivo y cuentas por cobrar;  así como también sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente, lo mismo que sus inventarios, presentando buen manejo de su cartera y   sus niveles de rentabilidad demuestran  buen nivel de solvencia. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio, surtido con lo que necesita su mercado objetivo, y es importante resultar que posee liquidez para responder a sus obligaciones y esto es lo que está aprovechando en este momento.
texts.en: Yolima is 35 years old and he is the owner of a store called "Cosas y Cositas Jehova Yiret". From this business she sells articles of clothing, shoes, and accessories for both men and women. She has 3 years' experience and she has been the owner for the past year. Yoliva started her business as a great opportunity. She started out as an employee, working for the first two years. When Yolima took over the reins, managing the business, the owner was motivated to sell her the business when she was going to relocate. And she bought it by making payments. She makes her purchases in the cities of Bucaramanga and Medellin. Her business operates with a steady client base, passers-by, and especially with the population in the sector. Her plan is to develop a new sales strategy. The plan consists of giving buyers the opportunity to lay way the product they wish to buy with an initial payment. The person can make payments until the full price is met and at that time they receive their product. Yolima wants to expand her business and she wants to invest to improve the selection and to supply it to meet the emerging needs of her clientele. For this reason she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase articles of clothing, shoes, and ladies' accessories. Financially speaking, this burins enjoys steady sales which are generally completed in cash. The current assets represent cash and credit sales. Credit sales are cancelled quickly and her inventory is also sold quickly which speaks to sound business management. Her profit levels demonstrate a good level of solvency. Her goal for the future is to have a store of her own, well stocked with whatever the target market requires. it is important for her to have profitability to be able to respond to her obligations, and it is what she is enjoying at this time.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a resident of and a farmer in the Kisii area in South Rift Kenya. He lives with his family of two children, and practices farming with the help of one farmhand.  He produces a variety of vegetables and beet roots, which he sells to the local market.

Wilfred has made a loan request for 25,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the dairy cow's income will help him improve his family's living standards, educate his youngest child, and further expand his farm in the future.

Wilfred observes that the lack of organised markets is a challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to more bread to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 35, married, and blessed with three children. He has been operating a barbershop to earn a living. He is a focused business man, and has retained his business because of his hard work. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000  Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Mauna

texts.en:
Mauna is a married woman with five school-going children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years; in addition, her husband contributes towards the family expenses. Her potential clients are local area residents. Her major challenge is the cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it enables small-scale entrepreneurs to expand their business through loan lending.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina cuenta con 30 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos que estudian la mayor estudia 2º grado de primaria y yaritza estudia 2º grado del preescolar su esposo se llama Enoc se dedica al campo.

Ella es comerciante tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes y un molino ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de productos como son: aceite, galleta, leche, frijol, papel higiénico, ella dice que le ha ayudado mucho económicamente.   Angelina le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco más.
texts.en:
Angelina, 30, is married and has two children.  The older one is in second grade and Yaritza is in second year of preschool.  Her husband’s name is Enoc and he works in the fields.

She’s a merchant.  She has a small grocery store and mill.  She used the loan to buy products like: oil, cookies, milk, beans and toilet paper.  She says that it’s been of great economic help to her.  Angelina would like her business to grow a bit more.

loans.use: to buy oil, cookies, milk, beans, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо проживает в городе Нурек. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Зебо уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. В городе у нее имеется магазин, где она продает разноцветные нитки, тюбетейки, кошельки, метровые ленты и ткани. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей, детских костюмчиков и платков.
texts.en: Zebo lives in the city of Nurek. She's forty years old, divorced and has two children. She's run a business for the past five years. Zebo owns a store in the city where she sells multicolored thread, skullcaps, wallets, ribbons and cloth. She's asking for a loan in order to buy some fabrics, children's suits and handkerchiefs.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, children's suits and handkerchiefs.
